LNodeType.Details: This LN is introduced in this part to model common issues for physical devices.

DO.name: Proxy
DO.desc: Indicates if this LN is a proxy

DO.name: WacTrg
DO.desc: Number of watchdog device resets detected

DO.name: Sim
DO.desc: Receive simulated GOOSE or simulated SV

LNodeType.Details: The common logical node class provides data objects which are mandatory or conditional to all dedicated LN classes. It contains also data which may be used in all dedicated logical node classes, such as input references and data objects for the statistical calculation methods.

DO.name: Blk
DO.desc: Dynamic blocking of function described by the LN

DO.name: CmdBlk
DO.desc: Blocking of control sequences and action triggers of controllable data objects

DO.name: BlkRef1
DO.desc: Blocking reference shows the receiving of dynamically blocking signal

DO.name: ClcStr
DO.desc: Enables the calculation start at time operTm from the control model (if set) or immediately

DO.name: ClcMth
DO.desc: Calculation method of statistical data objects

DO.name: ClcMod
DO.desc: Calculation mode. Allowed values: TOTAL, PERIOD, SLIDING

DO.name: ClcIntvPer
DO.desc: In case ClcIntvTyp equals to MS, PER-CYCLE, CYCLE, DAY, WEEK, MONTH, YEAR, number of units to consider to calculate the calculation interval duration

DO.name: NumSubIntv
DO.desc: The number of sub-intervals a calculation period interval duration contains

DO.name: ClcRfPer
DO.desc: In case ClcIntvTyp equals to MS, PER-CYCLE, CYCLE, DAY, WEEK, MONTH, YEAR, number of units to consider to calculate the refreshment interval duration

DO.name: ClcSrc
DO.desc: Object reference to source logical node

DO.name: ClcNxTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval - expressed in milliseconds

DO.name: InSyn
DO.desc: Object reference to the source of the external synchronization signal for the calculation interval

LNodeType.Details: This LN shall be used to address common issues for logical devices. For example, LLN0 contains common information for the LD like health, mode and beh and NamPlt.

DO.name: Blk
DO.desc: Dynamic blocking of function described by the LN

DO.name: CmdBlk
DO.desc: Blocking of control sequences and action triggers of controllable data objects

DO.name: BlkRef1
DO.desc: Blocking reference shows the receiving of dynamically blocking signal

DO.name: ClcStr
DO.desc: Enables the calculation start at time operTm from the control model (if set) or immediately

DO.name: ClcMth
DO.desc: Calculation method of statistical data objects

DO.name: ClcMod
DO.desc: Calculation mode. Allowed values: TOTAL, PERIOD, SLIDING

DO.name: ClcIntvPer
DO.desc: In case ClcIntvTyp equals to MS, PER-CYCLE, CYCLE, DAY, WEEK, MONTH, YEAR, number of units to consider to calculate the calculation interval duration

DO.name: NumSubIntv
DO.desc: The number of sub-intervals a calculation period interval duration contains

DO.name: ClcRfPer
DO.desc: In case ClcIntvTyp equals to MS, PER-CYCLE, CYCLE, DAY, WEEK, MONTH, YEAR, number of units to consider to calculate the refreshment interval duration

DO.name: ClcSrc
DO.desc: Object reference to source logical node

DO.name: ClcNxTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval - expressed in milliseconds

DO.name: InSyn
DO.desc: Object reference to the source of the external synchronization signal for the calculation interval

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: Local operation for complete logical device

DO.name: GrRef
DO.desc: Reference to a higher level logical device

DO.name: MltLev
DO.desc: Select mode of authority for local control

LNodeType.Details: This LN is introduced in this part to model common issues for physical communication channels. It is instantiated for each physical channel or each pair of link level redundant physical channels.

DO.name: ChLiv
DO.desc: Physical channel status; true, if channel receives telegrams within a specified time interval.

DO.name: RedChLiv
DO.desc: Physical channel status of redundant channel

DO.name: Fer
DO.desc: Frame error rate on this channel; count of erroneous (or missed, in case of redundancy) messages for each 1 000 messages forwarded to the application.

DO.name: RedFer
DO.desc: Frame error rate on redundant channel; count of missed messages on this channel for each 1 000 messages forwarded to the application.

DO.name: RedRxCnt
DO.desc: Number of received messages on redundant channel

DO.name: ApNam
DO.desc: Access point name to which this channel belongs; only needed, if more than one access point and more than one physical channel exist.

DO.name: ChLivTms
DO.desc: Timeout time for channel live supervision; default 5 s

LNodeType.Details: The LN LGOS shall be used monitoring of GOOSE messages. There shall be one instance of LGOS per GOOSE subscription for a given GOOSE source. It allows for instance to diagnose the subscription state of a GOOSE message.

DO.name: St
DO.desc: Status of the subscription (True = active, False=not active)

DO.name: SimSt
DO.desc: Status showing that really Sim messages are received and accepted

DO.name: GoCBRef
DO.desc: Reference to the subscribed GOOSE control block

LNodeType.Details: The LN LSVS shall be used for diagnose and monitoring supervision of sampled value messages. There shall be one instance of LSVS per SV subscription for a given server. It allows for instance to diagnose the subscription of a SV message (status of subscription).

DO.name: St
DO.desc: Status of the subscription (True = active, False=not active)

DO.name: SimSt
DO.desc: Status showing that really Sim messages are received and accepted

DO.name: SvCBRef
DO.desc: Reference to the subscribed SV control block

LNodeType.Details: The LN LTIM shall be use for diverse configurations regarding the local time of an IED.

DO.name: TmDT
DO.desc: Indicating if for this location daylight saving time is in effect now

DO.name: TmOfsTmm
DO.desc: Offset of local time from UTC in minutes

DO.name: TmUseDT
DO.desc: Flag indicating if this location is using daylight saving time

DO.name: TmChgDayTm
DO.desc: Local time of next change to daylight saving time

DO.name: TmChgStdTm
DO.desc: Local time of next change to standard time

DO.name: StrWeekDay
DO.desc: Day of the start of the local week for statistical calculation (Monday (default) | Tuesday | Wednesday | Thursday | Friday | Saturday | Sunday )

LNodeType.Details: The LN LTMS shall be used for the configuration and supervision of the time synchronization function in an IED.

DO.name: TmAcc
DO.desc: Number of significant bits in the Fraction Of Second in the time accuracy part of the time stamp. See IEC 61850-7-2.

DO.name: TmSrcSet1
DO.desc: Time source setting ("1588" in case the time source is a IEEE 1588 source or dotted IP-address)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used for regulation of suppression coils (ASC / Petersen coil) as tap coils and plunger core coils.

DO.name: StFixCol
DO.desc: Status of external fixcoil (True - fixcoil is connected, False - not connected)

DO.name: StClcTun
DO.desc: Result of tuning: not tuned , tuned, tuned but not compensated, Umax,Umax_nC(Umax- but not compensated), Umax_not compensated due to U continuous limitation

DO.name: MotAlm
DO.desc: Motor drive alarm due to no movement

DO.name: MotWrn
DO.desc: Motor for Petersen coil operating time exceeded

DO.name: ClcSeqWrn
DO.desc: Number of calculation sequence exceeded in automatic/manual mode

DO.name: ColPosA
DO.desc: Coil position (usually as current in Ampere)

DO.name: AWatt
DO.desc: Wattmetric part of the residual current at the fault location

DO.name: ADetun
DO.desc: Detuning due to the actual coil position

DO.name: VolResoPt
DO.desc: Value of the voltage at the resonance point

DO.name: ColTapPos
DO.desc: Move coil to specified discrete coil position

DO.name: ColPos
DO.desc: Move coil to specified continuous coil position

DO.name: ParColMod
DO.desc: Mode of parallel operation of Petersen coil (Master/ Slave | Master/ Slave with fixed slave coil position | Master/ Slave with variable slave coil position | Parallel operation without communication)

DO.name: ParMod
DO.desc: Set current regulator mode during control (master, slave, independent)

DO.name: ADetunSpt
DO.desc: Setpoint for the detuning of the suppression coil

DO.name: BndWid
DO.desc: Band width voltage as voltage or percent of nominal voltage

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used for a reactive controller independent of the control method being used.

DO.name: DschBlk
DO.desc: Bank switch close blocked due to discharge

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN should be used for the automatic wattmetric increase with thermal supervision.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DO.name: TapOpErr
DO.desc: Tap change error or tap indication error (e.g. wrong BCD code)

DO.name: LTCBlkVLo
DO.desc: LTC inhibit due to under voltage

DO.name: LTCBlkVHi
DO.desc: LTC inhibit due to over voltage

DO.name: LTCBlkAHi
DO.desc: LTC inhibit due to over current

DO.name: EndPosR
DO.desc: End position raise or highest allowed tap position reached

DO.name: EndPosL
DO.desc: End position lower or lowest allowed tap position reached

DO.name: PhAng
DO.desc: Phase angle of LodA relative to CtlV at 1.0 power factor, FPF

DO.name: BndCtrChg
DO.desc: Band centre change (raise, lower), no status

DO.name: BndWid
DO.desc: Band width voltage (as voltage or percent of nominal voltage, FPF presumed)

DO.name: LDCR
DO.desc: Line drop voltage due to line resistance component

DO.name: LDCX
DO.desc: Line drop voltage due to line reactance component

DO.name: BlkLV
DO.desc: Control voltage below which auto lower commands blocked

DO.name: BlkRV
DO.desc: Control voltage above which auto raise commands blocked

DO.name: BlkVLo
DO.desc: Control voltage below which auto raise commands are blocked

DO.name: BlkVHi
DO.desc: Control voltage above which auto lower commands are blocked

DO.name: LimLodA
DO.desc: Limit load current (LTC block load current)

DO.name: LDC
DO.desc: Line drop compensation is R and X or Z model

DO.name: TmDlChr
DO.desc: Time delay linear or inverse characteristic

DO.name: LDCZ
DO.desc: Line impedance for line drop compensation

DO.name: VRedVal
DO.desc: Reduction of band centre (percent) when voltage reduction step is active

DO.name: TapBlkR
DO.desc: Tap position of load tap changer where automatic raise commands are blocked

DO.name: TapBlkL
DO.desc: Tap position of load tap changer where automatic lower commands are blocked

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used for a voltage controller independent of the control method being used.

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. CALH allows the creation of group warnings, group indications and group alarms. The individual alarms, which are used to calculate the group indications/alarms/warnings, are subscribed from elsewhere. The calculation is a local issue, usually performed by a logic scheme.
This LN class shall be used to control the cooling equipment. One instance per cooling group shall be used.

DO.name: CETmpIn
DO.desc: Temperature of secondary cooling medium in

DO.name: CETmpOut
DO.desc: Temperature of secondary cooling medium out

DO.name: CECtl
DO.desc: Control of complete cooling group (pumps and fans)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used to "enable" a switching operation if the interlocking conditions are fulfilled. One instance per switching device is needed. At least all related switchgear positions have to be subscribed. The interlocking algorithm is a local issue.

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used if the circuit breaker is able to perform point-on-wave switching. In this case, the start signal for CPOW is OpOpn or OpCls to be subscribed from CSWI. Then CPOW shall perform its entire dedicated algorithm using data objects from the allocated TCTR or local and remote TVTR (local issue) and shall then release a "Time Activated Control" (see IEC 61850-7-2) to XCBR. OpOpn and OpCls shall be used if no "Time Activated Control" services is available between CPOW and XCBR. Alternatively, CPOW may be started by a control service acting on data object Pos.

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN class shall be used to control all switching conditions above process level. CSWI shall subscribe the data object POWCap ("point-on-wave switching capability") from XCBR if applicable. If a switching command (for example Select-before-Operate) arrives and "point-on-wave switching capability" is supported by the breaker, the command shall be passed to CPOW. OpOpn and OpCls shall be used if no Control Service is available between CSWI and XCBR (see GSE in IEC 61850-7-2).
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN class shall be used to control the synchronizing conditions i.e. voltage, frequency and phase.

DO.name: RelDeaBus
DO.desc: Releasing dead bus / dead line function

DO.name: DlSynTmms
DO.desc: Delay of synchronization process after start signal

LNodeType.Details: Logical node FCNT shall be used to count incoming pulses not related to the electrical network

Logical node FCSD shall comprise the data object classes that represent curve shaped output values. The values can be dynamically modified online. The curves entered in the table can be based on statistics obtained following a series of index tests. The logical node is used to adapt an incoming value to a specified curve function. For example, it can be used 2-dimensionally to adjust nonlinear transmitters to the correct physical values or, by instantiation, can be used for 3-dimensional surface mapping.
Logical node FFIL shall be used to filter an incoming value. For a more detailed description of the functionality behind FFIL, see Annex A of IEC 61850-7-410.
This logical node is used to set temporary or permanent operational limits to an output signal (MV) from a control function. The FLIM logical node should not be used to replace FXOT or FXUT.

DO.name: HiLim
DO.desc: High limit reached (input signal equal to or above limit)

DO.name: LoLim
DO.desc: Low limit reached (input signal equal to or below limit)

LNodeType.Details: Logical node FPID shall comprise the data objects classes that represent proportional, integral and derivative information for a PID controller. For a more detailed description of the functionality behind FPID, see Annex E.

DO.name: Droop
DO.desc: Percent change in effective setpoint at maximum action

LNodeType.Details: Logical node FRMP shall be used as a generic ramp. The LN is required due to the fact that the data object attributes of the ASG common data class do not contain all of the information required to achieve a full ramping function with divergent up and down trends.

DO.name: RmpUp
DO.desc: Ramping rate on a upward trend

DO.name: RmpDn
DO.desc: Ramping rate on a downward trend

DO.name: StepPs
DO.desc: Step size when turning from negative to positive direction

DO.name: StepNg
DO.desc: Step size when turning from positive to negative direction

LNodeType.Details: Logical node FSPT shall be used to provide the common characteristics found in all controller or regulator type logical nodes. The LN can be standalone or cascaded with other logical nodes to form a complete controller.

Logical node FXOT shall be used to set a high-level threshold value to be used in control sequences. If a second level is necessary, a second instance can be modelled. FXOT can typically be used whenever a protection, control or alarm function is based on other physical measurements than primary electrical data.

Logical node FXUT shall be used to set a low-level threshold value to be used in control sequences. If a second level is necessary, a second instance can be modelled. FXUT can typically be used whenever a protection, control or alarm function is based on other physical measurements than primary electric data.

This node shall be used only to model in a generic way the processing/automation of functions that are not predefined by one of the groups A, C, M, P, or R. If needed, all data objects listed in Clause 6 of this standard can be used single or multiple for a dedicated application of LN GAPC. Data objects with proper semantic meaning should be preferred. The extension rules according to IEC 61850-7-1, Clause 14 shall be followed.

This node shall be used only to model in a generic way process devices that are not predefined by the groups S, T, X, Y, or Z. If needed, all data objects listed in Clause 6 can be used single or multiple for a dedicated application of LN GGIO. Data objects with proper semantic meaning should be preferred. The extension rules according to IEC 61850-7-1, Clause 14 shall be followed.

The LN GLOG refers to a function which allows to log not only changed data itself but also any related data being defined in the settings of LN GLOG. The logging is started by the changed data object (TrgRef1) or by the operator (LogTrg). The logged data are identified by the references to the related source data objects in the data model.

DO.name: TrgRef1
DO.desc: Trigger reference shows the receiving trigger signal

DO.name: InRef1
DO.desc: Reference to data objects / data attributes to include in LOG according to IEC 61850-7-2, when the configured trigger was active

LNodeType.Details: This node shall be used to monitor security violations regarding authorisation, access control, service privileges and inactive associations.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. Logical node ISAF shall be used to represent an alarm push-button or any other device that is used to provide an alarm in case of danger to persons or property.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. The LN ITPC comprises all information for communication channel setting and supervision. ITPC is not intended to generate direct process data objects. Thus, it does not contain the input and output data objects to be transmitted and it has no "operate" data objects object.

DO.name: GrdRxCmdRx
DO.desc: Alarm situation: Guard received together with the command, may indicate interference on the channel. Used in case of an analogue communication channel.

DO.name: LosSig
DO.desc: Alarm situation: No signal received, indicates a channel problem

DO.name: TxCmdCnt1
DO.desc: For diagnostics: Transmitted commands counters (for each command)

DO.name: RxCmdCnt1
DO.desc: For diagnostics: Received commands counters (for each command)

DO.name: LosSyn
DO.desc: Alarm situation: Loss of synchronism. Indicates that there is no synchronization between the transmitter and the receiver, i.e., no communication is possible. Used in case of a digital communication channel.

DO.name: Ber
DO.desc: Bit error rate of the communication channel. Used in case of a digital communication channel

DO.name: Fer
DO.desc: Frame error rate of the communication channel. Used in case of a digital communication channel. May be vendor specific

DO.name: CarLev
DO.desc: Power of received signal in case of an analogue communication channel

DO.name: Snr
DO.desc: Signal to noise ratio (in dB), used in case of analogue communication

DO.name: LoopTestTm
DO.desc: Time measured at last loop test

DO.name: NumTxCmd
DO.desc: Number of used binary transmit commands

DO.name: NumRxCmd
DO.desc: Number of used binary receive commands

DO.name: TpcTxMod1
DO.desc: Teleprotection application mode in transmit direction for each command (Unused, Blocking, Permissive, Direct, Unblocking, Status)

DO.name: TpcRxMod1
DO.desc: Teleprotection application mode in receive direction for each command (Unused, Blocking, Permissive, Direct, Unblocking, Status)

DO.name: SecTmms
DO.desc: Pickup security timer on loss of carrier guard signal: if a command is received within SecTmms after the guard has disappeared, this command is considered valid, used in case of an analogue communication channel.

DO.name: BstRat
DO.desc: Level of increased power during the transmission of a command in dB. Used in case of an analogue communication channel

DO.name: TxPwr
DO.desc: Transmit power (peak envelope power) in dBm. Used in case of an analogue communication channel

DO.name: TxCtrHz
DO.desc: Transmit center frequency. Used in case of an analogue communication channel

DO.name: RxCtrHz
DO.desc: Receive center frequency. Used in case of an analogue communication channel

DO.name: TxBndWid
DO.desc: Transmit bandwidth. Used in case of an analogue communication channel

DO.name: RxBndWid
DO.desc: Receive bandwidth. Used in case of an analogue communication channel

LNodeType.Details: FLogical node KFAN shall be used to represent a fan. It can be seen as an extended nameplate that allows the temporary setting of data object.

DO.name: SpdSpt
DO.desc: Speed set-point (in case of speed regulated motor)

LNodeType.Details: Logical node KFIL shall be used to represent a (mechanical) filter. It can be seen as an extended nameplate that allows the temporary setting of data object.

DO.name: ACAlm
DO.desc: AC supply failure (fuse or other problem)

LNodeType.Details: Logical node KPMP shall be used to represent a pump. It can be seen as an extended nameplate that allows the temporary setting of data objects.

DO.name: SpdSpt
DO.desc: Speed set-point (in case of speed regulated motor)

LNodeType.Details: Logical node KTNK shall be used to represent the physical device of a tank, such as a hydraulic oil tank. The tank can be pressurised or not. If used to represent a tank for pressurised gas, only the pressure MV will be used. If used for an oil sump, only the level MV will be used. For a simple level sensor, the SLVL logical node can be used instead.

DO.name: LevPct
DO.desc: Level in the tank (as percentage of full tank level)

DO.name: TnkTyp
DO.desc: Type of data representing the tank fill status (pressure only, level only, both pressure and level)

LNodeType.Details: Logical node KVLV shall be used to represent a valve or gate where the position can be given as a percentage of full open position (optionally, the angle 0-90 may be used). In case of dam gates where either open or closed position depends on the water level of the dam, the HGTE LN should be used.

DO.name: ClsPos
DO.desc: Closed end position reached (valve cannot move further)

DO.name: OpnPos
DO.desc: Open end position reached (valve cannot move further)

DO.name: Stuck
DO.desc: Valve is blocked (cannot move from present position)

DO.name: Flw
DO.desc: Calculated liquid flow through the valve

DO.name: Pos
DO.desc: Valve to full open or closed position

DO.name: OpnLim
DO.desc: Opening limit of valve position (temporary restriction)

DO.name: ClsLim
DO.desc: Closing limit of valve position (temporary restriction)

DO.name: Incr
DO.desc: Increment of position change for open / close commands

LNodeType.Details: Logical node MENV shall be used for modelling the characteristics of environmental conditions such as emissions, and other key environmental data objects. In addition, many of the environmental sensors may be located remotely from the instantiated logical node. This logical node may therefore represent a collection of environmental information from many sources. It does, however, not include basic meteorological and hydrological data objects. For such information, see MHYD and MMET logical node classes.
This LN shall be used for calculation of flicker inducing voltage fluctuations according to IEC 61000-4-15. The main use is for operative applications.

DO.name: PPPst
DO.desc: Short-term flicker severity of last complete interval for phase to phase measurements

DO.name: PhPst
DO.desc: Short-term flicker severity of last complete interval for phase to ground measurements

DO.name: PPPlt
DO.desc: Long-term flicker severity of last complete interval for phase to phase measurements

DO.name: PhPlt
DO.desc: Long-term flicker severity of last complete interval for phase to ground measurements

DO.name: PPPiMax
DO.desc: Output 5 - Instantaneous peak P value for phase to phase measurements

DO.name: PhPiMax
DO.desc: Output 5 - Instantaneous peak P value for phase to ground measurements

DO.name: PPPiLoFil
DO.desc: Output 4 - 1 min average of output 5 for phase to phase measurements

DO.name: PhPiLoFil
DO.desc: Output 4 - 1 min average of output 5 for phase to ground measurements

DO.name: PPPiRoot
DO.desc: Output 3 - Square root of output 5 for phase to phase measurements

DO.name: PhPiRoot
DO.desc: Output 3 - Square root of output 5 for phase to ground measurements

DO.name: PPPcbLs
DO.desc: Classifier bins of last complete short interval for phase to phase (AB, BC, CA)

DO.name: PhPcbLs
DO.desc: Classifier bins of last complete short interval for phase to ground (A, B, C)

DO.name: PPPcbLs
DO.desc: Classifier bins of last complete long interval for phase to phase (AB, BC, CA)

DO.name: PPPcbLl
DO.desc: Classifier bins of last complete long interval for phase to ground (A, B, C)

DO.name: PPPdmWav
DO.desc: Real time demodulated waveform for phase to phase (AB, BC, CA)

DO.name: PhPdmWav
DO.desc: Real time demodulated waveform for phase to ground (A, B, C)

DO.name: PPPdmSpec
DO.desc: Real time demodulated waveform spectra for phase to phase (AB, BC, CA)

DO.name: PhPdmSpec
DO.desc: Real time demodulated waveform spectra for phase to ground (A, B, C)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used for calculation of harmonics or interharmonics in a three-phase system. Instances either for harmonics (including subharmonics and multiples) or interharmonics are possible depending on the value of the basic settings, i.e.: - frequency f ("Hz"); - evaluation window DeltaT ("EvTmms"). The frequency may either be given (HzSet) or calculated (Hz). Both harmonics and interharmonics carry power and produce distortions. There are different methods to calculate disturbances. For more information and definitions, see IEC 61000-4-7 (2002), IEEE 519-1992, and IEEE 1459-2000.

DO.name: HA
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics current

DO.name: HPhV
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics phase to ground voltages

DO.name: HPPV
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics phase to phase voltages

DO.name: HW
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics active power

DO.name: HVAr
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics reactive power

DO.name: HVA
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics apparent power

DO.name: HRmsA
DO.desc: Current RMS harmonic or interharmonics (un-normalized total harmonic distortion, Thd)

DO.name: HRmsPhV
DO.desc: Voltage RMS harmonic or interharmonics (un-normalized Thd) for phase to ground

DO.name: HRmsPPV
DO.desc: Voltage RMS harmonic or interharmonics (un-normalized Thd) for phase to phase

DO.name: HTuW
DO.desc: Total phase harmonic or interharmonics active power (no fundamental) unsigned sum

DO.name: HTsW
DO.desc: Total phase harmonic or interharmonic active power (no fundamental) signed sum

DO.name: ThdA
DO.desc: Current total harmonic or interharmonic distortion (different methods)

DO.name: ThdOddA
DO.desc: Current total harmonic or interharmonic distortion (different methods - odd components)

DO.name: ThdEvnA
DO.desc: Current total harmonic or interharmonic distortion (different methods - even components)

DO.name: TddA
DO.desc: Current total demand distortion per IEEE 519

DO.name: TddOddA
DO.desc: Current total demand distortion per IEEE 519 (odd components)

DO.name: TddEvnA
DO.desc: Current total demand distortion per IEEE 519 (even components)

DO.name: ThdPhV
DO.desc: Voltage total harmonic or Interharmonic Distortion (different methods) for phase to ground

DO.name: ThdOddPhV
DO.desc: Voltage total harmonic or interharmonic distortion (different methods) for phase to ground (odd components)

DO.name: ThdEvnPhV
DO.desc: Voltage total harmonic or interharmonic distortion (different methods) for phase to ground (even components)

DO.name: ThdPPV
DO.desc: Voltage total harmonic or interharmonic distortion (different methods) for phase to phase

DO.name: ThdOddPPV
DO.desc: Voltage total harmonic or interharmonic distortion (different methods) for phase to phase (odd components)

DO.name: ThdEvnPPV
DO.desc: Voltage total harmonic or interharmonic distortion (different methods) for phase to phase (even components)

DO.name: HCfPhV
DO.desc: Voltage crest factors (peak waveform value/sqrt(2)/fundamental) forphase to ground

DO.name: HCfPPV
DO.desc: Voltage crest factors (peak waveform value/sqrt(2)/fundamental) for phase to phase

DO.name: EvTmms
DO.desc: Evaluation time (time window) determines the lowest frequency

DO.name: NumCyc
DO.desc: Number of cycles of the basic frequency

DO.name: ThdAVal
DO.desc: ThdA alarm setting - value entered in %

DO.name: ThdVVal
DO.desc: ThdPhV / ThdPPV alarm setting - value entered in %

DO.name: ThdATmms
DO.desc: ThdA alarm time delay in ms

DO.name: ThdVTmms
DO.desc: ThdPhV / ThdPPV alarm time delay in ms

DO.name: NomA
DO.desc: Normalising demand current used in IEEE 519 TDD calculation

LNodeType.Details: This LN shall be used for calculation of harmonics or interharmonics in a single-phase system, i.e. a single line with no phase relations. Instances either for harmonics (including subharmonics and multiples) or interharmonics are possible depending on the value of the basic settings, i.e.: - frequency f ("Hz"); - evaluation window DeltaT ("EvTmms"). The frequency may either be given or calculated by means such as a phase-locked loop (only possible for a dominant frequency like the basic power frequency). For the settings for harmonics and interharmonics instances, see MHAI.

DO.name: HaAmp
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics for current

DO.name: HaVol
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics for voltages

DO.name: HaWatt
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics for active power

DO.name: HaVolAmpr
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics for reactive power

DO.name: HaVolAmp
DO.desc: Sequence of harmonics or interharmonics for apparent power

DO.name: HaRmsAmp
DO.desc: Current RMS harmonic or interharmonic (un-normalized Thd)

DO.name: HaRmsVol
DO.desc: Voltage RMS harmonic or interharmonic (un-normalized Thd)

DO.name: HaTuWatt
DO.desc: Total harmonic or interharmonic active power (no fundamental) unsigned sum

DO.name: HaTsWatt
DO.desc: Total harmonic or interharmonic active power (no fundamental) signed sum

DO.name: ThdAmp
DO.desc: Current total harmonic or Interharmonic distortion (different methods)

DO.name: ThdOddAmp
DO.desc: Current total harmonic or Interharmonic distortion (different methods - odd components)

DO.name: ThdEvnAmp
DO.desc: Current total harmonic or interharmonic distortion (different methods - even components)

DO.name: TddAmp
DO.desc: Current total demand distortion per IEEE 519

DO.name: TddOddAmp
DO.desc: Current total demand distortion per IEEE 519 (odd components)

DO.name: TddEvnAmp
DO.desc: Current total demand distortion per IEEE 519 (even components)

DO.name: ThdVol
DO.desc: Voltage total harmonic or Interharmonic distortion (different methods)

DO.name: ThdOddVol
DO.desc: Voltage total harmonic or interharmonic distortion (different methods - odd components)

DO.name: ThdEvnVol
DO.desc: Voltage total harmonic or Interharmonic distortion (different methodseven components)

DO.name: EvTmms
DO.desc: Evaluation time (time window) determines the lowest frequency

DO.name: NumCyc
DO.desc: Number of cycles of the basic frequency

DO.name: ThdAVal
DO.desc: ThdA alarm setting - value entered in %

DO.name: ThdVVal
DO.desc: ThdV alarm setting - value entered in %

DO.name: ThdATmms
DO.desc: ThdA alarm time delay in ms

DO.name: ThdVTmms
DO.desc: ThdV alarm time delay in ms

DO.name: NomA
DO.desc: Normalising demand current used in IEEE 519 TDD calculation

LNodeType.Details: Logical node MHYD shall comprise the data objects that represent hydrological information such as river, lake, pond, or oceanic water related information. This logical node may represent a collection of meteorological information from many sources.
Logical node MMDC shall be used to represent measurements in a DC system: current, voltage, power and resistance.

DO.name: VolPsGnd
DO.desc: Voltage between positive pole and earth

DO.name: VolNgGnd
DO.desc: Voltage between negative pole and earth

DO.name: RisPsGnd
DO.desc: Resistance between positive pole and earth

DO.name: RisNgGnd
DO.desc: Resistance between negative pole and earth

LNodeType.Details: Logical node MMET shall comprise the data objects that represent meteorological information. The data objects as shown in the following table focus on meteorological station information. MMET may in reality represent a collection of meteorological information from many sources, that is, from sensors located at different places.

DO.name: DlDur
DO.desc: Daylight duration (time elapsed between sunrise and sunset)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used for calculation of energy in a single-phase system. The main use is for billing purposes.

DO.name: SupWh
DO.desc: Real energy supply (default supply direction: energy flow towards busbar)

DO.name: SupVArh
DO.desc: Reactive energy supply (default supply direction: energy flow towards busbar)

DO.name: DmdWh
DO.desc: Real energy demand (default demand direction: energy flow from busbar away)

DO.name: DmdVArh
DO.desc: Reactive energy demand (default demand direction: energy flow from busbar away

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used for calculation of energy in a three-phase system. The main use is for billing purposes.

DO.name: SupWh
DO.desc: Real energy supply (default supply direction: energy flow towards busbar)

DO.name: SupVArh
DO.desc: Reactive energy supply (default supply direction: energy flow towards busbar)

DO.name: DmdWh
DO.desc: Real energy demand (default demand direction: energy flow from busbar away)

DO.name: DmdVArh
DO.desc: Reactive energy demand (default demand direction: energy flow from busbar away

LNodeType.Details: This LN shall be used for calculation of currents, voltages, powers and impedances in a singlephase system, i.e. in a system where voltages and currents are not phase-related. The main use is for operative applications.

DO.name: Amp
DO.desc: Current I not allocated to a phase

DO.name: Vol
DO.desc: Voltage V not allocated to a phase

DO.name: Watt
DO.desc: Power (P) not allocated to a phase

DO.name: VolAmpr
DO.desc: Reactive power (Q) not allocated to a phase

DO.name: VolAmp
DO.desc: Apparent power (S) not allocated to a phase

DO.name: PwrFact
DO.desc: Power factor not allocated to a phase

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used for calculation of currents, voltages, powers and impedances in a three-phase system. The main use is for operative applications.

DO.name: AvAPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of current of the 3 phases. Average(Ia,Ib,Ic)

DO.name: AvPPVPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of phase to phase voltage of the 3 phases. Average(PPVa, PPVb, PPVc)

DO.name: AvPhVPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of phase to reference voltage of the 3 phases. Average(PhVa, PhVb, PhVc)

DO.name: AvWPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of active power of the 3 phases. Average(Wa, Wb, Wc)

DO.name: AvVAPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of apparent power of the 3 phases. Average(VAa, VAb, VAc)

DO.name: AvVArPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of reactive power of the 3 phases. Average(VAra, VArb, VArc)

DO.name: AvPFPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of power factor of the 3 phases. Average(PFa, PFb, PFc)

DO.name: AvZPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of impedance of the 3 phases. Average(Za, Zb, Zc)

DO.name: MaxAPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of current of the 3 phases. Max(Ia,Ib,Ic)

DO.name: MaxPPVPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of phase to phase voltage of the 3 phases. Max(PPVa, PPVb, PPVc)

DO.name: MaxPhVPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of phase to reference voltage of the 3 phases. Max(PhVa, PhVb, PhVc)

DO.name: MaxWPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of active power of the 3 phases. Max(Wa, Wb, Wc)

DO.name: MaxVAPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of apparent power of the 3 phases. Max(VAa, VAb, VAc)

DO.name: MaxVArPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of reactive power of the 3 phases. Max(VAra, VArb, VArc)

DO.name: MaxPFPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of power factor of the 3 phases. Max(PFa, PFb, PFc)

DO.name: MaxZPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of impedance of the 3 phases. Max(Za, Zb, Zc)

DO.name: MinAPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of current of the 3 phases. Min(Ia,Ib,Ic)

DO.name: MinPPVPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of phase to phase voltage of the 3 phases. Min(PPVa, PPVb, PPVc)

DO.name: MinPhVPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of phase to reference voltage of the 3 phases. Min(PhVa, PhVb, PhVc)

DO.name: MinWPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of active power of the 3 phases. Min(Wa, Wb, Wc)

DO.name: MinVAPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of apparent power of the 3 phases. Min(VAra, VArb, VArc)

DO.name: MinVArPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of reactive power of the 3 phases. Min(VAra, VArb, VArc)

DO.name: MinPFPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of power factor of the 3 phases. Min(PFa, PFb, PFc)

DO.name: MinZPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of impedance of the 3 phases. Min(Za, Zb, Zc)

DO.name: ClcTotVA
DO.desc: Calculation method used for total apparent power (TotVA)

DO.name: PFSign
DO.desc: Sign convention for VAr and power factor (PF)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DO.name: SeqA
DO.desc: Positive, negative and zero sequence current

DO.name: SeqV
DO.desc: Positive, negative and zero sequence voltage

LNodeType.Details: This LN shall be used for all kinds of current differential protection. Proper current samples for the dedicated application shall be subscribed.

DO.name: LoSet
DO.desc: Low operate value, percentage of the nominal current

DO.name: HiSet
DO.desc: High operate value, percentage of the nominal current

LNodeType.Details: The operate decision is based on an agreement of the fault direction signals from all directional fault sensors (for example directional relays) surrounding the fault. The directional comparison for lines is made with PSCH.

DO.name: Str
DO.desc: Start (appearance of the first related fault direction)

DO.name: Op
DO.desc: Operate (decision from all sensors that the surrounded object is faulted)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. The phase start value and ground start value are minimum thresholds to release the impedance measurements depending on the distance function characteristic given by the algorithm and defined by the settings. The settings replace the data object curve as used for the characteristic on some other protection LNs. One instance of PDIS per zone shall be used.

DO.name: PoRch
DO.desc: Polar Reach is the diameter of the Mho diagram

DO.name: PhDlTmms
DO.desc: Operate Time Delay for Multiphase Faults

DO.name: GndDlMod
DO.desc: Operate Time Delay for Single Phase Ground Mode

DO.name: GndDlTmms
DO.desc: Operate Time Delay for single phase ground faults

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PDPR). This LN shall be used for thev overpower part of PDPR. Additionally, PDOP is used to model a reverse overpower function (IEEE device function number 32R, from IEEE C37.2:1996) when the DirMod is set to reverse.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PDPR). This LN shall be used for the underpower part of PDPR.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PFRQ). This LN shall be used to model the rate of frequency change of PFRQ. One instance shall be used per stage.

This LN shall be used to represent the harmonic restraint data object of the transformer differential protection (see PDIF) in a dedicated node. There may be multiple instantiations of this LN with different settings, especially with different data object HaRst.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used for high-impedance isolation faults only.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used for instantaneous overcurrent protection only.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PMSU). This LN shall be used to model in a dedicated LN the part from LN PMSU which protects a motor against thermal overload during start-up.

DO.name: MaxNumStr
DO.desc: Maximum number of starts (also for cold starts)

DO.name: MaxWrmStr
DO.desc: Maximum warm starts, permissible number of warm starts

DO.name: MaxStrTmm
DO.desc: Time period for the maximum number of starts

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PMSU). This LN shall be used to model from LN PMSU the part which protects a motor against excessive starting time/locked rotor during start-up in a dedicated LN.

DO.name: MotStr
DO.desc: Motor startup (current pickup value of motor starting)

DO.name: LokRotTms
DO.desc: Lock rotor time, permissible locked rotor time

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PPFR). This LN shall be used for the over power factor part of PPFR.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This function shall be used to model "out-ofstep" protection of generators.

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. Logical Node PRTR shall be used to represent a field short-circuit protection using the 6th harmonic (300 Hz). The protection is normally included in the excitation system.

This LN shall be used to model the logic scheme for line protection function co-ordination. The protection scheme allows the exchange of the "operate" outputs of different protection functions and conditions for line protection schemes. It includes data objects for teleprotection if applicable. In this case, all appropriate data objects shall be subscribed.

DO.name: TxPrm
DO.desc: Permissive information to be transmitted to the other side (teleprotection permissive signal)

DO.name: TxBlk
DO.desc: Blocking information to be transmitted to the other side (teleprotection blocking signal)

DO.name: TxTr
DO.desc: Direct trip information to be transmitted to the other side

DO.name: RxPrm1
DO.desc: Activation information RxPrm1 received from the other side(s), for logging purposes (teleprotection permissive signal received)

DO.name: RxBlk1
DO.desc: Activation information RxBlk1 received from the other side(s), for logging purposes (teleprotection blocking signal received)

DO.name: RxTr1
DO.desc: Activation information RxTr1 received from the other side(s), for logging purposes (direct trip signal received)

DO.name: EchoWei
DO.desc: TxPrm is being sent as echo signal or in case of weak end infeed

DO.name: EchoWeiOp
DO.desc: Additional indication that Op is the operate from the weak end infeed or echo function (typically with undervoltage control)

DO.name: RxSrc1
DO.desc: Source for activation information RxPrm or RxBlk, must refer to data of type ACT

DO.name: RxSrcTr1
DO.desc: Source for activation information RxTr, must refer to data of type ACT

DO.name: DurTmms
DO.desc: Minimum duration of TxPerm in case of operate of PSCH

DO.name: UnBlkMod
DO.desc: Unblock function mode for scheme type

DO.name: WeiMod
DO.desc: Mode of weak end infeed function

DO.name: WeiTmms
DO.desc: Co-ordination time for weak end infeed function

LNodeType.Details: For a general description of directed earth fault protection, see IEC 61850-5. This LN is used for directional earthfault handling in compensated and isolated networks. The use of "operate" is optional and depends both on protection philosophy and on instrument transformer capabilities. For compensated networks, this function is often called wattmetric directional earthfault. The very high accuracy needed for fault current measurement in compensated networks may require phase angle compensation. This shall be realised by the related LN TCTR.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used to detect ("start") transient earth fault in compensated networks.
Logical node PTHF shall be used to represent a thyristor (thyristor valve) protection. In a power plant, this protection will typically be included in the excitation system.

DO.name: Op
DO.desc: Operate (trips both field CB and generator CB)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PTOC). This LN shall also be used to model the directional time overcurrent (PDOC/IEEE device function number 67, from IEEE C37.2:1996). The Definite Time overcurrent (also PTOC/IEEE device function number 51, from IEEE C37.2:1996) shall be modelled by use of PTOC and selecting the related curve.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PFRQ). This LN shall be used to model the overfrequency part of PFRQ. One instance shall be used per stage.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. For some applications such as transformer starpoint or delta supervision, "operate" may not be used.

This LN shall be used to connect the "operate" outputs of one or more protection functions to a common "trip" to be transmitted to XCBR. In addition, or alternatively, any combination of "operate" outputs of the protection functions may be combined to a new "operate" of PTRC.

DO.name: Op
DO.desc: Operate (combination of subscribed Op from protection functions)

DO.name: Str
DO.desc: Start (combination of subscribed Str from protection functions)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LNs PROL, PSOL). PTTR shall be used for all thermal overload functions. Depending on the algorithm, the LN describes either a temperature or a current (thermal model). Temperature data objects are also provided by other LNs. Examples are the hot spot temperature in LN YPTR or the isolation gas temperature in LN SIMG.

DO.name: BlkThm
DO.desc: Block closing command for circuit breaker because of thermal condition

DO.name: TmpRl
DO.desc: Relation between temperature and maximum temperature

DO.name: TmACrv
DO.desc: Characteristic curve for current measurement /Thermal model

DO.name: ConsTms
DO.desc: Time constant of the thermal model

DO.name: DropoutVal
DO.desc: Dropout value for blocking closing command

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PUCP). This LN shall be used for the undercurrent part of PUCP. The underpower part of LN PUCP is covered by PDUP. Different instances shall be used for phase and ground.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PFRQ). This LN shall be used to model the nderfrequency part of PFRQ. One instance shall be used per stage.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. With an appropriate low operating curve, PTUV works also as zero voltage relay.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5 (LN PPFR). This LN shall be used for the underpower factor part of PPFR.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DO.name: AVCrv
DO.desc: Operating curve type (for voltage controlled current curve)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. One instance of PVPH shall be used per protection stage.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DO.name: VarStr
DO.desc: Start of the frequency variation event

DO.name: HzVaTm
DO.desc: Frequency variation duration of the last completed event

DO.name: HzVaMag
DO.desc: Frequency variation magnitude of the last completed event

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DO.name: VVa
DO.desc: Voltage variation magnitude of the last completed event

DO.name: VVaTm
DO.desc: Voltage variation duration of the last completed event

LNodeType.Details: In addition to the channel number, all attributes needed for the COMTRADE file (IEEE C37.111:1999) are provided either by data objects from the TVTR or TCTR or by attributes of the measured value (samples subscribed from TVTR or TCTR) itself or by data objects from pseudo channels (calculated values, derived values of power quality devices). The "circuit component" and "phase identification" is provided by the instance identification of the LN RADR. Channels "1" to "n" are created by "1" to "n" instances.

DO.name: TrgMod
DO.desc: Trigger mode (internal trigger, external or both)

DO.name: SrcRef
DO.desc: Reference to the IEC 61850 source data object

LNodeType.Details: In addition to the channel number, all attributes needed for the COMTRADE file (IEEE C37.111:1999) are provided by attributes of the binary input (subscribed from another LN). The "circuit component" and "phase identification" is provided by the instance identification of the LN RBDR. Channels "1" to "n" are created by "1" to "n" instances.

DO.name: TrgMod
DO.desc: Trigger mode (internal trigger, external or both)

DO.name: SrcRef
DO.desc: Reference to the IEC 61850 source data object

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DO.name: FailTmms
DO.desc: Breaker failure time delay for bus bar trip

LNodeType.Details: This LN shall be used to represent all directional data objects in a dedicated LN used for directional relay settings. The protection function itself is modelled by the dedicated protection LN. LN RDIR may be used with functions 21, 32 or 67 according to IEEE device function number designation.

DO.name: MinFwdAng
DO.desc: Minimum phase angle in forward direction

DO.name: MinRvAng
DO.desc: Minimum phase angle in reverse direction

DO.name: MaxFwdAng
DO.desc: Maximum phase angle in forward direction

DO.name: MaxRvAng
DO.desc: Maximum phase angle in reverse direction

LNodeType.Details: For consistent modelling, the disturbance recorder function described as a requirement in IEC 61850-5 is decomposed into one LN class for analogue channels (RADR) and another LN class for binary channels (RBDR). The output refers to the "IEEE Standard Format for transient data exchange (COMTRADE) for power systems" (see IEEE C37.111:1999). Disturbance recorders are logical devices built up with one instance of LN RADR or LN RBDR per channel. Since the content of logical devices (LD) are not standardised, other LNs may be inside the LD "disturbance recorder" if applicable. All enabled channels are included in the recording, independently of the trigger mode (TrgMod).

DO.name: MemRs
DO.desc: Reset recorder memory (set the pointer of memory start to the beginning)

DO.name: MemClr
DO.desc: Clear memory (erase all content of the memory)

DO.name: TrgMod
DO.desc: Trigger mode (internal trigger, external or both)

DO.name: StoRte
DO.desc: Storage rate, i.e. sampling rate of the disturbance recorder

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall handle the disturbance records acquired by some local function. This LN is normally located at station level.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. In case of a fault, the fault location is calculated in ohm.

This LN shall be used to provide locally calculated process values (phasors calculated out of samples or the samples itself) representing the local current values which are sent to the remote end and which are used for the local differential protection function (PDIF). Therefore, the LN RMXU together with LN PDIF models the core functionality of the differential protection function number 87 according to the IEEE designation (C37.2). In addition, the LNs RMXU on both sides of the line represents also the function to synchronize the samples. Therefore, also the samples sent from the local TCTR to the local PDIF are routed through the function represented by RMXU. The local RMXU is therefore the source of synchronized samples or phasors from the local current sensor, which sends its information to the local PDIF and to all required remote PDIF nodes.

DO.name: ALoc
DO.desc: Current (phasor) of the local current measurement

DO.name: AmpLocPhsA
DO.desc: Current (sampled value) of the local current measurement (phase L1)

DO.name: AmpLocPhsB
DO.desc: Current (sampled value) of the local current measurement (phase L2)

DO.name: AmpLocPhsC
DO.desc: Current (sampled value) of the local current measurement (phase L3)

DO.name: AmpLocRes
DO.desc: Current (sampled value) of the local current measurement (residual current)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. The power swing is characterised by slow periodic changing of measured impedance. Such a moderate impedance change is tolerated, but may result in tripping of the distance protection function. If the generator is out of step (pole slipping), transient changes of impedance (one per slip) are measured. After a small number of slips (MaxNumSlp) in a dedicated time window (EvTmms), the generator shall be tripped to avoid mechanical damage (out of step tripping). The actual number of slips shall be reset either by the trip or by the end of evaluation time.

DO.name: MaxNumSlp
DO.desc: Maximum number of pole slips until tripping (Op, out of step tripping)

DO.name: EvTmms
DO.desc: Evaluation time (time window, out of step tripping)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. The number of trigger modes (CycTrMod i) and reclose times (RecTmmsi) is equal to the maximum allowed number of reclose cycles (MaxCyc). The trigger for the activation of RREC can be the start signal of PTRC, or the report "breaker open" of the circuit breaker, or any other signals and combination of signals. If different types of protections are involved in the autoreclosing process, all relevant data objects have to be published and subscribed by the allocated protection LNs. A principal diagram of RREC is given in Annex G.

DO.name: TrBeh
DO.desc: Defines single or three pole tripping (mostly resulting from combination CycTrMod[n] and RecCyc) for the next trip to be subscribed by the protection

DO.name: RecCyc
DO.desc: Actual reclose cycle (number between 1 and UseCyc)

DO.name: OpCls
DO.desc: Operation "close switch" issued to close the XCBR

DO.name: CycTrMod1
DO.desc: Indicates if single pole tripping allowed or three pole tripping always requested in the cycle indicated by the DO index

DO.name: UseCyc
DO.desc: Used actual set maximum number of reclose cycles

DO.name: MaxTmms
DO.desc: Maximum time after fault detection during which autoreclosing is permitted

DO.name: Rec1Tmms
DO.desc: Reclose time for 1-phase faults i.e. time to reclose command after trip in the cycle indicated by the DO index

DO.name: RdyTmms
DO.desc: Time between successful and ready state

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. The voltage phasor difference from both sides of an open breaker is calculated and compared with predefined switching conditions (synchrocheck). Included is the case that one side is dead (example: energising a dead line).
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: Resettable operation counter (switch and fault arcs)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN is used for supervision of circuit breakers. Operating a breaker and especially tripping a short circuit causes always some abrasion (or erosion) of the breaker contacts. The supervision is per phase since each phase has its own contact.

DO.name: OpCntAlm
DO.desc: Number of operations (modelled in the XCBR) has exceeded the alarm level for number of operations

DO.name: OpCntWrn
DO.desc: Number of operations (modelled in the XCBR) exceeds the warning limit

DO.name: OpTmWrn
DO.desc: Warning when operation time reaches the warning level

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: Time since installation or last maintenance in hours

DO.name: SwA
DO.desc: Current that was interrupted during last open operation

DO.name: AbrAlmLev
DO.desc: Abrasion sum threshold for alarm state

DO.name: AbrWrnLev
DO.desc: Abrasion sum threshold for warning state

DO.name: OpAlmTmh
DO.desc: Alarm level for operation time in hours

DO.name: OpWrnTmh
DO.desc: Warning level for operation time in hours

DO.name: OpAlmNum
DO.desc: Alarm level for number of operations

DO.name: OpWrnNum
DO.desc: Warning level for number of operations

LNodeType.Details: For a general description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. Insulation medium is gas, for example SF6 in gas isolated devices. For other measuring objects related to the same IED, a new instance of SIMG may be used. If the new measuring point(s) is/are related to a new IED, in this new IED a new instance of SIMG shall be used.

DO.name: InsBlk
DO.desc: Insulation gas not safe (block device operation)

DO.name: InsTr
DO.desc: Insulation gas dangerous (trip for device isolation)

DO.name: InsLevMax
DO.desc: Insulation gas level maximum (relates to predefined filling value)

DO.name: InsLevMin
DO.desc: Insulation gas level minimum (relates to predefined filling value)

DO.name: InsBlkTmh
DO.desc: Calculated time till blocking level is reached, corresponds to leakage of gas compartment

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. The insulation medium is a liquid such as oil, like that used for example for some transformers and tap changers. For other measuring objects related to the same IED, a new instance of SIML may be used. If the new measuring point(s) is/are related to a new IED a new instance of SIML shall be used.

DO.name: InsBlk
DO.desc: Insulation liquid not safe (block device operation)

DO.name: InsTr
DO.desc: Insulation liquid dangerous (trip for device isolation)

DO.name: GasInsAlm
DO.desc: Gas in insulation liquid alarm (may be used for Buchholz alarm)

DO.name: GasInsTr
DO.desc: Gas in insulation liquid trip (may be used for Buchholz trip)

DO.name: GasFlwTr
DO.desc: Insulation liquid flow trip because of gas (may be used for Buchholz trip)

DO.name: H2O
DO.desc: Relative saturation of moisture in insulating liquid (in %)

DO.name: H2OPap
DO.desc: Relative saturation of moisture in insulating paper (in %)

DO.name: H2OAir
DO.desc: Relative saturation of moisture in air in expansion volume (in %)

DO.name: H2OTmp
DO.desc: Temperature of insulating liquid at point of H2O measurement

DO.name: CmbuGas
DO.desc: Measurement of total dissolved combustible gases (TDCG)

DO.name: FltGas
DO.desc: Fault gas volume in Buchholz relay

LNodeType.Details: This LN is used for supervision of tap changer. It is used to assess the condition of the tap changer.

DO.name: AbrPrt
DO.desc: Abrasion (in %) of parts subject to wear

LNodeType.Details: This LN is used for supervision of operating mechanism for switches. It is used to assess the condition of the operating mechanism and can be used to indicate a possible malfunction in the future. Today, different technologies for operating mechanisms are available. Typically operating mechanisms for circuit breakers contain an energy storage to provide the required switching energy within a short time. Examples for today s storage medias are springs or compressed gas. To operate the switch, the energy is transferred by means of a mechanical or hydraulical linkage. A charger motor is used to compensate energy losses due to leakages or to recharge the storage after a switch operation. The proposed attributes cover the status of the relevant components both of the hydraulic system and the spring system. Depending on the used technology, some of the attributes are not applicable. This LN can also be used for simple operating mechanisms that are directly driven by a motor.

DO.name: MotOp
DO.desc: Indicates if the motor is running

DO.name: MotStrAlm
DO.desc: Alarm for number of motor starts exceeds MotAlmNum

DO.name: HyBlk
DO.desc: Block of operation due to hydraulic

DO.name: ChaIntvTms
DO.desc: Time interval between last two charging operations

DO.name: En
DO.desc: Stored energy (e.g. stored energy or remaining energy)

DO.name: MotAlmTms
DO.desc: Alarm level for motor run time in s

DO.name: MotStrNum
DO.desc: Alarm level for number of motor starts

DO.name: MotStrTms
DO.desc: Time interval for acquisition of motor starts

LNodeType.desc: Monitoring and diagnostics for partial discharges
LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. IEC 60270 should be applied.

DO.name: AppPaDsch
DO.desc: Apparent charge of partial discharge, peak level (PD)

DO.name: CtrHz
DO.desc: Center frequency of measurement unit according to IEC 60270

DO.name: BndWid
DO.desc: Bandwidth of measurement unit according to IEC 60270

LNodeType.Details: This LN is used for supervision of power transformer. It is used to asses the condition of the power transformer.

DO.name: MbrAlm
DO.desc: Leakage supervision alarm of tank conservator membrane

LNodeType.Details: This LN is used for supervision of all switches, such as disconnectors, earthing switches, etc. except circuit breakers. It is used to assess the condition of the switch and is closely related to LN SOPM. Most attributes are used to supervise the operation time of the switch and contact movement. Deviations from nominal values can be used to indicate a possible malfunction of the switch in the future. Abrasion of parts gives an indication when to maintain the switch. For the special requirements of a circuit breaker, the abrasion, etc. is defined in LN SCBR. The supervision SSWI is per phase.

DO.name: OpCntAlm
DO.desc: Number of operations (modelled in XSWI) has exceeded the alarm level for number of operations

DO.name: OpCntWrn
DO.desc: Number of operations (modelled in XSWI) exceeds the warning limit

DO.name: OpTmWrn
DO.desc: Warning when operation time reaches the warning level

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: Time since installation or last maintenance in hours

DO.name: AccAbr
DO.desc: Cumulated abrasion of parts subject to wear

DO.name: OpAlmTmh
DO.desc: Alarm level for operation time in hours

DO.name: OpWrnTmh
DO.desc: Warning level for operation time in hours

DO.name: OpAlmNum
DO.desc: Alarm level for number of operations

DO.name: OpWrnNum
DO.desc: Warning level for number of operations

LNodeType.Details: Logical node STMP shall be used to represent various devices that supervise the temperatures of major plant objects. It provides alarm and trip/shutdown functions. If more than one sensor (LN TTMP) is connected, the LN STMP shall be instantiated for each sensor.

Logical node SVBR shall be used to represent various devices that supervise the vibrations in rotating plant objects such as shafts, turbines, generators etc. It provides alarm and trip / shutdown functions. If more than one sensor (LN TVBR) is connected, the LN SVBR shall be instantiated for each sensor.

Logical node TANG shall be used to represent a measurement of an angle between two objects (one of which might be a theoretical vertical or horizontal line). The measurement can be returned optionally as degrees or radians ( or rad).

Logical node TAXD shall be used to represent an axial displacement value. The axial displacement can, depending on the application, be either longitudinal or transverse to the shaft. This sensor is often used together with vibration sensors as input to a vibration monitoring system.

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. The current is delivered as sampled values. The sampled values are transmitted as engineering values, i.e. as "true" (corrected) primary current values. Therefore, the transformer ratio and the correction factors are of no interest for the transmitted samples, but for maintenance purposes of an external conventional (magnetic) transducer only. In addition, status information is provided and some other settings are accepted from the LN TCTR.

DO.name: Rat
DO.desc: Winding ratio of an external current transformer (transducer) if applicable

DO.name: Cor
DO.desc: Current phasor magnitude correction of an external current transformer

DO.name: AngCor
DO.desc: Current phasor angle correction of an external current transformer

DO.name: CorCrv
DO.desc: Curve phasor magnitude and angle correction

LNodeType.Details: Logical node TDST shall be used to represent a measurement of the distance to an object that can move. It is intended to provide a measurement between a fixed location and a movable object.
Logical node TFLW shall be used to represent a measurement of media flow rate through the device where it is located.

Logical node TFRQ shall be used to represent a measurement of frequency. It is intended for any frequency that is not related to electrical a.c. measurements. It can be used for example for sound measurements, vibrations and timing of repeated occurrences. If a pure vibration is to be measured, where the movement rather than the frequency is of interest, the TVBR logical node is recommended.
Logical node TGSN shall be used to represent a generic sensor if there is no specific sensor available. It can also be used for modeling the health and name of an external equipment (sensor).
Logical Node THUM shall be used to represent a measurement of humidity in the media that is monitored. The result is given in percent of maximum possible humidity.

Logical node TLVL shall be used to represent a measurement of the media level in the container where it is located. The level is expressed as a percentage of full container. For a measurement given as a distance from a base level, the HLVL logical node shall be used.

Logical node TMVM shall be used to represent a measurement of movement or speed. It is intended to provide a measurement of the speed, in m/s, with which two objects (one of which may be fixed) are moving in relation to each other.

Logical node TPOS shall be used to represent the position of a movable device, actuator or similar. The position is given as a percentage of the full movement of the device being monitored. Compare with TDST that returns the distance in m.

DO.name: PosPctSv
DO.desc: Position given as percentage of full movement [%]

LNodeType.Details: Logical node TPRS shall be used to represent the absolute pressure of a medium. The medium might be air, water, oil, steam or any other substance, the pressure of which needs to be supervised.
Logical node TRTN shall be used to represent the rotational speed of a rotating device. Different measurement principles may be used, the presented result is however the same.
Logical node TSND shall be used to represent the sound pressure level at the location where the sensor is located.
Logical node TTMP shall be used to represent a single temperature measurement.
Logical node TTNS shall be used to represent a measurement of the mechanical tension in an object.
Logical node TVBR shall be used to represent a vibration level value. In case the vibration can be defined as a frequency, the TFRQ logical node could be used instead.

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. The voltage is delivered as sampled values. The sampled values are transmitted as engineering values, that is as "true" (corrected) primary voltage values. Therefore, the transformer ratio and the correction factors are of no interest for the transmitted samples but for maintenance purposes of an external conventional (magnetic) transducer only. In addition, status information is provided and some other settings are accepted from the LN TVTR.

DO.name: Rat
DO.desc: Winding ratio of external voltage transformer (transducer) if applicable

DO.name: Cor
DO.desc: Voltage phasor magnitude correction of external voltage transformer

DO.name: AngCor
DO.desc: Voltage phasor angle correction of external voltage transformer

DO.name: CorCrv
DO.desc: Curve phasor magnitude and angle correction

LNodeType.Details: Logical node TWPH shall be used to represent a water pH level value.

This LN is used for modelling switches with short circuit breaking capability. Additional LNs, for example SIMS, etc. may be required to complete the logical modelling for the breaker being represented. The closing and opening commands shall be subscribed from CSWI or CPOW if applicable. If no "time activated control" service is available between CSWI or CPOW and XCBR, the opening and closing commands shall be performed with a GSE-message (see IEC 61850-7-2).

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: Local or remote key (local means without substation automation communication, hardwired direct control)

DO.name: MaxOpCap
DO.desc: Circuit breaker operating capability when fully charged (O-C cycles)

LNodeType.Details: This LN is used for modelling switches without short circuit breaking capability, for example disconnectors, air break switches, earthing switches, etc. Additional LNs, SIMS, etc. may be required to complete the logical model for the switch being represented. The closing and opening commands shall be subscribed from CSWI. If no "time activated control" service is available between CSWI or CPOW and XSWI, the opening and closing commands shall be performed with a GSE-message (see IEC 61850-7-2).

DO.name: MaxOpCap
DO.desc: Switch operating capability when fully charged; obsolete, kept for Edition 1 compatibility

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. This LN shall be used for suppression coils as tap coils and plunge core coils.

DO.name: ColPosA
DO.desc: Coil position derived from the air gap

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DO.name: OoStep

DO.name: LTCCycAlm

DO.name: TapPos
DO.desc: Change Tap Position to dedicated position

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. The LN class power shunt also includes the switch for closing and opening the shunt.

DO.name: MaxOpCap
DO.desc: Power shunt operating capability when fully charged

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DO.name: OvlTm
DO.desc: Calculated maximum permissible overload time with cooling unit [min]

DO.name: OvlTEmg

DO.name: OvlTmSpt
DO.desc: Maximum permissible overload time with cooling unit [min]

DO.name: OvlTEmgSpt
DO.desc: Maximum permissible overload time without cooling unit (emergency case) [min]

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. Auxiliary networks belong to the power supply system of substations and other power systems installations.

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DO.name: DisplA

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. ZGEN has to be used for all generators not modelled elsewhere in IEC 61850.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5. ZLIN represents an overhead line with all physical characteristics.

For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
Logical Node ZRES shall be used to represent a ohmic resistor. A typical application is the resistor of the starpoint (a neutral resistor). The resistor is normally not controlled.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
Logical node ZSCR shall be used to represent a controllable rectifier. A typical use is to provide the controllable d.c. current within an excitation system.

DO.name: SetA
DO.desc: Current setting (if operating to a fixed current)

DO.name: SetV
DO.desc: Voltage setting (if operating to a fixed voltage)

LNodeType.Details: Logical Node ZSMC shall be used to represent any type of synchronous machine. The logical node only includes rating data.

DO.name: SpdCrit
DO.desc: Synchronous machine critical speed of the generator [s-1]

DO.name: FldRisTmp
DO.desc: Reference temperature for field resistance [usually in C]

DO.name: StatRisTmp

DO.name: Iner
DO.desc: Synchronous machine moment of inertia J [kgm2]

DO.name: FldAmpRtgO
DO.desc: No-load field current for rated stator voltage [A]

DO.name: Xdp
DO.desc: D-axis transient synchronous reactance Xd [per unit] (unsaturated)

DO.name: TmTdp
DO.desc: D-axis short circuit transient time constant Td [s] (unsaturated)

DO.name: TmTds
DO.desc: D-axis short-circuit sub-transient time constant Td [s] (unsaturated)

DO.name: TmTd0p
DO.desc: D-axis open circuit transient time constant Td0 [s] (unsaturated)

DO.name: TmTd0s
DO.desc: D-axis open circuit sub-transient time constant Td0 [s] (unsaturated)

DO.name: TmTqp
DO.desc: Q-axis short circuit transient time constant Tq [s] (unsaturated)

DO.name: TmTqs
DO.desc: Q-axis short circuit sub-transient time constant Tq [s] (unsaturated)

DO.name: TmTq0p
DO.desc: Q-axis open circuit transient time constant Tq0 [s] (unsaturated)

DO.name: TmTq0s
DO.desc: Q-axis open circuit sub-transient time constant Tq0 [s] (unsaturated)

LNodeType.Details: For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.
For a description of this LN, see IEC 61850-5.

DA.name: ldNs
DA.desc: shall be included in LLN0 only;

DA.name: ldNs
DA.desc: shall be included in LLN0 only;

BDA.name: f
BDA.desc: The value of f shall be the FLOAT representation of the measured value. f shall represent the technological value in SI units.

BDA.name: scaleFactor
BDA.desc: Scaling factor

BDA.name: hhLim
BDA.desc: Shall be the configuration parameter used in the context with the range attribute as defined in clause 8.

BDA.name: hLim
BDA.desc: Shall be the configuration parameter used in the context with the range attribute as defined in clause 8.

BDA.name: lLim
BDA.desc: Shall be the configuration parameter used in the context with the range attribute as defined in clause 8.

BDA.name: llLim
BDA.desc: Shall be the configuration parameter used in the context with the range attribute as defined in clause 8.

BDA.name: min
BDA.desc: Shall represent the minimum process measurement for which values of i or f are considered within process limits. If the value is lower, Quality shall be set accordingly (Quality.detailQual.outOfRange=TRUE results in Quality.validity=questionable).

BDA.name: max
BDA.desc: Shall represent the maximum process measurement for which values of i or f are considered within process limits. If the value is higher, Quality shall be set accordingly (Quality.detailQual.outOfRange=TRUE results in Quality.validity=questionable).

BDA.name: limDb
BDA.desc: 0 ... 100 000. Limit hysteresis. The value shall represent the percentage between max and min in units of 0,001 %. If limDb is not present, no hysteresis calculation is made

BDA.name: posVal
BDA.desc: Step position.

BDA.name: transInd
BDA.desc: Whether the equipment is in a transient state.

BDA.name: cmdQual
BDA.desc: Shall define if the control output is a pulse output or a persistent output. If "cmdQual=pulse", the duration of the pulse shall be defined with [onDur,offDur,numPls]. If "cmdQual=persistent", the deactivation of the output pulse is a local issue determined in the server.

BDA.name: onDur
BDA.desc: Duration of the pulse in ms. If set to 0, it means that the duration is locally defined.

BDA.name: offDur
BDA.desc: Duration between two pulses in ms. If set to 0, it means that the duration is locally defined.

BDA.name: numPls
BDA.desc: Number of pulses that are generated.

BDA.name: orCat
BDA.desc: Originator category indicates who/what caused the change of a controllable value. See OriginatorCategory.

BDA.name: orIdent
BDA.desc: Originator identification shall show the address of the originator who caused the change of the value. If NULL, originator of a particular action is not known or is not reported.

BDA.name: SIUnit
BDA.desc: See SIUnits.

BDA.name: multiplier
BDA.desc: The default value is 0 (i.e. multiplier = 1). See Multiplier.

BDA.name: mag
BDA.desc: The magnitude of the complex value.

BDA.name: ang
BDA.desc: The angle of the complex value in degrees. The angle reference is defined in the context where the Vector type is used. - 180 ... 180

BDA.name: xVal
BDA.desc: The x value of a curve point.

BDA.name: yVal
BDA.desc: The y value of a curve point.

BDA.name: zVal
BDA.desc: The z value of a curve point.

BDA.name: xStart
BDA.desc: The x start (lower left) value of a cell.

BDA.name: xEnd
BDA.desc: The x end (upper right) value of a cell.

BDA.name: yStart
BDA.desc: The y start (lower left) value of a cell.

BDA.name: yEnd
BDA.desc: The y end (upper right) value of a cell.

BDA.name: occ
BDA.desc: The x start (lower left) value of a cell.

BDA.name: occType
BDA.desc: The x end (upper right) value of a cell.

BDA.name: occPer
BDA.desc: The y start (lower left) value of a cell.

BDA.name: weekDay
BDA.desc: The y end (upper right) value of a cell.

BDA.name: month
BDA.desc: The y end (upper right) value of a cell.

BDA.name: day
BDA.desc: The y end (upper right) value of a cell.

BDA.name: hr
BDA.desc: 0..23 hour

BDA.name: mn
BDA.desc: 0..59 minute
