Dead Line, Dead Bus OR Dead Line, Live Bus
Live Line, Dead Bus OR Dead Line, Live Bus
Dead Line, Dead Bus OR Live Line, Dead Bus OR Dead Line, Live Bus
Master/ Slave with fixed slave position
Master/ Slave with variable slave posiiton
Circulating reactive current by equalizing power factor
With Current and Breaker Status Check
Cancelled: loss of communication with dispatch centre
Cancelled: loss of communication with local area network
Cancelled: loss of communication with the local interface
Cancelled: equipment was in the wrong mode
Umax but not compensated due to U continous limitation

NS.name: IEC 61400-25-2
NS.application: Wind power plant specific logical nodes
NS.LNodeType:
The logical node comprises the data classes that represent the wind turbine general information as listed in Table 7. This logical node shall be mandatory, which means that at least all mandatory defined data classes shall be available for compliance with this part of the IEC 61400-25 series.
O

LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent the wind turbine rotor information. This logical node is mandatory, and at least all mandatory defined data classes in Table 8 shall be available for compliance with the IEC 61400-25 series.

DO.name: RotSpd
DO.desc: Value of rotor speed at rotor side

DO.name: PtHyPresBl1
DO.desc: Pressure of hydraulic pitch system for blade 1 (reference)

DO.name: PtHyPresBl2
DO.desc: Pressure of hydraulic pitch system for blade 2

DO.name: PtHyPresBl3
DO.desc: Pressure of hydraulic pitch system for blade 3

DO.name: PtAngSpBl1
DO.desc: Pitch angle set points for blade 1 (reference)

DO.name: PtAngSpBl2
DO.desc: Pitch angle set points for blade 2

DO.name: PtAngSpBl3
DO.desc: Pitch angle set points for blade 3

LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent wind turbine (mechanical) transmission information. The logical node is optional. Table 9 shows the data classes for a usual transmission topology, consisting of a slow speed shaft, multistage gearbox, a fast shaft and a (hydraulically driven) mechanical brake.

DO.name: OilLevSt
DO.desc: Status of oil level in gearbox sump

DO.name: GsLev
DO.desc: Grease level for lubrication of main shaft bearing

LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent wind turbine generator information. This logical node shall be mandatory, which means that at least all mandatory defined data classes in Table 10 shall be available for compliance with the IEC 61400-25 series.

DO.name: GnTmpInlet
DO.desc: Temperature measurement for inlet air/water temperature at generator

LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent the wind turbine converter information. This logical node shall be optional, but if used, the mandatory defined data classes in Table 11 shall be available for compliance with the IEC 61400-25 series.

This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent the wind turbine transformer information. This logical node shall be optional, but if used, the mandatory defined data classes in Table 12 shall be available for compliance with the IEC 61400-25 series.

DO.name: OilLevSt
DO.desc: Oil level information for oil filled transformers.

DO.name: MTPresSt
DO.desc: Gas pressure of main tank for oil filled transformers.

DO.name: TrfTurPPV
DO.desc: Transformer turbine side 3 phase phase-to-phase voltage

DO.name: TrfGriPPV
DO.desc: Transformer grid side 3 phase phase-to-phase voltage

DO.name: AtvGriSw
DO.desc: Activation command to main grid switch

LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent information concerning the wind turbine nacelle. Table 13 shows the data classes for common equipment in or at the nacelle: vibration measurements and beacon equipment. This logical node is mandatory and at least the mandatory defined data classes in Table 13 shall be available for compliance with the IEC 61400-25 series.

DO.name: WdHtSt
DO.desc: Status of heater for wind sensor.

DO.name: BecLumLev
DO.desc: Value of luminosity level of beacon

DO.name: SetBecLev
DO.desc: Set bulb light level of beacon

DO.name: SetFlsh
DO.desc: Set value of flash duty cycle of beacon

LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent the wind turbine yawing information. This logical node shall be mandatory, which means that at least all mandatory defined data classes in Table 14 shall be available for compliance with the IEC 61400-25 series.

DO.name: YawAng
DO.desc: Yaw bearing rotation angle relative to nominal true North

DO.name: SysGsLev
DO.desc: Grease level for lubrication of yaw system

LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent information concerning the wind turbine tower structure. Table 15 shows the data classes for common equipment related to the tower. This logical node shall be optional; but when used, at least the mandatory defined data classes shall be available for compliance with the IEC 61400-25 series. series.
This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent meteorological information.

This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent alarm information of a wind power plant. This logical node shall be mandatory, which means that at least all mandatory defined data classes in Table 17 shall be available for compliance with the IEC 61400-25 series.

LNodeType.desc: Wind power plant active power control
LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent information concerning wind power plant active power control. This logical node shall be optional; but when used, at least the mandatory defined data classes shall be available for compliance with the IEC 61400-25 series. Table 21 represents and visualises the different data class attributes in the WAPC logical node.

DO.name: NumOpTur
DO.desc: Actual number of wind turbines in operation

DO.name: PlVAEn
DO.desc: Active Power Control Mode Enabled controlling apparent power

DO.name: PlWCap
DO.desc: Wind Power Plant active power output capability

DO.name: PlW
DO.desc: Wind Power Plant active power output

DO.name: PlWDel
DO.desc: Wind Power Plant active power reserve utilizing the Delta function - the difference between active power generation capability and active power generated

DO.name: SetPlW
DO.desc: Set reference value for the wind power plant active power output

DO.name: SetPlVA
DO.desc: Set reference value for the wind power plant apparent power output

DO.name: SetPlWUpGra
DO.desc: Set reference value for gradient ramping up the wind power plant active power output

DO.name: SetPlWDoGra
DO.desc: Set reference value for gradient ramping down the wind power plant active power output

DO.name: SetPlDel
DO.desc: Set reference value for the wind power plant active power reserve - also named as spinning reserve

LNodeType.desc: Wind power plant reactive power control
LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall comprise the data classes that represent information concerning wind power plant reactive power control. This logical node shall be optional; but when used at least the mandatory defined data classes shall be available for compliance with the IEC 61400-25 series. Table 22 represents and visualises the different data class attributes in the WRPC logical node. All aspects concerning reactive power are following the generator convention. Positive values imply increase of voltage and production of reactive power. Negative values imply decrease of voltage and consumption of reactive power.

DO.name: NumOpTur
DO.desc: Actual number of wind turbines in operation

DO.name: PlVAr
DO.desc: Wind power plant reactive power output

DO.name: PlVArCapImp
DO.desc: Wind power plant reactive power import (demand) capability

DO.name: PlVArCapExp
DO.desc: Wind power plant reactive power export (supply) capability

DO.name: PlPF
DO.desc: Wind Power Plant actual Power Factor

DO.name: PlV
DO.desc: Wind Power Plant output voltage at the external grid connection point

DO.name: SetPlVAr
DO.desc: Set reference value of wind power plant reactive power output

DO.name: SetPlVArUpGra
DO.desc: Set reference value for gradient for ramping up the wind power plant reactive power output

DO.name: SetPlVArDoGra
DO.desc: Set reference value for gradient for ramping down the wind power plant reactive power output

DO.name: SetPlV
DO.desc: Set reference value for wind power plant voltage output

DO.name: SetPlVUpGra
DO.desc: Set reference value for wind power plant voltage ramping up

DO.name: SetPlVDoGra
DO.desc: Set reference value for wind power plant voltage ramping down

DO.name: SetPlDrp
DO.desc: Set reference value for slope of voltage control droop

DO.name: SetPlPF
DO.desc: Set reference value for wind power plant power factor - negative: consuming reactive power; positive: producing reactive power

DA.name: tmTot
DA.desc: Total time duration of a state

DA.name: rsPer
DA.desc: Time periodical reset dly | wly | mly | yly | manual

DA.name: rsPer
DA.desc: Time periodical reset dly | wly | mly | yly | manual

DA.name: actVal
DA.desc: Demand value of setpoint or parameter

DA.name: numAlm
DA.desc: Number of elements in the array of alarms

BDA.name: ctlVal
BDA.desc: Reset (TRUE)

BDA.name: origin
BDA.desc: Operator of last reset

NS.name: IEC 61850-7-420
NS.application: Communication networks and systems for power utility automation - Part 7-420: Basic communication structure - Distributed energy resources and distribution automation logical nodes

LNodeType.desc: DER plant corporate characteristics at the ECP
LNodeType.Details: This logical node defines the corporate and contractual characteristics of a DER plant. A DER plant in this context is defined as one DER unit and/or a group of DER units which are connected at an electrical connection point (ECP). The DCRP LN can be associated with each ECP (e.g. with each DER unit and a group of DER units) or just those ECPs where it is appropriate.

DO.name: PlntOblSelf
DO.desc: Plant purpose/obligations at the ECP - run passively or whenever possible (e.g. photovoltaics, wind)

DO.name: PlntOblBck
DO.desc: Plant purpose/obligations at the ECP - for backup

DO.name: PlntOblMan
DO.desc: Plant purpose/obligations at the ECP - manual operations

DO.name: PlntOblMrk
DO.desc: Plant purpose/obligations at the ECP - market-driven

DO.name: PlntOblUtil
DO.desc: Plant purpose/obligations at the ECP - utility operated

DO.name: PlntOblEm
DO.desc: Plant purpose/obligations at the ECP - emission-limited

LNodeType.desc: DER operational authority at the ECP
LNodeType.Details: This Logical Node is associated with role based access control (RBAC) and indicates the authorized control actions that are permitted for each 'role', including authority to disconnect the ECP from the power system, connect the ECP to the power system, change operating modes, start DER units, and stop DER units. This LN could also be used to indicate what permissions are in effect. One instantiation of this LN should be established for each 'role' that could have operational control. The possible types of roles are outside the scope of this standard. See Table 7.

DO.name: DERAuth
DO.desc: List of the MRIDs of the DER units at this ECP which are covered by this authorization

DO.name: ECPOpnAuth
DO.desc: Authorized to disconnect the ECP from power system

DO.name: ECPClsAuth
DO.desc: Authorized to connect the ECP to the power system

DO.name: ECPModAuth
DO.desc: Authorized to change operating mode of DER plant connected to ECP

DO.name: DERStrAuth
DO.desc: Authorized to start DER units connected to this ECP

DO.name: DERStpAuth
DO.desc: Authorized to stop DER units connected to the ECP

LNodeType.Details: This logical node contains the operational characteristics of the combined group of DER units connected at the ECP, including the list of physically connected DER units, the status of their electrical connectivity at this ECP, the type of ECP, the modes of ECP operation, combined ratings of all DERs at ECP, and power system operating limits at ECP. See Table 6.

DO.name: InCctID
DO.desc: Circuit Id of generation source at ECP

DO.name: OutCctID
DO.desc: Circuit Id of non-generation (load) at ECP

DO.name: ECPWRtg
DO.desc: Nominal, min, and max aggregated DER W rating at ECP

DO.name: ECPVarRtg
DO.desc: Nominal, min, and max aggregated DER var rating at ECP

DO.name: ECPVLev
DO.desc: Nominal, min, and max voltage level at ECP

DO.name: ECPHz
DO.desc: Nominal, min, and max frequency at ECP

LNodeType.Details: This logical node provides settings for the operating mode at the ECP. This LN can be used to set available operating modes as well as to set actual operating modes. More than one mode can be set simultaneously for certain logical combinations. For example: - PV designates both constant W and constant voltage modes; - PQ designates both constant var and constant voltage modes; - PF with voltage override mode designates both constant PF and constant voltage modes; - Constant W and vars mode designates both constant W and constant vars modes. It is assumed that a DER management system will then take whatever actions are necessary to set the DER units appropriately so that the ECP maintains the operating mode that has been set. See Table 8.

DO.name: OpModPM
DO.desc: Mode of operation - driven by energy source (e.g. solar, water flow)

DO.name: OpModPk
DO.desc: Mode of operation - peak load shaving

DO.name: OpModIsld
DO.desc: Mode of operation - islanded at the ECP

LNodeType.Details: This logical node provides the real-time status and measurements at the ECP, including connection status of ECP and accumulated watt-hours. The active modes of operation are handled by the LN DOPM, the actual power system measurements at the ECP are handled by the LN MMXU, and control of connectivity at ECP is either a manual action or handled by LNs XCBR and CSWI. See Table 9.

DO.name: ECPConn
DO.desc: Connection of DER plant at ECP

DO.name: TotWh
DO.desc: Total watt-hours at ECP since last reset

LNodeType.Details: The DCCT logical node defines the DER economic dispatch parameters. Each DCCT is associated with one or more ECPs through the power management function.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: RampCost
DO.desc: Cost to ramp DER per kW per minute

DO.name: HeatRteCost
DO.desc: Incremental heat rate piecewise linear curve costs.

LNodeType.desc: DER energy and/or ancillary services schedule control
LNodeType.Details: The following logical node controls the use of DER energy and ancillary services schedules. Each DSCC is associated with one or more ECPs. Time activated control shall be used to establish the start time for schedules using relative time and if the start time is in the future. See Table 11.

DO.name: ActWSchdSt
DO.desc: Indication of which energy schedule is active - schedule 0 indicates no schedule

DO.name: ActAncSchdSt
DO.desc: Indication of which ancillary services schedule is active - schedule 0 indicates no schedule

DO.name: ActWSchd
DO.desc: Activate specific energy schedule, using TimeActivatedOperate to establish start time for schedules using relative time and if start time is in the future. ctrVal: 0 = deactivate, 1 = activate

DO.name: ActAncSchd
DO.desc: Activate specific ancillary services schedule, using TimeActivatedOperate to establish start time for schedules using relative time and if start time is in the future. ctrVal: 0 = deactivate, 1 = activate

LNodeType.desc: DER energy and/or ancillary services schedule
LNodeType.Details: The following logical node defines a DER energy and/or ancillary services schedule. Multiple schedules can be defined, using DSCC LN to control which ones are active. Each DSCH is associated with one or more ECPs. See Table 12.

DO.name: SchdSt
DO.desc: Indication that this schedule has been activated

DO.name: SchdTyp
DO.desc: Type of schedule, identifying the operating mode under which the schedule will be used (0-9/99)

DO.name: SchdAbsTm
DO.desc: Array of energy targets for each schedule period using absolute time, starting at zero (UTC epoch)

DO.name: SchdRelTm
DO.desc: Array of energy targets for each schedule period using relative time offsets

DO.name: SchdVal
DO.desc: Meaning of the val parameter in the SCA or SCR (0-7/99)

LNodeType.Details: The DER controller logical node defines the control characteristics and capabilities of one DER unit or aggregations of one type of DER device with a single controller. See Table 13.

DO.name: DERNum
DO.desc: Number of DER units connected to controller

DO.name: StrDlTms
DO.desc: Nominal time delay before starting or restarting

DO.name: LodRampRte
DO.desc: Nominal ramp load or unload rate, power versus time

LNodeType.Details: The DER controller logical node defines the control status of one DER unit or aggregations of one type of DER device with a single controller. See Table 14.

DO.name: ECPConn
DO.desc: Electrically connected to the ECP that it is physically connected to

DO.name: ModOnConn
DO.desc: Operational mode - True: On and connected

DO.name: ModOnAval
DO.desc: Operational mode - True: On and available for connection

DO.name: ModOnUnav
DO.desc: Operational mode - True: On but not available for connection

DO.name: ModOffAval
DO.desc: Operational mode - True: Off but available to start

DO.name: ModOffUnav
DO.desc: Operational mode - True: Off and not available to start

DO.name: FltRatePct
DO.desc: Fault rates of DER as percent

LNodeType.Details: The DER supervisory control logical node defines the control actions for one DER unit or aggregations of one type of DER device with a single controller. See Table 15.

DO.name: ImExSet
DO.desc: Setpoint for maintaining constant import/export energy at ECP

DO.name: OutPFSet
DO.desc: Setpoint for maintaining fixed power factor: negative PF is leading and positive PF is lagging

DO.name: OutHzSet
DO.desc: Setpoint for maintaining fixed frequency offset

DO.name: OutVSet
DO.desc: Voltage setpoint for maintaining fixed voltage level in percent offset

DO.name: AutoManCtl
DO.desc: Sets operations mode to automatic or manual

DO.name: LocRemCtl
DO.desc: Sets operations mode to remote or local

DO.name: OpModAval
DO.desc: Sets operational mode: is or is not available

LNodeType.Details: The DGEN logical node defines the actual connected and operational state of a DER generating unit, including aggregations of generating units. It inherits nameplate and operational characteristics, and includes the commands that cause it to change state. It also reflects the generating unit's responses to external events that cause a change of state (DERState).

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: GnSynSt
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Synchronization status of the DER generator unit.

DO.name: RmpLodSw
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Ramp Load/Unload Switch; True = Ramp load, False = Ramp unload

DO.name: RemExpcOpTms
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Expected remaining operational run time (in seconds) before the unit is required to end exporting energy (get out from the state "Connected and Generating" state) due to external factors (e.g. lack of fuel, limits on emissions, limits on heat storage, limits on energy storage) if operating as planned. If not used, quality shall be set to invalid.

DO.name: DEROpSt
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Current state of operation of the distributed energy resource.

DO.name: TestRsl
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Set to true at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test) if all tests successful, otherwise set to false. Its value remains unchanged until a new test procedure is launched. Set systematically to false at warm or cold start of the equipment, and at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: TestAddRsl
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Reflects the equipment test additional results at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test). Set systematically to value 'test running' at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: CnstWMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) The calculation of the maximum power that the generator could output, based on constraining environmental conditions (e.g. solar insolation or wind speed or constraints from heat or vibrations). The delta between this calculation and the actual power being output indicates how much additional power could be output.

DO.name: GnOpTm
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Elapsed time as the generator becomes ready after the start command was issued; max = maximum time before issuing a start-failure alarm

DO.name: GnStabTm
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Timer for stabilization time; max = maximum time before issuing a stabilization-failure alarm

DO.name: GnClDnTm
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Timer for generator unit to cool down; min = minimum time for cool down

DO.name: AutoVRegPct
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Automatic voltage regulator percent duty cycle

DO.name: GnEnPer
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Energy generated during the period since last reset

DO.name: RenWPct
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Percentage of the active power currently generated which results from renewable energy resource. What is considered as renewable is a local definition.

DO.name: RenVArPct
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Percentage of the reactive power currently generated which results from renewable energy resource. What is considered as renewable is a local definition.

DO.name: VArTot
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) The total amount of reactive power without impacting active power output if the distinction between absorbing and injecting reactive power is not significant (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of AvarTot and IvarTot)

DO.name: AvarTot
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) The total amount of reactive power available for absorbing even if possibly impacting active power output (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArTot)

DO.name: IvarTot
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) The total amount of reactive power available for injecting even if possibly impacting active power output (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArTot)

DO.name: VArAvl
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) The amount of reactive power available without impacting active power output if the distinction between absorbing and injecting reactive power is not significant (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of AvarAvl and IvarAvl)

DO.name: AvarAvl
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) The amount of reactive power available for absorbing without impacting active power output (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArAvl)

DO.name: IvarAvl
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) The amount of reactive power available for injecting without impacting active power output (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArAvl)

DO.name: SelfSvcWh
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_ActualPowerInformationLN) Actual self service energy used

DO.name: VAPct
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_ActualPowerInformationLN) Actual percentage of apparent power output based on VAMax

DO.name: AvlUpW
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_ActualPowerInformationLN) Available capability (measured or calculated) for increasing active output, including increasing generation of active power, even if currently consuming power.

DO.name: AvlDnW
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_ActualPowerInformationLN) Available capability (measured or calculated) for decreasing active power, including increasing the consumption of active power, even if currently generating power.

DO.name: GnOnCnt
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) The number of times that the DER unit has been turned on or returned to service: count of "DER unit on" times, since the last time the counter was reset

DO.name: TotStrCnt
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Count of total number of starts

DO.name: PerStrCnt
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Count of starts in period since reset

DO.name: OpTms
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Total time DER unit has operated - resettable: accumulated time since the last time the time was reset

DO.name: GnEnPerRs
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_GeneratorLN) Reset the generated energy in period.

DO.name: AuthConn
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) (controllable) if true, the DER is authorized to connect, otherwise it has to remain (or become) disconnected. Authorization may come from an external source or may be a default setting.

DO.name: DEROpStCtl
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) (controllable) Operating with the value expressed in ctlVal (selected among the list specified in DERStateControlKind) initiates the appropriate transition request. The reading of its attribute stVal is meaningless. The resulting state of the DER shall be observed in the DEROpSt DO.

DO.name: CeaEgzCtl
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) (controllable) Operating with value true initiates the cease to energize state of the DER (see definition of "cease to energize"); operating with value false initiates the return to service (get back to Idle, then reflect the settings of any or all default settings, enabled operational functions, and/or schedules) of the DER.

DO.name: WSpt
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Active power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArSpt
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Reactive power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: EmgMod
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) (controllable) if true the DER shall operate in emergency mode, otherwise shall operate in normal mode. In emergency mode, emergency settings, emergency limits, and other emergency- related setpoints will be in effect.

DO.name: AuthDscon
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) (controllable) if true, the DER is authorized to disconnect, otherwise shall remain connected (if possible)

DO.name: TestEna
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) (controllable) If set to true, entering into test mode for the DER is allowed, otherwise forbidden

DO.name: Test
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) (controllable) Operating with value true initiates starting a test of the DER equipment and resets the values of TestRsl.stVal (set to 'false') and TestAddRsl.stVal (set to 'test running'); operating with value false aborts the test. The reading of the status indicates whether the equipment is under test or not. The content of such test is implementation dependant.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlledLN) (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: InclGn
DO.desc: Included generator. This DO points to an instance of DGEN

DO.name: DERUnit
DO.desc: Reference to the DER Unit LN which may be associated to this generic model LN

DO.name: EqGn
DO.desc: Reference to the equivalent DGEN instance reflecting the generation aspects of the DER

DO.name: WMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Nameplate maximum active generation power rating at unity power factor

DO.name: WOvPFRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Nameplate active power generation rating at specified over-excited power factor, OvPFRtg

DO.name: WUnPFRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Nameplate active power generation rating at specified under-excited power factor, UnPFRtg

DO.name: VAMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Nameplate maximum apparent power generation rating

DO.name: VArMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Setpoint for maximum reactive power if the distinction between absorbing and injecting reactive power is not significant

DO.name: AvarMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Rating for maximum absorbing reactive power

DO.name: IvarMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Rating for maximum supply (injection) reactive power

DO.name: AMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Maximum current rating under nominal voltage under nominal power factor

DO.name: ConsWMinRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Minimum continuous active power generation rating

DO.name: ConsWMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Maximum continuous active power generation rating

DO.name: EmgWMinRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Minimum active power generation ratings curve of emergency limits for different minutes

DO.name: EmgWMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Maximum active power generation ratings curve of emergency limits for different minutes

DO.name: DsconWMinRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Minimum active power generation level that generator should be able to disconnect without harm

DO.name: WRpuMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Maximum generation active power ramp up rating

DO.name: WRpdMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Maximum generation active power ramp down rating

DO.name: CtbWMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Max rated active power (WMaxRtg) which may result from controllable resource, .i.e whose level can be potentially controlled/set under the request of an entity external to the given DER.

DO.name: CtbVArMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Max rated reactive power VArMaxRtg, which may result from controllable resource, .i.e whose level can be potentially controlled/set under the request of an entity external to the given DER.

DO.name: WCtb
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) If true, the active power currently generated which results from controllable resource is fully controllable (up to CtbWMaxRtg), .i.e its level can be potentially controlled/set under the request of an entity external to the given DER. Otherwise the generated active power is not controllable.

DO.name: VArCtb
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) If true, the reactive power currently generated which results from controllable resource is fully controllable (up to CtbVArMaxRtg), .i.e its level can be potentially controlled/set under the request of an entity external to the given DER. Otherwise the reactive power is not controllable.

DO.name: RenWMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Max rated active power (WMaxRtg) which may result from renewable energy resource. What is considered as renewable is a local definition.

DO.name: RenVArMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: GeneratorNameplateRatingsLN) Max rated reactive power VArMaxRtg, which may result from renewable energy resource. What is considered as renewable is a local definition.

DO.name: WMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum active power

DO.name: WOvPFMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum active power at specified over-excited power factor, OvPF

DO.name: WUnPFMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum active power at specified under-excited power factor, UnPF

DO.name: WRmp
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Default ramp rate for changes in active power: percentage of WMax per second

DO.name: VArMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum reactive power if the distinction between absorbing and injecting reactive power is not significant (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of AvarMax and IvarMax)

DO.name: AvarMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum absorbing reactive power (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArMax)

DO.name: IvarMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum supply (injection) reactive power (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArMax)

DO.name: VMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum voltage operational rating

DO.name: VMin
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for minimum voltage operational rating

DO.name: AMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum operational current rating under nominal voltage under nominal power factor

DO.name: VAMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum apparent power while generating (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of AvaMax and IvaMax)

DO.name: AvaMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum absorbing apparent power (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VAMax)

DO.name: IvaMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Setting for maximum injecting apparent power (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VAMax)

DO.name: VArSptRef
DO.desc: (inherited from: NonStorageOperationalSettingsLN) Reference for reactive power setpoints. Selects which setpoint is active.

DO.name: StrMaxTms
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Maximum time from starting to connect to the grid until achieving grid connection

DO.name: OffMinTms
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Minimal time the DER needs to stay off after being switched off

DO.name: OnMinTms
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Minimal time the DER needs to stay on after being switched on

DO.name: StopDlMinTms
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Minimal time delay before stopping and/or disconnecting after a disconnect command received

DO.name: StopMaxTms
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Maximum time from starting to disconnect from the grid until achieving grid disconnection

DO.name: StrDlMinTms
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) Minimal time delay before starting or restarting after a connect command has been received

DO.name: AutoStr
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) if true, the DER can automatically initate its starting up

DO.name: AutoConn
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_StateAbstractLN) if true, the DER can automatically initiate its connection to the grid

DO.name: PFSign
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_OperationalSettingsLN) Power factor convention: IEC or EEI

DO.name: OplPct
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_OperationalSettingsLN) Percentage of the changed value that must be reached in response to a step change in an open loop response time context (normally equals 90 % or 95 %)

DO.name: OvPF
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_OperationalSettingsLN) Specified Over-Excited Power Factor setting

DO.name: PFExtSet
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_OperationalSettingsLN) True = overexcited; False = underexcited

DO.name: IsldCtlFol
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_OperationalSettingsLN) DER behaviour in Islanded Mode. Determines how the DER behaves when in an Islanded configuration. False = Controlling Isochronous Mode. DER attempts to control voltage and frequency independent of configured curves and settings up to the limits of the machine's capabilities in order to achieve the Reference Voltage and nominal frequency. True = Following Droop Mode. DER acts as a follower using Volt/VAR and Freq/Watt curves.

DO.name: ClcTotVA
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_OperationalSettingsLN) Calculation method used for total apparent power calculation: Vector or Arithmetic

DO.name: FllBckTmExp
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_OperationalSettingsLN) Timeout period after which the fallback behavior must apply

DO.name: AvarZerWMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_OperationalSettingsLN) Maximum reactive power absorbed in case of zero active power

DO.name: IvarZerWMax
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_OperationalSettingsLN) Maximum reactive power injected in case of zero active power

DO.name: OutEcpRef
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Reference to ECP directly connected at the output of the DER, the "plug" part. Note: The power management function ECP associated to this same resource will refer to the "socket" part.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

DO.name: PhsConnTyp
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Phase type of electrical connection of the DER

DO.name: OvPFRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Specified Over-Excited Power Factor Rating

DO.name: UnPFRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Specified Under-Excited Power Factor

DO.name: FltRtgPct
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Exposure to fault rates as percent of ??

DO.name: FltAMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Max fault current rating

DO.name: FltDurMaxTms
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Max fault duration rating

DO.name: SelfWRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Self- service nominal power

DO.name: SelfPFRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Self- service nominal power factor

DO.name: RvSeq
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Sequence (direction) reversed: False = ABC, true = CBA

DO.name: SelfVRngRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Self- service acceptable voltage range

DO.name: EfcRtgPct
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Efficiency at rated capacity as percent

DO.name: SuscRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Susceptance rating in siemens

DO.name: RegClas
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Regulatory classification, using text strings which may have pre-specified values. For example, for IEEE 1547:2018, the specified text is "IEEE 1547:2018 Normal Category A (B) & Abnormal Category I (II,III)", where either "A" or "B" is stated for the Normal Category and either "I", "II", or "III" is stated for the Abnormal Category

DO.name: HzNomRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Rated Nominal frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: HzMinRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Rated minimal frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: HzMaxRtg
DO.desc: (inherited from: DER_NameplateRatingsLN) Rated maximum frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: DERId
DO.desc: (inherited from: AllEnergyDEResourceLN) Internal identifier of the resource within a system which is using that resource. It complements the mRID defined as part of the EEname DO. Different DERIds may be defined for different system users.

LNodeType.Details: The following logical node defines the DER basic generator ratings. These are established as status objects since they are not expected to be remotely updated except through the use of the system configuration language or other direct intervention. See Table 17.

DO.name: ConnTyp
DO.desc: Type of connection: 3-phase or single phase, delta, wye

DO.name: ARtg
DO.desc: Current rating under nominal voltage under nominal power factor

DO.name: FltRtgPct
DO.desc: Exposure to fault rates as percent

DO.name: EmgMaxWOut
DO.desc: Max watt output - emergency limits for different minutes

DO.name: EmgMinWOut
DO.desc: Min watt output - emergency limits for different minutes

DO.name: EffRtgPct
DO.desc: Efficiency at rated capacity as percent

LNodeType.Details: The following logical node defines the DER advanced generator ratings. These are established as status objects since they are not expected to be remotely updated except through the use of the system configuration language or other direct intervention. See Table 18.

DO.name: PFGnRtg
DO.desc: Power factor rating generating as angle

DO.name: PFAbsRtg
DO.desc: Power factor rating absorbing as angle

DO.name: OpCctDirTms
DO.desc: Open circuit transient direct axis time constants

DO.name: ShCctDirTms
DO.desc: Short circuit subtransient direct axis time constants

DO.name: OpCctQudTms
DO.desc: Open circuit subtransient quadrature axis time constants

DO.name: ShCctQudTms
DO.desc: Short circuit subtransient quadrature axis time constants

DO.name: InertTms
DO.desc: Time for response to fault current (MW * seconds / MVA)

DO.name: PMaxQCrv
DO.desc: PQ operating region of apparent power for max Q

DO.name: PMinQCrv
DO.desc: PQ operating region of apparent power for min Q

DO.name: TransVLim
DO.desc: Transient voltage limits: Volts - Surge - mostly by magnitude

DO.name: ThdWPct
DO.desc: Total harmonic distortion for power as percent of fundamental power

DO.name: ImpactHzPct
DO.desc: Frequency impact on the DER output as percent

DO.name: HACrvPct
DO.desc: Table of current harmonics dependencies on DER operations

DO.name: HVCrvPct
DO.desc: Table of voltage harmonics dependencies on DER operations

DO.name: ChgLimVPct
DO.desc: Rapid voltage changes as percent of voltage

DO.name: ChgLimAng
DO.desc: Rapid angle changes as limits on degrees

DO.name: ChgLimRatAng
DO.desc: Rate of angle change as limits on degrees over time

LNodeType.Details: The DCST logical node provides the economic information related to DER operating characteristics. In some implementations, it is expected that multiple DCST LNs will be used for different seasons or for different operational conditions.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: HeatRteAct
DO.desc: Active curve characteristics for the incremental heat rate curve

DO.name: HeatRteCost
DO.desc: Costs associated with each segment in an incremental heat rate curve

DO.name: RampCost
DO.desc: Cost for ramping associated with each segment

LNodeType.Details: The following logical node defines the DER excitation ratings. These are established as status objects since they are not expected to be remotely updated except through the use of the system configuration language or other direct intervention. See Table 20.

DO.name: ExtTyp
DO.desc: Type of exciter: DC: permanent magnet or motor-generator; AC: static

DO.name: CtrHzHiLim
DO.desc: Hard high frequency control limit. This is for normal, islanded generation, as setpoint for the upper level of Hz allowed for the generator.

DO.name: CtrHzLoLim
DO.desc: Hard low frequency control limit. This is for normal, islanded generation, as setpoint for the lower level of Hz allowed for the generator.

LNodeType.Details: The DEXC logical node provides settings and status of the excitation components of DER devices.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: (inherited from: EquipmentInterfaceLN) Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: DrpV
DO.desc: Voltage droop status; True = Droop enabled

DO.name: PwrStab
DO.desc: Power system stabilizer present; True = Yes

DO.name: MaxHiVLim
DO.desc: Maximum allowed voltage set-point reached - True = max

DO.name: MaxLoVLim
DO.desc: Minimum allowed voltage set-point reached - True = min

DO.name: FlshAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: Field flashing failure - True = failure

DO.name: PwrSupAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: Power to excitation system failure - True = failure

DO.name: DCAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: DC system failure - True = failure

DO.name: ACAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: AC system failure - True = failure

DO.name: UPSAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: UPS failure - True = failure

DO.name: BlkA
DO.desc: Operation blocked due to current - True = blocked

DO.name: BlkV
DO.desc: Operation blocked due to voltage - True = blocked

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: (inherited from: EquipmentInterfaceLN) State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: (inherited from: EquipmentInterfaceLN) Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: ExtTyp
DO.desc: Type of exciter: DC: permanent magnet or motor- generator; AC: static

DO.name: PFExtV
DO.desc: Excitation voltage at rated power factor

DO.name: PFExtA
DO.desc: Excitation current at rated power factor

DO.name: PhLdComp
DO.desc: Power system stabilizer phase lead compensation

DO.name: CtlHzHiLim
DO.desc: Hard high frequency control limit. This is for normal, islanded generation, as setpoint for the upper level of Hz allowed for the generator.

DO.name: CtlHzLoLim
DO.desc: Hard low frequency control limit. This is for normal, islanded generation, as setpoint for the lower level of Hz allowed for the generator.

DO.name: ExtVDurTms
DO.desc: Forced excitation duration of ceiling voltage

LNodeType.Details: The DSFC logical node defines the characteristics of the speed or frequency controller. See Table 22.

DO.name: Droop
DO.desc: Power droop in energy per frequency

DO.name: RegBndOvHz
DO.desc: Regulation band for over-frequency (frequency deviation at which the control response is 100 percent activated)

DO.name: RegDbOvHz
DO.desc: Deadband for over-frequency (frequency deviation where no control action is taken)

DO.name: PwrRsvOvHz
DO.desc: Power reserved for over-frequency for frequency control

DO.name: RegBndUnHz
DO.desc: Regulation band for under-frequency (frequency deviation at which the control response is 100 percent activated)

DO.name: RegDbUnHz
DO.desc: Deadband for under-frequency (frequency deviation where no control action is taken)

DO.name: PwrRsvUnHz
DO.desc: Power reserved for under-frequency for frequency control

DO.name: HzPwr
DO.desc: Power currently activated for frequency control

LNodeType.Details: The ZRCT logical node defines the characteristics of the rectifier, which converts generator output AC to intermediate DC. See Table 23.

The ZINV logical node defines the characteristics of the inverter, which converts DC to AC. The DC may be the output of the generator or may be the intermediate energy form after a generators AC output has been rectified. See Table 24.

DO.name: Stdby
DO.desc: Inverter stand-by status - True: stand-by active

DO.name: CurLev
DO.desc: DC current level available for operation - True: sufficient current

DO.name: GridMod
DO.desc: Power system connect modes to the power grid

DO.name: PQVLimSet
DO.desc: Active curve characteristic curve for PQV limit

DO.name: PhBCnfg
DO.desc: Inverter Phase B feed configuration: see PhACnfg for enumerated values

DO.name: PhCCnfg
DO.desc: Inverter Phase C feed configuration: see PhACnfg for enumerated values

DO.name: HeatSinkTmp
DO.desc: Heat sink temperature: Alarm if over max

DO.name: FanSpdVal
DO.desc: Measured fan speed: Tach or vane

LNodeType.Details: The DCIP logical node supports the reciprocating engine characteristics required for remote monitoring and control of reciprocating engine functions and states.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: EngTmDeg
DO.desc: Engine timing as degrees BTDC (before top dead centre)

DO.name: ImpactHzPct
DO.desc: Frequency impact on the DER output as percent

DO.name: InOxFlwRte
DO.desc: Input air flow rate. Air needed in the motor compartment for the combustion process.

DO.name: TrsVLim
DO.desc: Transient voltage limits: Volts - Surge - mostly by magnitude

DO.name: HACrvPct
DO.desc: Table of ampere harmonics dependencies on DER operations

DO.name: HVCrvPct
DO.desc: Table of voltage harmonics dependencies on DER operations

DO.name: ChgLimVPct
DO.desc: Rapid voltage changes as percent of voltage

DO.name: ChgLimAng
DO.desc: Rapid angle changes as limits on degrees

DO.name: ChgLimRatAng
DO.desc: Rate of angle change as limits on degrees over time

DO.name: CrankCtl
DO.desc: True = on; False = off crank relay driver command

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlledLN) (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: WMaxVArCrv
DO.desc: PQ operating region of apparent power for max Q

DO.name: WMinVArCrv
DO.desc: PQ operating region of apparent power for min Q

DO.name: OcDirTms
DO.desc: Open circuit transient direct axis time constant

DO.name: OcSubDirTms
DO.desc: Open circuit subtransient direct axis time constant

DO.name: OcSubQudTms
DO.desc: Open circuit subtransient quadrature axis time constant

DO.name: ScDirTms
DO.desc: Short circuit subtransient direct axis time constant

DO.name: ScSubDirTms
DO.desc: Short circuit subtransient direct axis time constant

DO.name: ScSubQudTms
DO.desc: Short circuit subtransient quadrature axis time constant

DO.name: InerTms
DO.desc: Time for response to fault current (MW - seconds / MVA)

DO.name: X0
DO.desc: Per unit unsaturated zero sequence reactance.

DO.name: X2
DO.desc: Per unit unsaturated negative sequence reactance.

DO.name: Xd
DO.desc: Per unit unsaturated d-axis synchronous reactance.

DO.name: Xdp
DO.desc: Per unit unsaturated d-axis transient reactance Xd'.

DO.name: Xds
DO.desc: Per unit unsaturated d-axis subtransient reactance Xd''.

DO.name: Xqs
DO.desc: Per unit unsaturated q-axis subtransient reactance Xq''.

DO.name: Xqp
DO.desc: Per unit unsaturated q-axis transient reactance Xq'.

DO.name: Xq
DO.desc: Per unit unsaturated q-axis synchronous reactance.

LNodeType.Details: The DFCL logical node provides the fuel cell characteristics required for remote monitoring of critical functions and states of the fuel cell itself.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: ConnGriCnt
DO.desc: Count of reconnections to power system

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: InOxFlwRte
DO.desc: Input air or oxygen flow rate for the fuel cell chemical process

DO.name: FuelStop
DO.desc: True = open; False = close fuel valve driver command

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlledLN) (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: GriIndpWRtg
DO.desc: System power system independent output power rating

DO.name: GriDepRtg
DO.desc: System power system dependent output power rating

LNodeType.Details: The DSTK logical node supports monitoring of the fuel cell stack. Fuel cells are stacked together to provide the desired voltage level. The characteristics of a fuel cell stack that are included in the DSTK logical node are those required for remote monitoring of the fuel cell stack.

DO.name: StcSt
DO.desc: Stack state; True = on, False = off

DO.name: CelVTrCnt
DO.desc: Count of cell low voltage trips

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: (inherited from: StatisticsLN) Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: InOxFlwRte
DO.desc: Input air or oxygen flow rate for the fuel cell chemical process

LNodeType.Details: The DFPM logical node supports the fuel processing module of the fuel cell. The fuel processing module of the fuel cell is used to extract hydrogen from other types of fuels. The hydrogen can then be used in the fuel cell to make electricity. This LN can be combined with one or two DFUL LNs for a complete picture of fuel processing. The data included in the DFPM logical node are those required for remote monitoring of the fuel processing module.

DO.name: FPMSt
DO.desc: FPM state; True = on; False = off

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: OutFuelTyp
DO.desc: FPM output fuel type: e.g. Hydrogen, Reformate

LNodeType.Details: The DPVM logical node describes the photovoltaic characteristics of a photovoltaic module, including ratings.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: (inherited from: EquipmentInterfaceLN) Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: AVCrvIx
DO.desc: Index into active point of the AV curve

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: (inherited from: EquipmentInterfaceLN) State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: (inherited from: EquipmentInterfaceLN) Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: MdulAVCrv
DO.desc: Amp-Volt curve of module at STC3)

DO.name: MdulWRtg
DO.desc: Module rated power at active power peak STC

DO.name: MdulW200Rtg
DO.desc: Module rated power as active power peak at 200 W/m2

DO.name: MaxMdulV
DO.desc: Module voltage at max power at STC

DO.name: MaxMdulA
DO.desc: Module current at max power at STC

DO.name: MdulOcV
DO.desc: Module open circuit voltage (Voc at STC)

DO.name: MdulScA
DO.desc: Module short circuit current (Isc at STC)

DO.name: MdulWTmpDrt
DO.desc: Module power/temperature derate as percent of degrees above 25 C

DO.name: MdulATmpDrt
DO.desc: Module current/temperature derate as percent of degrees above 25 C

DO.name: MdulVTmpDrt
DO.desc: Module voltage/temperature derate as voltage/degrees above 25 C

DO.name: MdulDrtPct
DO.desc: Module age derating as percent over time

LNodeType.Details: The DPVA logical node support PV array characteristics. The photovoltaics array characteristics describe the configuration of the PV array. The logical node may be used to provide configuration information on the number of strings and panels or the number of sub-arrays in parallel. (Note that if the strings are individually controlled, the array characteristic is the same as string. In other words, a string becomes an array by itself).

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: (inherited from: EquipmentInterfaceLN) Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: (inherited from: EquipmentInterfaceLN) State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: (inherited from: EquipmentInterfaceLN) Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: StrgCnt
DO.desc: Number of parallel strings per sub-array

DO.name: SubArrCnt
DO.desc: Number of parallel sub-arrays per array

DO.name: ArrWRtg
DO.desc: Array active power rating (watts peak - watts p)

DO.name: Tilt
DO.desc: Assembly fixed tilt - degrees from horizontal (may be seasonally adjusted)

DO.name: Azi
DO.desc: Assembly azimuth - degrees from true north

LNodeType.Details: The DPVC logical node supports the photovoltaic array controller and reflects the information required for remote monitoring of critical photovoltaic functions and states. If the strings are individually controlled, one DPVC per string would be required to describe the controls. This logical node also provides list of the possible control modes that can be applied by the array controller. The control mode may change during the operation. The present status is then given by the array control status attribute.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: (inherited from: StatisticsLN) Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: ArrModCtl
DO.desc: Mode selected to control the power output of the array

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlledLN) (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: TrkDlSlpTms
DO.desc: Time delay for PV sleep test

DO.name: TrkSlpW
DO.desc: PV power point to begin sleep test timer

DO.name: TrkVStep
DO.desc: Voltage perturbation step of power tracker

LNodeType.Details: The DTRC logical node support the PV tracking system. The tracking controller provides overall information on the tracking system to external users. This LN can still be used for defining array or device orientations even if no active tracking is included.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: TrkAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: Tracking alarm - True: alarm condition

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: AziDeg
DO.desc: Device azimuth degrees from true north toward east positive

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlledLN) (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: StowAziDeg
DO.desc: Stow azimuth degrees from true north toward east positive

DO.name: StormAziDeg
DO.desc: Storm azimuth degrees from true north toward east positive

DO.name: SnwAziDeg
DO.desc: Snow azimuth degrees from true north toward east positive

DO.name: NightAziDeg
DO.desc: Night azimuth degrees from true north toward east positive

DO.name: MaintAziDeg
DO.desc: Maintenance azimuth degrees from true north toward east positive

DO.name: IntvAzi
DO.desc: Azimuth interval, for sensory tracking. Tracking, if absolute difference between actual tracker position and sun position is a higher interval value.

DO.name: IntvEl
DO.desc: Elevation interval, for sensory tracking. Tracking, if absolute difference between actual tracker position and sun position is a higher interval value.

DO.name: IntvTm
DO.desc: Time interval, for astronomical tracking. After this time interval tracking operation is done periodically.

DO.name: AziDegTgt
DO.desc: Target azimuth degrees from true north toward east positive

LNodeType.Details: The DCHC logical node supports the CHP controller. The CHP controller provides overall system information from the CHP system to external users, including identification of the types of equipment within the CHP system, usage issues, and constraints affecting the overall CHP system, and other parameters associated with the CHP system as a whole.

DO.name: EEName

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControlEquipmentInterfaceLN) Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: (inherited from: StatisticsLN) Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: HtEfcPct
DO.desc: Efficiency of heat production in percentage

LNodeType.Details: The DCTS logical node describes the characteristics of the CHP thermal storage. This LN applies both to heat storage and to coolant storage, and is used for measurements of heat exchanges.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: ThmCapPct
DO.desc: Remaining actual thermal energy capacity as percent of total available capacity

DO.name: ThmIn
DO.desc: Instantaneous thermal energy input into storage

DO.name: ThmOut
DO.desc: Instantaneous thermal energy output from storage

DO.name: ThmOutEst
DO.desc: Reference to the LN holding the estimated instantaneous thermal energy output over time (using time offsets)

LNodeType.Details: The DCHB logical node describes the characteristics of the CHP boiler system.

DO.name: EEName

DO.name: OpTmh

DO.desc: (inherited from: DomainLN) If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: BoilCtl
DO.desc: Boiler start and stop: True = Start; False = Stop
