DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: BlkRef
DO.desc: (inherited from: FunctionLN) Object reference of data object that sent the dynamically blocking signal n.

LNodeType.Details: The fuel characteristics covered in the MFUL logical node describe the type and nature of the fuel. See Table 37.

DO.name: GrossCalVal
DO.desc: Gross calorific value for the fuel

DO.name: FuelEffCoef
DO.desc: Rated fuel efficiency coefficient as percent

DO.name: FuelEfcPct
DO.desc: Fuel efficiency coefficient measured as percent

LNodeType.Details: The fuel delivery system covered in the DFLV logical node describes the delivery system for the fuel. See Table 38.
This logical node contains information related to monitoring and controlling power battery bank states and measurements.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: SocPro
DO.desc: State of the SOC protection of the battery. If true, this internal protection is actived, otherwise the battery is running under normal conditions.

DO.name: TestRsl
DO.desc: If true, battery test has succeeded, otherwise it failed

DO.name: DCSwCls
DO.desc: If true, the battery DC contactor (switch) is closed otherwise open.

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir

DO.name: ChaAmpLim
DO.desc: Instantaneous DC current limit on charging

DO.name: EffAhr
DO.desc: Effective Ampere-hour operational value, including after degradation

DO.name: DschAmpLim
DO.desc: Instantaneous DC current limit on discharging

DO.name: CelStrgCnt
DO.desc: Number of strings of cells currently connected

DO.name: AvlChaAhr
DO.desc: Available charge capacity: not yet stored and available for being charged in Amp-hours

DO.name: AvlDschAhr
DO.desc: Available discharge capacity: stored and available for discharging in Amp-hours

DO.name: ChaAhrTot
DO.desc: Total amount charged since last reset in Amp-hour

DO.name: DschAhrTot
DO.desc: Total amount discharged since last reset in Amphour

DO.name: SocEffAhrPct
DO.desc: State of charge as percentage in relation to the effective energy capacity of the storage resource with respect to the degradation so far (EffAhr)

DO.name: SocDvPct
DO.desc: State of charge deviation between calculated (estimated) value with direct measured (real) value (in %)

DO.name: VolChgRte
DO.desc: Rate of battery voltage change over time.

DO.name: CycSocRngPct
DO.desc: Soc (in Amp-hour) range (in %) at last time of the operating substantial charge cycle, defined as 'discharge and subsequent recharge of a cell or battery to restore the initial conditions'.

DO.name: CycAmpAv
DO.desc: Average current during last operating substantial charge cycle, defined as 'discharge and subsequent recharge of a cell or battery to restore the initial conditions'.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: ChaAmpMaxRtg
DO.desc: Maximum battery charge DC current rating

DO.name: EffAhrRtg
DO.desc: Effective total charge capacity rating in Amp-hours

DO.name: AhrMinRtg
DO.desc: Minimum resting amp-hour capacity rating allowed

DO.name: DschAmpMxRtg
DO.desc: Maximum battery discharge DC current rating

DO.name: ExtVolMaxRtg
DO.desc: Rating reflecting the maximum battery voltage while charging

DO.name: IntnVNom
DO.desc: Nominal internal voltage of the battery (non DC)

LNodeType.Details: The battery charger characteristics covered in the ZBTC logical node reflect those required for remote monitoring and control of critical auxiliary battery charger. See Table 40.
The XFUS logical node is used to model a fuse which can be described as a switch that is normally closed but can only open once. This equipment cannot be controlled. See Table 41.

DO.name: PkLetA
DO.desc: Peak let-thru current or Interrupting capacity

DO.name: TypV
DO.desc: Application voltage: True = DC; False = AC

LNodeType.Details: The role of this logical node is to provide information regarding sequences of actions during startup or stopping of a DER device. See Table 42.
This LN provides pressure measurements. See Table 44.
This LN describes the measurement of heat in the material (air, water, steam, etc.) used for heating and cooling. See Table 45.

DO.name: MaxHeatOut
DO.desc: Maximum heat output of heating system

DO.name: MatPct
DO.desc: Percent of container filled with material

DO.name: AccHeatOut
DO.desc: Accumulated heat output since last reset

DO.name: AccHeatCtl
DO.desc: Reset accumulated heat output since last reset

LNodeType.Details: This LN describes the measurement of flows of liquid or gas materials (air, water, steam, oil, etc.) used for heating, cooling, lubrication, and other auxiliary functions. See Table 46.

DO.name: MinXsecArea
DO.desc: Smallest restriction on flow: area of cross-section of restricted point

DO.name: FanSpd
DO.desc: Fan or other fluid driver speed

DO.name: MatLev
DO.desc: Material level as percent of full

DO.name: FanSpdSet
DO.desc: Set fan (or other fluid driver) speed

DO.name: MtrVol
DO.desc: Metered volume of fluid since last reset

LNodeType.Details: The DCTE LN covers the Cease to energize authorization, state, and external request, as well as the Return to service authorizations, state, and external request. Cease to energize causes the DER to stop exporting active power at the DER's ECP (as defined in the DO "ECPRef") with minimal exchange of reactive power. Return to service causes the DER to be able to start exporting active power and reactive power.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: CeaEgzReqSt
DO.desc: Current state of the request to the DER to Cease to Energize

DO.name: CeaEgzReq
DO.desc: If true, the cease to energize behavior of the DER is requested, otherwise return to service is authorized

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir

DO.name: CeaEgzAuth
DO.desc: Cease to Energize is authorized. True = authorized; False = not authorized

DO.name: CeaEgzReqCtl
DO.desc: Operating with the value expressed in ctlVal'selected among the list specified in CeasetoEnergizeStateControlKind' initiates the appropriate transition request. The reading of its attribute stVal is meaningless. The resulting state of the Cease-to-Energize request shall be observed in the CeaEngzReqSt DO

DO.name: RtnSvcAuth
DO.desc: Authorization setting that permits the DER to return to service. True = authorized; False = not authorized. If true, the DER may or may not initiate the return to service process, depending on other factors. The CeaEngz command sets this setting to False.

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: inherited from: OperationalFunctionLN) Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: RtnSvcAuto
DO.desc: If true, the DER is authorized to automatically return to service; if false, the DER must wait until an external RtnSvcAuth is received to allow it to return to service

Do.name: RtnRmpTmms
Do.desc: Return to service duration (ms) that is a time for ramping up that must not be exceeded. Active power shall increase linearly, or in a stepwise linear ramp, with an average rate-of-change not exceeding the DER nameplate active power rating divided by this return to service duration.

DO.name: RtnDlTmms
DO.desc: Time delay (ms) before returning to service fin order to ensure that both the frequency and voltage are within their high and low limits

DO.name: VArLimPct
DO.desc: Limit of reactive power permitted to be supplied or absorbed across the PCC during cease to energize as percent of VArMax '0 % - 100 %'.

DO.name: VHiLim
DO.desc: The voltage high limit of the normal voltage range.The measured voltage must be below this high limit before the DER may be allowed to return to service.

DO.name: VLoLim
DO.desc: The voltage low limit of the normal voltage range. The measured voltage must be above this low limit before the DER may be allowed to return to service.

DO.name: HzHiLim
DO.desc: The frequency high limit of the normal frequency range. The measured frequency must be below this high limit before the DER may be allowed to return to service.

DO.name: HzLoLim
DO.desc: The frequency low limit of the normal frequency range. The measured frequency must be above this low limit before the DER may be allowed to return to service.

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp time for moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

DO.name: ModPsAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in plus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: ModNgAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in minus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: SocUseMaxPct
DO.desc: Maximum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: The DECP logical node contains the operational characteristics of the Electrical Connection Point (ECP), to be used in all other cases than the PCC case (refer to DPCC).

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir

DO.name: GndSys
DO.desc: Grounding system at the electrical reference point

DO.name: VRef
DO.desc: Default reference voltage for functions using voltage at this ECP as input. It may be overridden by VRef setpoints in specific operational functions.

DO.name: VRefPct
DO.desc: Percent of VRef to use in calculating the voltage to use in operational function calculations

DO.name: WRtg
DO.desc: Electrical active power rating at ECP

DO.name: DERMsIncl
DO.desc: Indication whether the active power from the DER referencing this ECP is included in the measurements coming from the ECP. This is important for managing Generation and Load Following, as well as Peak Power Limiting functions.

DO.name: RefFrm
DO.desc: True = Producer Reference Frame; False = Consumer Reference Frame

DO.name: EcpIsldAuto
DO.desc: Islanded state autonomously determined. If true, islanded state is autonomously determined; if false, islanded state is provided by external data.

DO.name: ElcStCtlRef
DO.desc: Reference to status (and control) function associated to the ECP, typically the switching function XSWI, XCBR, CSWI LN classes

DO.name: ElcRefId
DO.desc: Identity of electrical reference point as a Visible String

DO.name: ElcMsRef
DO.desc: Reference to electrical measurement/calculation function, typically MMXU, MMXN or MMDC, MMTR LN instances

LNodeType.Details: The DPCC logical node contains the operational characteristics of a specific Electrical Connection Point (ECP) located between the local EPS and the area EPS, called PCC.

DO.name: AreaEpsWMax

DO.name: GndSys

DO.name: VRef
DO.desc: Default reference voltage for functions using voltage at this ECP as input. It may be overridden by VRef setpoints in specific operational functions.

DO.name: VRefPct
DO.desc: Percent of VRef to use in calculating the voltage to use in operational function calculations

DO.name: WRtg

DO.name: DERMsIncl
DO.desc: Indication whether the active power from the DER referencing this ECP is included in the measurements coming from the ECP. This is important for managing Generation and Load Following, as well as Peak Power Limiting functions.

DO.name: RefFrm
DO.desc: True = Producer Reference Frame; False = Consumer Reference Frame

DO.name: EcpIsldAuto
DO.desc: Islanded state autonomously determined. If true, islanded state is autonomously determined; if false, islanded state is provided by external data.

DO.name: ElcStCtlRef
DO.desc: Reference to status (and control) function associated to the ECP, typically the switching function XSWI, XCBR, CSWI LN classes

DO.name: ElcRefId
DO.desc: Identity of electrical reference point as a Visible String

DO.name: ElcMsRef
DO.desc: Reference to electrical measurement/calculation function, typically MMXU, MMXN or MMDC, MMTR LN instances

LNodeType.Details: This LN reflect the creation of a virtual connection point needed to be associated to an aggregated set of DErs when these one are not connected at the same ECP. It hosts a collection of physical/virtual ECPs each of them being defined by the system reference (ORG) of their corresponding LN.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir

DO.name: ElcStCtlRef
DO.desc: Reference to status (and control) function associated to the ECP, typically the switching function XSWI, XCBR, CSWI LN classes

DO.name: ElcMsRef
DO.desc: Reference to electrical measurement/calculation function, typically MMXU, MMXN or MMDC, MMTR LN instances

LNodeType.Details: The DER power management capability is basically a "black box" component that acts as the intelligence for managing DERs. Just like the other components of DERs, it can be hierarchical, with higher level power management systems managing lower level power management systems. The power management functions generally include applications that can use the input from the DER resources to assess situations and provide feedback to the DER resources in the form of modifying the settings, requests, or commands in order to meet specified "goals". These goals could come from an upper level power management function, operational functions, and DER operator input, each associated with different priorities

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: PFExtQudEsp
DO.desc: Effective PFExtension considered by the DPMC LN: True = Underexcited; False = Overexcited

DO.name: ReqPFExtQud
DO.desc: Complementary parameter of the ReqPF of same instance: True = Underexcited; False = Overexcited

DO.name: PQSt
DO.desc: status of the power vector expressed through one of the 9 zones of the PQ diagram quadrant, based on the signing conventions set with PFSign and PFExt, as requested from the attached DER

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: DifWEsp
DO.desc: Effective differential active power setpoint of the same instance considered by the DPMC LN

DO.name: DifVArEsp
DO.desc: Effective differential reactive power setpoint of the same instance considered by the DPMC LN

DO.name: PFEsp
DO.desc: Effective power factor setpoint considered by the DPMC LN

DO.name: ReqPF
DO.desc: Power Factor requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function

DO.name: ReqW
DO.desc: Active power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function

DO.name: ReqTotW
DO.desc: Total active power requested to the (DER) resource associated to this power management function. This resource may be hierarchically composed of many DERs.

DO.name: ReqWMin
DO.desc: Minimum active power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function.

DO.name: ReqWMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function.

DO.name: ReqTotWMin
DO.desc: Minimum total active power requested to the (DER) resource associated to this power management function. This resource may be hierarchically composed of many DERs.

DO.name: ReqTotWMax
DO.desc: Maximum total active power requested to the (DER) resource associated to this power management function. This resource may be hierarchically composed of many DERs.

DO.name: ReqVAr
DO.desc: Reactive power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function

DO.name: ReqTotVAr
DO.desc: Total reactive power requested to the (DER) resource associated to this power management function. This resource may be hierarchically composed of many DERs.

DO.name: ReqVArMin
DO.desc: Minimum reactive power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function.

DO.name: ReqVArMax
DO.desc: Maximum reactive power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function.

DO.name: ReqTotVArMin
DO.desc: Minimum total reactive power requested to the (DER) resource associated to this power management function. This resource may be hierarchically composed of many DERs.

DO.name: ReqTotVArMax
DO.desc: Maximum total reactive power requested to the (DER) resource associated to this power management function. This resource may be hierarchically composed of many DERs.

DO.name: WSpt
DO.desc: Active power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: DifWSpt
DO.desc: Active differential power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: WMinSpt
DO.desc: Minimum limiting setpoint of the DER's active power. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: WMaxSpt
DO.desc: Limiting setpoint of the DER's active power. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArSpt
DO.desc: Received reactive power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is applied.

DO.name: DifVArSpt
DO.desc: Reactive differential power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArMaxSpt
DO.desc: (Permanent control) Maximum limiting setpoint of the DER's reactive power. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArMinSpt
DO.desc: Minimum limiting setpoint of the DER's reactive power. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: PFSpt
DO.desc: Power factor set point. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: PFExtQudSpt
DO.desc: Complementary PF setpoint parameter of the PFSpt of same instance: (controllable) True = Underexcited; False = Overexcited. Its stVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: CeaEgzCtl
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates the cease to energize state of the DER (see definition of 'cease to energize'); operating with value false initiates the return to service (get back to Idle, then reflect the settings of any or all default settings, enabled operational functions, and/or schedules) of the DER.

DO.name: RenChaEna
DO.desc: if true, enables charging only from renewable source, otherwise allows charging from any sources

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (inherited from: ControllingLN) (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: DERRef
DO.desc: Reference to the DER resource LN (a child of DERResourceLN)

DO.name: OutEcpRef
DO.desc: Reference to a Electrical Reference Point LN (a child of ElectricalReferencePointLN) which the power management function has an impact on, using its associated resource (located at the output of the resource).

DO.name: FctRef
DO.desc: Reference to an Operational Function LN (a child of OperationalFunctionLN)

DO.name: StrWRpuPct
DO.desc: Soft-start reconnection active power ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax

LNodeType.desc: LN class to support mixed combined DER
LNodeType.Details: LN class to support mixed combined DER

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: DEROpSt
DO.desc: Current state of operation of the distributed energy resource.

DO.name: TestRsl
DO.desc: Set to true at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test) if all tests successful, otherwise set to false. Its value remains unchanged until a new test procedure is launched. Set systematically to false at warm or cold start of the equipment, and at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: TestAddRsl
DO.desc: Reflects the equipment test additional results at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test). Set systematically to value 'test running' at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: VAPct
DO.desc: Actual percentage of apparent power output based on VAMax

DO.name: AvlUpW
DO.desc: Available capability (measured or calculated) for increasing active output, including increasing generation of active power, even if currently consuming power.

DO.name: AvlDnW
DO.desc: Available capability (measured or calculated) for decreasing active power, including increasing the consumption of active power, even if currently generating power.

DO.name: AuthConn
DO.desc: (controllable) if true, the DER is authorized to connect, otherwise it has to remain (or become) disconnected. Authorization may come from an external source or may be a default setting.

DO.name: DEROpStCtl
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with the value expressed in ctlVal (selected among the list specified in DERStateControlKind) initiates the appropriate transition request. The reading of its attribute stVal is meaningless. The resulting state of the DER shall be observed in the DEROpSt DO.

DO.name: CeaEgzCtl
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates the cease to energize state of the DER (see definition of 'cease to energize'); operating with value false initiates the return to service (get back to Idle, then reflect the settings of any or all default settings, enabled operational functions, and/or schedules) of the DER.

DO.name: WSpt
DO.desc: Active power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArSpt
DO.desc: Reactive power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: EmgMod
DO.desc: (controllable) if true the DER shall operate in emergency mode, otherwise shall operate in normal mode. In emergency mode, emergency settings, emergency limits, and other emergencyrelated setpoints will be in effect.

DO.name: AuthDscon
DO.desc: (controllable) if true, the DER is authorized to disconnect, otherwise shall remain connected (if possible)

DO.name: TestEna
DO.desc: (controllable) If set to true, entering into test mode for the DER is allowed, otherwise forbidden

DO.name: Test
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates starting a test of the DER equipment and resets the values of TestRsl.stVal (set to 'false') and TestAddRsl.stVal (set to 'test running'); operating with value false aborts the test. The reading of the status indicates whether the equipment is under test or not. The content of such test is implementation dependant.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control commands and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function (except CmdBlk, Mod) have been blocked.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: InclDER
DO.desc: Reference to included combined DER resource. This DO points to an instance of DMDR.

DO.name: InclGn
DO.desc: Reference to included generator resource. This DO points to an instance of DGEN.

DO.name: InclSto
DO.desc: Reference to included storage load resource. This DO points to an instance of DSTO.

DO.name: InclLod
DO.desc: Reference to included load resource. This DO points to an instance of DLOD.

DO.name: EqGn
DO.desc: Reference to the equivalent DGEN instance reflecting the generation aspects of the DER

DO.name: EqSto
DO.desc: Reference to the equivalent DSTO instance reflecting the storage aspects of the DER

DO.name: EqLod
DO.desc: Reference to the equivalent DLOD instance reflecting the load aspects of the DER

DO.name: StrMaxTms
DO.desc: Maximum time from starting to connect to the grid until achieving grid connection

DO.name: OffMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time the DER needs to stay off after being switched off

DO.name: OnMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time the DER needs to stay on after being switched on

DO.name: StopDlMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time delay before stopping and/or disconnecting after a disconnect command received

DO.name: StopMaxTms
DO.desc: Maximum time from starting to disconnect from the grid until achieving grid disconnection

DO.name: StrDlMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time delay before starting or restarting after a connect command has been received

DO.name: AutoStr
DO.desc: if true, the DER can automatically initate its starting up

DO.name: AutoConn
DO.desc: if true, the DER can automatically initiate its connection to the grid

DO.name: PFSign
DO.desc: Power factor convention: IEC or EEI

DO.name: OplPct
DO.desc: Percentage of the changed value that must be reached in response to a step change in an open loop response time context (normally equals 90 % or 95 %)

DO.name: IsldCtlFol
DO.desc: DER behaviour in Islanded Mode. Determines how the DER behaves when in an Islanded configuration. False = Controlling Isochronous Mode. DER attempts to control voltage and frequency independent of configured curves and settings up to the limits of the machine's capabilities in order to achieve the Reference Voltage and nominal frequency. True = Following Droop Mode. DER acts as a follower using Volt/VAR and Freq/Watt curves.

DO.name: ClcTotVA
DO.desc: Calculation method used for total apparent power calculation: Vector or Arithmetic

DO.name: FllBckTmExp
DO.desc: Timeout period after which the fallback behavior must apply

DO.name: AvarZerWMax
DO.desc: Maximum reactive power absorbed in case of zero active power

DO.name: IvarZerWMax
DO.desc: Maximum reactive power injected in case of zero active power

DO.name: OutEcpRef
DO.desc: Reference to ECP directly connected at the output of the DER, the 'plug' part. Note: The power management function ECP associated to this same resource will refer to the 'socket' part.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

DO.name: PhsConnTyp
DO.desc: Phase type of electrical connection of the DER

DO.name: FltRtgPct
DO.desc: Exposure to fault rates as percent of ??

DO.name: RvSeq
DO.desc: Sequence (direction) reversed: False = ABC, true = CBA

DO.name: EfcRtgPct
DO.desc: Efficiency at rated capacity as percent

DO.name: RegClas
DO.desc: Regulatory classification, using text strings which may have pre-specified values. For example, for IEEE 1547:2018, the specified text is 'IEEE 1547:2018 Normal Category A (B) & Abnormal Category I (II,III)', where either 'A' or 'B' is stated for the Normal Category and either 'I', 'II', or 'III' is stated for the Abnormal Category

DO.name: HzNomRtg
DO.desc: Rated Nominal frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: HzMinRtg
DO.desc: Rated minimal frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: HzMaxRtg
DO.desc: Rated maximum frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: DERId
DO.desc: Internal identifier of the resource within a system which is using that resource. It complements the mRID defined as part of the EEname DO. Different DERIds may be defined for different system users.

LNodeType.Details: The Automatic Generation Control operational function (DAGC) is used by a Balancing Authority to increase/ decrease DER active power with the purpose of managing frequency.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: SocExpcTms
DO.desc: Time in seconds from now, associated with the expected State of Charge (SOC) and/or State of Energy (SOE), assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: WMinAvl
DO.desc: Minimum available active power for AGC function

DO.name: WMaxAvl
DO.desc: Maximum available active power for AGC function

DO.name: ReqW
DO.desc: Requested active power resulting from the function. Quality attribute shall be invalid when function is not active.

DO.name: SocExpc
DO.desc: Expected State of Charge (SOC) at SocExpcTms time from now, assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: SocWhExpc
DO.desc: Expected State of Charge expressed in Wh at SocExpcTms time from now, assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: WSpt
DO.desc: Active power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: WSptPct
DO.desc: Active power setpoint setting as a percentage of Maximum Active Power capability, WMax at the Referenced ECP, and in the case of signed setpoint (typically for storage systems) as a percentage of Maximum Active Power charging (consuming) capability for values related to the charging phase. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: RmpRteUse
DO.desc: Use ramp rates limit. True = limited to ramp rates ; False = Not limited to ramp rates

DO.name: RpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during generating (discharging)/injecting. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function. In case the output of the operational function is PF, the ramp rate is expressed dimensionless.

DO.name: RpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during generating (discharging)/injecting . Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function

DO.name: ChaRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp down rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: OutFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: OplTmsMax
DO.desc: Maximum (Fast-as-possible) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It may go as fast as it can, while still respecting any limiting ramp rates. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: OplTmsMin
DO.desc: Minimum (nofaster-than-this time) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It should not go faster than this time. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: InFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP input filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: RspTmms
DO.desc: Value of the response time (in ms) used by the low-pass filter applying to the input signal of the considered operational function. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp time for moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

DO.name: ModPsAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in plus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: ModNgAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in minus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: SocUseMaxPct
DO.desc: Maximum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: The DFPF logical node sets the power factor and the quadrant of the DER, with the possibility of different settings for generating and consuming. Also known as constant cos(phi).

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: ReqPFExt
DO.desc: Requested PF setpoint excitation information. If ReqPFExt is set to true = overexcited; If ReqPFExt is set to false = underexcited. If the quality attribute for this value is set to 'invalid', then the value of this requested DO is not valid and should not be used by other functions. Therefore, if this function is not enabled or has some other constraining factor, the quality attribute must be set to 'invalid'.

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: ClcExp
DO.desc: If true, calculation period of the statistical logical node has expired.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: ReqPF
DO.desc: Requested PF results as a measurement or calculation. If the quality attribute for this power factor value is set to 'invalid', then the value of this requested DO is not valid and should not be used by other functions. Therefore, if this function is not enabled or has some other constraining factor, the quality attribute must be set to 'invalid'. If PFGnTgt or PFLodTgt have not been defined, this is set to the default PF target.

DO.name: PFGnTgtSpt
DO.desc: Target power factor setpoint when generating. PFSign (in MMXU) defines what convention is in use. The power factor target is a number between -1 and 1, and is used in conjunction with PFGnExtSet to indicate whether it to set it over or under excited. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: PFGnExtQud
DO.desc: PF excitation setpoint when discharging / generating to indicate which quadrant to go to when switching from generating to charging: 0 = Injecting reactive power - Q1, 1 = Absorbing reactive power - Q4. Its stVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: PFLodTgtSpt
DO.desc: Target power factor setpoint when acting as a load (consuming, charging). PFSign (in MMXU) defines what convention is in use. The power factor target is a number between -1 and 1, and is used in conjunction with PFLodExtSet to indicate whether it to make it over or under excited. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: PFLodExtQud
DO.desc: PF excitation setpoint when charging / load to indicate which quadrant to go to when switching from load to discharging: 0 = Injecting reactive power - Q2, 1 = Absorbing reactive power - Q3. Its stVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: RmpRteUse
DO.desc: Use ramp rates limit. True = limited to ramp rates ; False = Not limited to ramp rates

DO.name: RpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during generating (discharging)/injecting. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function. In case the output of the operational function is PF, the ramp rate is expressed dimensionless.

DO.name: RpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during generating (discharging)/injecting . Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function

DO.name: ChaRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp down rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: OutFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: OplTmsMax
DO.desc: Maximum (Fast-as-possible) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It may go as fast as it can, while still respecting any limiting ramp rates. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: OplTmsMin
DO.desc: Minimum (nofaster-than-this time) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It should not go faster than this time. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: InFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP input filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: RspTmms
DO.desc: Value of the response time (in ms) used by the low-pass filter applying to the input signal of the considered operational function. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp time for moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

DO.name: ModPsAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in plus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: ModNgAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in minus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: SocUseMaxPct
DO.desc: Maximum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: LN DHFT defines High Frequency ride-through. Each curve defines the boundary between the different zones. - High Frequency Must Trip boundary - High Frequency Mandatory Operation boundary During the ride-through, tripping is blocked. The trip action is allowed to take place if the trip curve is crossed.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: ModRtSt
DO.desc: True = a Ride-Through event is occurring; False = no ridethrough event is occuring. The timestamp indicates the time of the last event.

DO.name: TrZnSt
DO.desc: True = the voltage or frequency of the Referenced ECP exceeds the Trip zone, False = the voltage or frequency does not exceed the Trip zone.

DO.name: CeaZnSt
DO.desc: True = the voltage or frequency of the Referenced ECP is within the Momentary Cessation zone; False = the voltage or frequency is not within the Momentary Cessation zone.

DO.name: PrmZnSt
DO.desc: Permissive state: True = the voltage or frequency of the Referenced ECP is in the 'may or may not' trip zone; False = the voltage or frequency is not in a 'may or may not' trip zone.

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: RtRs
DO.desc: Resetable/Presetable counter of voltage or frequency ride-through events

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: HzChgMaxRte
DO.desc: Maximum rate of change of frequency (ROCOF) for which DER must still remain connected

DO.name: EvtStopTm
DO.desc: Time that the voltage must remain in the Normal Operational zone before the ride-through event can be declared as ended.

DO.name: PreScCapMin
DO.desc: Minimum prefault short circuit capacity at referenced connection point in VA? [Are these one-time calculations or continuously updated? Are they different for different connection points?]

DO.name: PstScCapMin
DO.desc: Minimum postfault short circuit capacity at referenced connection point in VA?

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp timefor moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

DO.name: ModPsAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in plus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: ModNgAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in minus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: SocUseMaxPct
DO.desc: Maximum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.desc: Set active power level based on frequency using curves, for high frequency conditions
LNodeType.Details: The DHFW logical node supports the frequency-watt function for high frequency conditions, which sets or limits active power if the frequency exceeds the high specific frequencies.The DHFW logical node supports the frequency-watt function for high frequency conditions, which sets or limits active power if the frequency exceeds the high specific frequencies.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: WRef
DO.desc: WRef is established dynamically by the DER to the instantaneous power that the DER was generating (consuming) at the time when the function becomes active because the independent variable (frequency or voltage) has reached a triggering value (HzStr or VStr). Only valid during the event has been activated - otherwise the quality should be set to invalid. Its usage is conditioned by the value of WMaxRefSet.

DO.name: ReqW
DO.desc: Setpoint of the DER's active power generation (or consumption). Only valid when function is active (i.e. during the event) - otherwise the quality attribute should be set to invalid.

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: HzWCrv
DO.desc: Paired array of independent and dependent variables For crvPts: xVal = frequency (with increasing abscissas first optionally followed by decreasing abscissas for hysteresis ) yVal = active power or percent of WMax for generation and ChaWMax for consumption set by DepRef Active power curve delineating the gradients. There may be one or more gradients, with one curve per instance (defining the zone). The independent value of the each point of the curve establishes the starting point for the gradient, while the delta between succeeding points establish the gradients. - Zone 1: High frequency generating gradients - Zone 2: Low frequency generation gradients - Zone 3: High frequency consuming gradients - Zone 4: Low frequency consuming gradients Hysteresis path shall be described by adding points with decreasing abscissas at the end of the list of the points describing the initial path

DO.name: HzWCrvRef
DO.desc: Meaning of dependent variable in the frequency-watt curves

DO.name: WGra
DO.desc: If curves are not used, this defines a single active decreasing (increasing) power gradient while generating or consuming in percent of WMax per Hz during a high (low) frequency condition

DO.name: HzRef
DO.desc: Reference frequency set for this function. This could be different from HzNom if the Area Control Error is being corrected.

DO.name: HzStr
DO.desc: The frequency which must be higher (lower) than the reference frequency at which to start reducing (increasing) power output.

DO.name: HzStop
DO.desc: The frequency between nominal grid frequency and the high (low) start frequency at which any hysteresis effect ends and power output starts to return to normal following the hysteresis gradient.

DO.name: ChaWGra
DO.desc: If curves are not used, the active decreasing power gradient while consuming in percent of WMax per Hz during a high (low) frequency condition.

DO.name: HzChgRteTms
DO.desc: Time to average the rate of change of frequency (ROCOF) which could be used to respond to ROCOF events.

DO.name: HysEna
DO.desc: If HysEna = True, then use of hysteresis; If HysEna = False, then do not use hysteresis

DO.name: SnptBarEna
DO.desc: Determines if a dynamic or static boundaries should be used. If SnptBarEna = true, the actual active power output (input) is dynamically snapshotted to WRef and becomes the start of the boundary using the appropriate gradient (see WGra or gradients defined by curves). The DER tries to 'go-to' and stay on the gradient, whenever HzStr (for voltwatt, VStr) is exceeded. If curves are used, then the HzStr (VStr) is the independent variable in the first point of the curve. If SnptBar = false, the boundary remains statically defined and the active power output is only 'bounded' by the gradients and the maximum generation and minimum consumption, but is not being asked to go to the gradient boundary. In this case, the boundary must define a closed area.

DO.name: StrDlTmms
DO.desc: Activation Start Delay. Intentional delay in ms before function activation, used to ensure that the frequency has actually continuously exceeded the HzStr (or VStr) during that time period.

DO.name: StopDlTmms
DO.desc: Deactivation Delay. Intentional delay in ms before function deactivation, used to ensure that the frequency (voltage) is continuously stable during that time period within the normal frequency band between high HzStr (VStr) and low HzStr (VStr).

DO.name: WMaxRefSpt
DO.desc: Setting that enables/disables the use of WRef rather than WMax as the power output level to use as the basis of the frequency-watt curve. True = % of WRef per Hz; False = % of WMax per Hz. False is the default.

DO.name: RtnRmpRte
DO.desc: Ramp rate used after the frequency-watt (or volt-watt) function has released the active power value which can now return to any power level. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax per second.

DO.name: RmpRteUse
DO.desc: Use ramp rates limit. True = limited to ramp rates ; False = Not limited to ramp rates

DO.name: RpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during generating (discharging)/injecting. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function. In case the output of the operational function is PF, the ramp rate is expressed dimensionless.

DO.name: RpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during generating (discharging)/injecting . Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function

DO.name: ChaRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp down rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: OutFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: OplTmsMax
DO.desc: Maximum (Fast-as-possible) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It may go as fast as it can, while still respecting any limiting ramp rates. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: OplTmsMin
DO.desc: Minimum (nofaster-than-this time) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It should not go faster than this time. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: InFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP input filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: RspTmms
DO.desc: Value of the response time (in ms) used by the low-pass filter applying to the input signal of the considered operational function. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp time for moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

DO.name: ModPsAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in plus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: ModNgAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in minus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: SocUseMaxPct
DO.desc: Maximum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: LN DHVT defines the curves for high voltage ride-through events, the status during an event, and a count of events. Each curve defines the boundary between the different zones. For North America two curves may be required for the voltage-time profiles, but only the high voltage "Must Trip" curves are mandatory: 1) High Voltage Must Trip boundary 2) High Voltage Momentary Cessation boundary

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: ModRtSt
DO.desc: True = a Ride-Through event is occurring; False = no ridethrough event is occuring. The timestamp indicates the time of the last event.

DO.name: TrZnSt
DO.desc: True = the voltage or frequency of the Referenced ECP exceeds the Trip zone, False = the voltage or frequency does not exceed the Trip zone.

DO.name: CeaZnSt
DO.desc: True = the voltage or frequency of the Referenced ECP is within the Momentary Cessation zone; False = the voltage or frequency is not within the Momentary Cessation zone.

DO.name: PrmZnSt
DO.desc: Permissive state: True = the voltage or frequency of the Referenced ECP is in the 'may or may not' trip zone; False = the voltage or frequency is not in a 'may or may not' trip zone.

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: RtRs
DO.desc: Resetable/Presetable counter of voltage or frequency ride-through events

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: EvtStopTm
DO.desc: Time that the voltage must remain in the Normal Operational zone before the ride-through event can be declared as ended.

DO.name: PreScCapMin
DO.desc: Minimum prefault short circuit capacity at referenced connection point in VA? [Are these one-time calculations or continuously updated? Are they different for different connection points?]

DO.name: PstScCapMin
DO.desc: Minimum postfault short circuit capacity at referenced connection point in VA?

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: The DINV logical node defines the characteristics of the inverter, which converts DC to AC. The DC may be the output of the generator or may be the intermediate energy form after a generator's AC output has been rectified.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: InvACLosAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: Inverter detects loss of AC power

DO.name: InvDCLosAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: Inverter detects loss of DC power

DO.name: InvGriLosAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: Inverter detects loss of grid power

DO.name: InvSwAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: Inverter contactor switch open or closed: True = alarm, False = normal

DO.name: Stdby
DO.desc: If true, the inverter stand-by status is active.

DO.name: CurLev
DO.desc: If true, the DC current level available for operation is sufficient.

DO.name: DCPwrSt
DO.desc: if true, DC power of modules is connected to the rest of the system.

DO.name: TestRsl
DO.desc: Set to true at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test) if all tests successful, otherwise set to false. Its value remains unchanged until a new test procedure is launched. Set systematically to false at warm or cold start of the equipment, and at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: TestAddRsl
DO.desc: Reflects the equipment test additional results at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test). Set systematically to value 'test running' at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir

DO.name: DCVSpt
DO.desc: DC voltage setpoint of the inverter (the cold-up and warm-up attribute may be used as default configured values)

DO.name: DCPwrBlk
DO.desc: DC voltage setpoint of the inverter (the cold-up and warm-up attribute may be used as default configured values)

DO.name: Test
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates starting a test of the DER equipment and resets the values of TestRsl.stVal (set to 'false') and TestAddRsl.stVal (set to 'test running'); operating with value false aborts the test. The reading of the status indicates whether the equipment is under test or not. The content of such test is implementation dependant.

DO.name: WSpt
DO.desc: Active power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArSpt
DO.desc: Received reactive power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is applied.

DO.name: InvCtlSrc
DO.desc: Inverter control source: current, voltage, voltagecurrent

DO.name: WRtg
DO.desc: Electrical active power rating at ECP

DO.name: WVArVLimSet
DO.desc: Active curve characteristic curve for PQV limit.

DO.name: CmutSelf
DO.desc: If true, the converter is self commutated, otherwise it is line commutated.

DO.name: ClMthTyp
DO.desc: Type of cooling method: - Passive air cooling (heatsink) - Forced air cooling (fan + heatsink) - Fluid cooling (water) - Heat pipe

LNodeType.Details: LN DLFT defines Low Frequency ride-through. Each curve defines the boundary between the different zones. - Low Frequency Mandatory Operation boundary - Low Frequency Must Trip boundary During the ride-through, tripping is blocked. The trip action is allowed to take place if the trip curve is crossed.
