DO.name: WGra
DO.desc: If curves are not used, this defines a single active decreasing (increasing) power gradient while generating or consuming in percent of WMax per Hz during a high (low) frequency condition

DO.name: HzRef
DO.desc: Reference frequency set for this function. This could be different from HzNom if the Area Control Error is being corrected.

DO.name: HzStr
DO.desc: The frequency which must be higher (lower) than the reference frequency at which to start reducing (increasing) power output.

DO.name: HzStop
DO.desc: The frequency between nominal grid frequency and the high (low) start frequency at which any hysteresis effect ends and power output starts to return to normal following the hysteresis gradient.

DO.name: ChaWGra
DO.desc: If curves are not used, the active decreasing power gradient while consuming in percent of WMax per Hz during a high (low) frequency condition.

DO.name: HzChgRteTms
DO.desc: Time to average the rate of change of frequency (ROCOF) which could be used to respond to ROCOF events.

DO.name: HysEna
DO.desc: If HysEna = True, then use of hysteresis; If HysEna = False, then do not use hysteresis

DO.name: SnptBarEna
DO.desc: Determines if a dynamic or static boundaries should be used. If SnptBarEna = true, the actual active power output (input) is dynamically snapshotted to WRef and becomes the start of the boundary using the appropriate gradient (see WGra or gradients defined by curves). The DER tries to 'go-to' and stay on the gradient, whenever HzStr (for voltwatt, VStr) is exceeded. If curves are used, then the HzStr (VStr) is the independent variable in the first point of the curve. If SnptBar = false, the boundary remains statically defined and the active power output is only 'bounded' by the gradients and the maximum generation and minimum consumption, but is not being asked to go to the gradient boundary. In this case, the boundary must define a closed area.

DO.name: StrDlTmms
DO.desc: Activation Start Delay. Intentional delay in ms before function activation, used to ensure that the frequency has actually continuously exceeded the HzStr (or VStr) during that time period.

DO.name: StopDlTmms
DO.desc: Deactivation Delay. Intentional delay in ms before function deactivation, used to ensure that the frequency (voltage) is continuously stable during that time period within the normal frequency band between high HzStr (VStr) and low HzStr (VStr).

DO.name: WMaxRefSpt
DO.desc: Setting that enables/disables the use of WRef rather than WMax as the power output level to use as the basis of the frequency-watt curve. True = % of WRef per Hz; False = % of WMax per Hz. False is the default.

DO.name: RtnRmpRte
DO.desc: Ramp rate used after the frequency-watt (or volt-watt) function has released the active power value which can now return to any power level. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax per second.

DO.name: RmpRteUse
DO.desc: Use ramp rates limit. True = limited to ramp rates ; False = Not limited to ramp rates

DO.name: RpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during generating (discharging)/injecting. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function. In case the output of the operational function is PF, the ramp rate is expressed dimensionless.

DO.name: RpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during generating (discharging)/injecting . Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function

DO.name: ChaRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp down rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: OutFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: OplTmsMax
DO.desc: Maximum (Fast-as-possible) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It may go as fast as it can, while still respecting any limiting ramp rates. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: OplTmsMin
DO.desc: Minimum (nofaster-than-this time) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It should not go faster than this time. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: InFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP input filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: RspTmms
DO.desc: Value of the response time (in ms) used by the low-pass filter applying to the input signal of the considered operational function. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp time for moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

DO.name: ModPsAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in plus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: ModNgAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in minus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: SocUseMaxPct
DO.desc: Maximum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: LN class for aggregated loads resources

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: DEROpSt
DO.desc: Current state of operation of the distributed energy resource.

DO.name: TestRsl
DO.desc: Set to true at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test) if all tests successful, otherwise set to false. Its value remains unchanged until a new test procedure is launched. Set systematically to false at warm or cold start of the equipment, and at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: TestAddRsl
DO.desc: Reflects the equipment test additional results at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test). Set systematically to value 'test running' at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: VArTot
DO.desc: The total amount of reactive power without impacting active power output if the distinction between absorbing and injecting reactive power is not significant (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of AvarTot and IvarTot)

DO.name: AvarTot
DO.desc: The total amount of reactive power available for absorbing even if possibly impacting active power output (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArTot)

DO.name: IvarTot
DO.desc: The total amount of reactive power available for injecting even if possibly impacting active power output (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArTot)

DO.name: VArAvl
DO.desc: The amount of reactive power available without impacting active power output if the distinction between absorbing and injecting reactive power is not significant (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of AvarAvl and IvarAvl)

DO.name: AvarAvl
DO.desc: The amount of reactive power available for absorbing without impacting active power output (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArAvl)

DO.name: IvarAvl
DO.desc: The amount of reactive power available for injecting without impacting active power output (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArAvl)

DO.name: VAPct
DO.desc: Actual percentage of apparent power output based on VAMax

DO.name: AvlUpW
DO.desc: Available capability (measured or calculated) for increasing active output, including increasing generation of active power, even if currently consuming power.

DO.name: AvlDnW
DO.desc: Available capability (measured or calculated) for decreasing active power, including increasing the consumption of active power, even if currently generating power.

DO.name: AuthConn
DO.desc: (controllable) if true, the DER is authorized to connect, otherwise it has to remain (or become) disconnected. Authorization may come from an external source or may be a default setting.

DO.name: DEROpStCtl
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with the value expressed in ctlVal (selected among the list specified in DERStateControlKind) initiates the appropriate transition request. The reading of its attribute stVal is meaningless. The resulting state of the DER shall be observed in the DEROpSt DO.

DO.name: CeaEgzCtl
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates the cease to energize state of the DER (see definition of 'cease to energize'); operating with value false initiates the return to service (get back to Idle, then reflect the settings of any or all default settings, enabled operational functions, and/or schedules) of the DER.

DO.name: WSpt
DO.desc: Active power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArSpt
DO.desc: Reactive power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: EmgMod
DO.desc: (controllable) if true the DER shall operate in emergency mode, otherwise shall operate in normal mode. In emergency mode, emergency settings, emergency limits, and other emergencyrelated setpoints will be in effect.

DO.name: AuthDscon
DO.desc: (controllable) if true, the DER is authorized to disconnect, otherwise shall remain connected (if possible)

DO.name: TestEna
DO.desc: (controllable) If set to true, entering into test mode for the DER is allowed, otherwise forbidden

DO.name: Test
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates starting a test of the DER equipment and resets the values of TestRsl.stVal (set to 'false') and TestAddRsl.stVal (set to 'test running'); operating with value false aborts the test. The reading of the status indicates whether the equipment is under test or not. The content of such test is implementation dependant.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control commands and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function (except CmdBlk, Mod) have been blocked.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: InclLod
DO.desc: Reference to included load resource. This DO points to an instance of DLOD.

DO.name: DERUnit
DO.desc: Reference to the DER Unit LN which may be associated to this generic model LN

DO.name: EqLod
DO.desc: Reference to the equivalent DLOD instance reflecting the load aspects of the DER

DO.name: WMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate maximum Load active power rating at unity power factor

DO.name: WOvPFRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate active charging power rating at specified over-excited power factor

DO.name: WUnPFRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate active charging power rating at specified under-excited power factor

DO.name: AMaxRtg
DO.desc: Maximum current rating under nominal voltage under nominal power factor while charging

DO.name: VAMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate maximum apparent charging power rating

DO.name: WRpuMaxRtg
DO.desc: Maximum nameplate charging ramp up rating

DO.name: WRpdMaxRtg
DO.desc: Maximum nameplate charging ramp down rating

DO.name: WOvPFMax
DO.desc: Setting for maximum active power at specified over-excited power factor, OvPF

DO.name: WUnPFMax
DO.desc: Setting for maximum active power at specified under-excited power factor, UnPF

DO.name: WRmp
DO.desc: Default ramp rate for changes in active power: percentage of WMax per second

DO.name: VArMax
DO.desc: Setting for maximum reactive power if the distinction between absorbing and injecting reactive power is not significant (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of AvarMax and IvarMax)

DO.name: AvarMax
DO.desc: Setting for maximum absorbing reactive power (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArMax)

DO.name: IvarMax
DO.desc: Setting for maximum supply (injection) reactive power (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VArMax)

DO.name: AMax
DO.desc: Setting for maximum operational current rating under nominal voltage under nominal power factor

DO.name: VAMax
DO.desc: Setting for maximum apparent power while generating (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of AvaMax and IvaMax)

DO.name: AvaMax
DO.desc: Setting for maximum absorbing apparent power (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VAMax)

DO.name: IvaMax
DO.desc: Setting for maximum injecting apparent power (the use of this DO is mutually exclusive with the use of VAMax)

DO.name: VArSptRef
DO.desc: Reference for reactive power setpoints. Selects which setpoint is active.

DO.name: StrMaxTms
DO.desc: Maximum time from starting to connect to the grid until achieving grid connection

DO.name: OffMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time the DER needs to stay off after being switched off

DO.name: OnMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time the DER needs to stay on after being switched on

DO.name: StopDlMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time delay before stopping and/or disconnecting after a disconnect command received

DO.name: StopMaxTms
DO.desc: Maximum time from starting to disconnect from the grid until achieving grid disconnection

DO.name: StrDlMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time delay before starting or restarting after a connect command has been received

DO.name: AutoStr
DO.desc: if true, the DER can automatically initate its starting up

DO.name: AutoConn
DO.desc: if true, the DER can automatically initiate its connection to the grid

DO.name: PFSign
DO.desc: Power factor convention: IEC or EEI

DO.name: OplPct
DO.desc: Percentage of the changed value that must be reached in response to a step change in an open loop response time context (normally equals 90 % or 95 %)

DO.name: IsldCtlFol
DO.desc: DER behaviour in Islanded Mode. Determines how the DER behaves when in an Islanded configuration. False = Controlling Isochronous Mode. DER attempts to control voltage and frequency independent of configured curves and settings up to the limits of the machine's capabilities in order to achieve the Reference Voltage and nominal frequency. True = Following Droop Mode. DER acts as a follower using Volt/VAR and Freq/Watt curves.

DO.name: ClcTotVA
DO.desc: Calculation method used for total apparent power calculation: Vector or Arithmetic

DO.name: FllBckTmExp
DO.desc: Timeout period after which the fallback behavior must apply

DO.name: AvarZerWMax
DO.desc: Maximum reactive power absorbed in case of zero active power

DO.name: IvarZerWMax
DO.desc: Maximum reactive power injected in case of zero active power

DO.name: OutEcpRef
DO.desc: Reference to ECP directly connected at the output of the DER, the 'plug' part. Note: The power management function ECP associated to this same resource will refer to the 'socket' part.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

DO.name: PhsConnTyp
DO.desc: Phase type of electrical connection of the DER

DO.name: FltRtgPct
DO.desc: Exposure to fault rates as percent of ??

DO.name: RvSeq
DO.desc: Sequence (direction) reversed: False = ABC, true = CBA

DO.name: EfcRtgPct
DO.desc: Efficiency at rated capacity as percent

DO.name: RegClas
DO.desc: Regulatory classification, using text strings which may have pre-specified values. For example, for IEEE 1547:2018, the specified text is 'IEEE 1547:2018 Normal Category A (B) & Abnormal Category I (II,III)', where either 'A' or 'B' is stated for the Normal Category and either 'I', 'II', or 'III' is stated for the Abnormal Category

DO.name: HzNomRtg
DO.desc: Rated Nominal frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: HzMinRtg
DO.desc: Rated minimal frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: HzMaxRtg
DO.desc: Rated maximum frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: DERId
DO.desc: Internal identifier of the resource within a system which is using that resource. It complements the mRID defined as part of the EEname DO. Different DERIds may be defined for different system users.

LNodeType.Details: LN DLVT defines the curves for low voltage ride-through events, the status during an event, and a count of events. Each curve defines the boundary between the different zones. For the European low "fault-ride-through" voltage-time profile only one curve may be required. For North America two curves may be required for the voltage-time profiles, but only the low voltage "Must Trip" curves are mandatory: 1) Low Voltage Momentary Cessation boundary 2) Low Voltage Must Trip boundary

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: ModRtSt
DO.desc: True = a Ride-Through event is occurring; False = no ridethrough event is occuring. The timestamp indicates the time of the last event.

DO.name: TrZnSt
DO.desc: True = the voltage or frequency of the Referenced ECP exceeds the Trip zone, False = the voltage or frequency does not exceed the Trip zone.

DO.name: CeaZnSt
DO.desc: True = the voltage or frequency of the Referenced ECP is within the Momentary Cessation zone; False = the voltage or frequency is not within the Momentary Cessation zone.

DO.name: PrmZnSt
DO.desc: Permissive state: True = the voltage or frequency of the Referenced ECP is in the 'may or may not' trip zone; False = the voltage or frequency is not in a 'may or may not' trip zone.

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir

DO.name: RtRs
DO.desc: Resetable/Presetable counter of voltage or frequency ride-through events

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: EvtStopTm
DO.desc: Time that the voltage must remain in the Normal Operational zone before the ride-through event can be declared as ended.

DO.name: PreScCapMin
DO.desc: Minimum prefault short circuit capacity at referenced connection point in VA? [Are these one-time calculations or continuously updated? Are they different for different connection points?]

DO.name: PstScCapMin
DO.desc: Minimum postfault short circuit capacity at referenced connection point in VA?

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp timefor moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

DO.name: ModPsAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in plus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: ModNgAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in minus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: SocUseMaxPct
DO.desc: Maximum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: The DRGS logical node provides the settings for the dynamic reactive current support function. This function provides dynamic reactive current support in response to a sudden rise or fall in the voltage at the Referenced ECP. Since its purpose is to react to these sudden voltage spikes and sags, it considered as an emergency mode, but could be used not only if HLVRT is in effect, but also during normal operations which are experiencing locally-caused voltage spikes and sags.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: HiVRtSt
DO.desc: If true, high voltage ride-through incident is occurring

DO.name: LoVRtSt
DO.desc: If true, low voltage ride-through incident is occurring

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir

DO.name: ReqA
DO.desc: Requested amps, calculated based on the dynamic reactive current support algorithm.

DO.name: ReqVAr
DO.desc: Reactive power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function

DO.name: VArTgtSpt
DO.desc: Target reactive power setpoint as absolute value. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArTgtSptPct
DO.desc: Target reactive power setpoint expressed as percent as indicated by VArSetRef. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: ArGraMod
DO.desc: Mode of reactive current characteristic: selects between that behaviour where gradients trend toward zero at the deadband edges, and where the gradients trend toward zero at the centre False = Gradients trend toward zero at the deadband True = Gradient trend toward zero at the centre

DO.name: ArGraSag
DO.desc: Gradient for reactive current during a voltage sag (0 gradient implies no reactive current feed-in)

DO.name: ArGraSwl
DO.desc: Gradient for reactive current during a voltage swell (0 gradient implies no reactive current feed-in)

DO.name: VArSptRef
DO.desc: Reference for reactive power setpoints. Selects which setpoint is active.

DO.name: VArAct
DO.desc: Var set action on change between charging and discharging: True = VArAct switches between leading and lagging when active power changes sign, False = VArAct remains with the same sign (leading or lagging)

DO.name: RmpRteUse
DO.desc: Use ramp rates limit. True = limited to ramp rates ; False = Not limited to ramp rates

DO.name: RpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during generating (discharging)/injecting. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function. In case the output of the operational function is PF, the ramp rate is expressed dimensionless.

DO.name: RpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during generating (discharging)/injecting . Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function

DO.name: ChaRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp down rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: OutFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: OplTmsMax
DO.desc: Maximum (Fast-as-possible) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It may go as fast as it can, while still respecting any limiting ramp rates. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: OplTmsMin
DO.desc: Minimum (nofaster-than-this time) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It should not go faster than this time. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: InFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP input filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: RspTmms
DO.desc: Value of the response time (in ms) used by the low-pass filter applying to the input signal of the considered operational function. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp time for moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

DO.name: ModPsAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in plus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: ModNgAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in minus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: SocUseMaxPct
DO.desc: Maximum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: The DRTF logical node defines the characteristics of the rectifier, which converts generator output AC to intermediate DC.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: DCPwrSt
DO.desc: if true, DC power of modules is connected to the rest of the system.

DO.name: TestRsl
DO.desc: Set to true at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test) if all tests successful, otherwise set to false. Its value remains unchanged until a new test procedure is launched. Set systematically to false at warm or cold start of the equipment, and at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: TestAddRsl
DO.desc: Reflects the equipment test additional results at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test). Set systematically to value 'test running' at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir

DO.name: DCPwrBlk
DO.desc: DC voltage setpoint of the inverter (the cold-up and warm-up attribute may be used as default configured values)

DO.name: Test
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates starting a test of the DER equipment and resets the values of TestRsl.stVal (set to 'false') and TestAddRsl.stVal (set to 'test running'); operating with value false aborts the test. The reading of the status indicates whether the equipment is under test or not. The content of such test is implementation dependant.

DO.name: WSpt
DO.desc: Active power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArSpt
DO.desc: Received reactive power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is applied.

DO.name: CnvTyp
DO.desc: Type of AC to DC conversion.

DO.name: CmutSelf
DO.desc: If true, the converter is self commutated, otherwise it is line commutated.

DO.name: ClMthTyp
DO.desc: Type of cooling method: - Passive air cooling (heatsink) - Forced air cooling (fan + heatsink) - Fluid cooling (water) - Heat pipe

LNodeType.Details: This logical node contains information related to monitoring and controlling energy storage functions and states. It can apply to single element or to aggregated one.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: SocHiAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: if true, the maximum state of charge threshold of the battery (SocHiAlsPct) has been exceeded

DO.name: SocHiWrn
DO.desc: Warning trigger status: if true, the high state of charge warning threshold of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: SocLoAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true,the minimum state of charge threshold of the battery (SocLoAlsPct) has been exceeded

DO.name: SocLoWrn
DO.desc: Warning trigger status: if true, the low state of charge warning threshold of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: SohLoAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true, the predefined threshold of the low state of health of the storage resource (SohLoAlsPct) has been reached

DO.name: ChaCycCnt
DO.desc: Count of the number of equivalent full charge cycles

DO.name: DEROpSt
DO.desc: Current state of operation of the distributed energy resource.

DO.name: TestRsl
DO.desc: Set to true at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test) if all tests successful, otherwise set to false. Its value remains unchanged until a new test procedure is launched. Set systematically to false at warm or cold start of the equipment, and at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: TestAddRsl
DO.desc: Reflects the equipment test additional results at the end of the test procedure (just before Test.stVal goes from true to false to notify the end of the test). Set systematically to value 'test running' at the time a new test is initiated (when the Test.stVal goes from false to true).

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: InWh
DO.desc: Available energy capacity to be charged (in Wh)

DO.name: OutWh
DO.desc: Energy stored and available for discharging (in Wh)

DO.name: SocWh
DO.desc: Actual state of charge expressed in Wh

DO.name: UseSocPct
DO.desc: Usable state of charge (expressed as percent of total usable energy capacity UseWh) which may be directly measured or calculated

DO.name: SocEffWhPct
DO.desc: State of charge as percentage in relation to the effective energy capacity of the storage resource with respect to the degradation so far (EffWh).

DO.name: ChaWhTot
DO.desc: Total Energy Charged since last reset (in Wh)

DO.name: DschWhTot
DO.desc: Total Energy Discharged since last reset

DO.name: ChaVAPct
DO.desc: Actual volt-amps percentage charged based on ChaVAMax

DO.name: ChaAvarTot
DO.desc: The total amount of reactive power available for absorbing even if possibly impacting active power output while charging

DO.name: DschAvarTot
DO.desc: The total amount of reactive power available for absorbing even if possibly impacting active power output while discharging.

DO.name: ChaIvarTot
DO.desc: The total amount of reactive power available for injecting even if possibly impacting active power output while charging

DO.name: DschIvarTot
DO.desc: The total amount of reactive power available for injecting even if possibly impacting active power output while discharging

DO.name: ChaAvarAvl
DO.desc: The amount of reactive power available for absorbing without impacting active power output while charging

DO.name: DschAvarAvl
DO.desc: The amount of reactive power available for absorbing without impacting active power output while discharging

DO.name: ChaIvarAvl
DO.desc: The amount of reactive power available for injecting without impacting active power output while charging

DO.name: DschIvarAvl
DO.desc: The amount of reactive power available for injecting without impacting active power output while discharging

DO.name: EffWh
DO.desc: Effective actual total energy capacity (in Wh) provided by the storage resource. Due to degradation, the amount may be less than the rated total energy capacity (WhRtg).

DO.name: EffWhPct
DO.desc: Effective actual total energy capacity (expressed as percentage of WhRtg) provided by the storage resource. Due to degradation, the amount may be less than the rated total energy capacity (WhRtg). In case both WhEffCapPct and WhEffCap DOs are present in a same LN instance, the application shall ensure to keep the values of both DOs consistent.

DO.name: VAPct
DO.desc: Actual percentage of apparent power output based on VAMax

DO.name: AvlUpW
DO.desc: Available capability (measured or calculated) for increasing active output, including increasing generation of active power, even if currently consuming power.

DO.name: AvlDnW
DO.desc: Available capability (measured or calculated) for decreasing active power, including increasing the consumption of active power, even if currently generating power.

DO.name: ChaWhTotRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates the reset of the DO ChaWhTot (Total Energy Charged); operating with value false is ignored. The change of its status value is a local issue.

DO.name: DschWhTotRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates the reset of the DschWhTot (Total Energy Discharged); operating with value false is ignored. The change of its status value is a local issue.

DO.name: AuthConn
DO.desc: (controllable) if true, the DER is authorized to connect, otherwise it has to remain (or become) disconnected. Authorization may come from an external source or may be a default setting.

DO.name: DEROpStCtl
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with the value expressed in ctlVal (selected among the list specified in DERStateControlKind) initiates the appropriate transition request. The reading of its attribute stVal is meaningless. The resulting state of the DER shall be observed in the DEROpSt DO.

DO.name: CeaEgzCtl
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates the cease to energize state of the DER (see definition of 'cease to energize'); operating with value false initiates the return to service (get back to Idle, then reflect the settings of any or all default settings, enabled operational functions, and/or schedules) of the DER.

DO.name: WSpt
DO.desc: Active power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArSpt
DO.desc: Reactive power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: EmgMod
DO.desc: (controllable) if true the DER shall operate in emergency mode, otherwise shall operate in normal mode. In emergency mode, emergency settings, emergency limits, and other emergencyrelated setpoints will be in effect.

DO.name: AuthDscon
DO.desc: (controllable) if true, the DER is authorized to disconnect, otherwise shall remain connected (if possible)

DO.name: TestEna
DO.desc: (controllable) If set to true, entering into test mode for the DER is allowed, otherwise forbidden

DO.name: Test
DO.desc: (controllable) Operating with value true initiates starting a test of the DER equipment and resets the values of TestRsl.stVal (set to 'false') and TestAddRsl.stVal (set to 'test running'); operating with value false aborts the test. The reading of the status indicates whether the equipment is under test or not. The content of such test is implementation dependant.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control commands and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function (except CmdBlk, Mod) have been blocked.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: EqSto
DO.desc: Reference to the equivalent DSTO instance reflecting the storage aspects of the DER

DO.name: InclSto
DO.desc: Reference to included storage load resource. This DO points to an instance of DSTO.

DO.name: DERUnit
DO.desc: Reference to the DER Unit LN which may be associated to this generic model LN

DO.name: EqGn
DO.desc: Reference to the equivalent DGEN instance reflecting the generation aspects of the DER

DO.name: EqLod
DO.desc: Reference to the equivalent DLOD instance reflecting the load aspects of the DER

DO.name: SocHiAlsPct
DO.desc: High state of charge alarm threshold of the battery (in percent)

DO.name: SocHiWrsPct
DO.desc: Warning high state of charge threshold of the battery (in percent)

DO.name: SocLoAlsPct
DO.desc: Low state of charge alarm threshold of the battery (in percent)

DO.name: SocLoWrsPct
DO.desc: Warning state of charge threshold of the battery (in percent)

DO.name: SohLoAlsPct
DO.desc: Threshold alarm setting of the usable lower limit of the storage resource (in % of the usable capacity of the storage element (in Wh) - CapWhUseRtg )

DO.name: ChaWMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate maximum active power rating while charging

DO.name: DschWMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate maximum active power rating while discharging

DO.name: ChaWRmpRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate ramp rate for changes in active power while charging: percentage of WMax per second

DO.name: DschWRmpRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate ramp rate for changes in active power while discharging: percentage of WMax per second

DO.name: ChaWOvPFRtg
DO.desc: Active power charging rating at specified overexcited PF

DO.name: DschWOvPFRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate active power discharging rating at specified over-excited power factor, OvPFRtg

DO.name: ChaWUnPFRtg
DO.desc: Active power charging rating at specified underexcited PF

DO.name: DschWUnPFRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate active power discharging rating at specified under-excited power factor, UnPFRtg

DO.name: ChaVAMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate maximum apparent charging power rating

DO.name: DschVAMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate maximum apparent discharging power rating

DO.name: ChaAvarRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate rating for maximum absorbing reactive power while charging

DO.name: DschAvarRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate rating for maximum absorbing reactive power while discharging

DO.name: ChaIvarRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate rating for maximum supply (injection) reactive power while charging

DO.name: DschIvarRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate rating for maximum supply (injection) reactive power while discharging

DO.name: ChaVMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate rating for maximum voltage while charging

DO.name: DschVMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate rating for maximum voltage while discharging

DO.name: ChaVMinRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate rating for minimum voltage while charging

DO.name: DschVMinRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate rating for minimum voltage while discharging

DO.name: ChaAMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate rating for maximum current under nominal voltage under nominal power factor while charging

DO.name: DschAMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate rating for maximum current under nominal voltage under nominal power factor while discharging

DO.name: WhRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate energy storage capacity rating in Wh

DO.name: WhMaxRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate maximum amount of energy (in Wh) to be stored in the storage resource for e.g. supporting long life and avoid faster degradation

DO.name: WhMinRtg
DO.desc: Nameplate minimum amount of energy (in Wh) to be retained in the storage resource for e.g. supporting long life and avoid faster degradation or to ensure a reserve of energy stored for emergencies and other purposes.

DO.name: ChaSrcRtg
DO.desc: Net Energy Metering (NEM) Policy Mode which establishes whether the DER qualifies as renewable. Mode A = Storage may charge from the grid but may not discharge to the grid (acts only as load). Mode B = Storage may not charge from the grid but may discharge to the grid (charges from local energy source). Mode C = Storage may charge or discharge from the grid at will / in response to commands for location where there are no NEM integrity concerns.

DO.name: DschWMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power while discharging. (This DO is optional because WMax could be used)

DO.name: ChaWRmp
DO.desc: Default ramp rate for changes in active power: percentage of WMax per second while charging

DO.name: DschWRmp
DO.desc: Default ramp rate for changes in active power: percentage of WMax per second while discharging

DO.name: DschVAMax
DO.desc: Operational setpoint for maximum apparent power while discharging

DO.name: ChaAvarMax
DO.desc: Operational setpoint for maximum absorbing reactive power while charging

DO.name: DschAvarMax
DO.desc: Operational setpoint for maximum absorbing reactive power while discharging

DO.name: ChaIvarMax
DO.desc: Operational setpoint for maximum supply (injection) reactive power while charging

DO.name: DschIvarMax
DO.desc: Operational setpoint for maximum supply (injection) reactive power while discharging

DO.name: ChaVMax
DO.desc: Operational setting for maximum voltage while charging

DO.name: DschVMax
DO.desc: Operational setpoint for maximum voltage while discharging

DO.name: ChaVMin
DO.desc: Operational setting for minimum voltage while charging

DO.name: DschVMin
DO.desc: Operational setpoint for minimum voltage while discharging

DO.name: ChaAMax
DO.desc: Operational setting for maximum current under nominal voltage under nominal power factor while charging

DO.name: DschAMax
DO.desc: Operational setpoint for maximum current under nominal voltage under nominal power factor while discharging

DO.name: UseWhMaxPct
DO.desc: The energy reserve level above which the storage system may be only be charged in emergency situations, expressed as a percentage of the usable capacity, WhUseCap.

DO.name: UseWhMinPct
DO.desc: The energy reserve level below which the storage system may be only be discharged in emergency situations, expressed as a percentage of the usable capacity, WhUseCap.

DO.name: UseWh
DO.desc: Operational setpoint for usable energy storage capacity in Wh

DO.name: ChaSrc
DO.desc: Net Energy Metering (NEM) Policy Mode which establishes whether the DER qualifies as renewable. Mode A = Storage may charge from the grid but may not discharge to the grid (acts only as load). Mode B = Storage may not charge from the grid but may discharge to the grid (charges from local energy source). Mode C = Storage may charge or discharge from the grid at will / in response to commands for location where there are no NEM integrity concerns.

DO.name: ChaWOvPFMax
DO.desc: Charging active power maximum at specified Over-Excited Power Factor setting, OvPF

DO.name: DschWOvPFMax
DO.desc: Discharging active power maximum at specified Over-Excited Power Factor setting, OvPF

DO.name: ChaWUnPFMax
DO.desc: Charging active power maximum at specified Under-Excited Power Factor setting, UnPF

DO.name: DschWUnPFMax
DO.desc: Discharging active power maximum at specified Under-Excited Power Factor setting, UnPF

DO.name: RenChaEna
DO.desc: if true, enables charging only from renewable source, otherwise allows charging from any sources

DO.name: StrMaxTms
DO.desc: Maximum time from starting to connect to the grid until achieving grid connection

DO.name: OffMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time the DER needs to stay off after being switched off

DO.name: OnMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time the DER needs to stay on after being switched on

DO.name: StopDlMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time delay before stopping and/or disconnecting after a disconnect command received

DO.name: StopMaxTms
DO.desc: Maximum time from starting to disconnect from the grid until achieving grid disconnection

DO.name: StrDlMinTms
DO.desc: Minimal time delay before starting or restarting after a connect command has been received

DO.name: AutoStr
DO.desc: if true, the DER can automatically initate its starting up

DO.name: AutoConn
DO.desc: if true, the DER can automatically initiate its connection to the grid

DO.name: PFSign
DO.desc: Power factor convention: IEC or EEI

DO.name: OplPct
DO.desc: Percentage of the changed value that must be reached in response to a step change in an open loop response time context (normally equals 90 % or 95 %)

DO.name: IsldCtlFol
DO.desc: DER behaviour in Islanded Mode. Determines how the DER behaves when in an Islanded configuration. False = Controlling Isochronous Mode. DER attempts to control voltage and frequency independent of configured curves and settings up to the limits of the machine's capabilities in order to achieve the Reference Voltage and nominal frequency. True = Following Droop Mode. DER acts as a follower using Volt/VAR and Freq/Watt curves.

DO.name: ClcTotVA
DO.desc: Calculation method used for total apparent power calculation: Vector or Arithmetic

DO.name: FllBckTmExp
DO.desc: Timeout period after which the fallback behavior must apply

DO.name: AvarZerWMax
DO.desc: Maximum reactive power absorbed in case of zero active power

DO.name: IvarZerWMax
DO.desc: Maximum reactive power injected in case of zero active power

DO.name: OutEcpRef
DO.desc: Reference to ECP directly connected at the output of the DER, the 'plug' part. Note: The power management function ECP associated to this same resource will refer to the 'socket' part.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

DO.name: PhsConnTyp
DO.desc: Phase type of electrical connection of the DER

DO.name: FltRtgPct
DO.desc: Exposure to fault rates as percent of ??

DO.name: RvSeq
DO.desc: Sequence (direction) reversed: False = ABC, true = CBA

DO.name: EfcRtgPct
DO.desc: Efficiency at rated capacity as percent

DO.name: RegClas
DO.desc: Regulatory classification, using text strings which may have pre-specified values. For example, for IEEE 1547:2018, the specified text is 'IEEE 1547:2018 Normal Category A (B) & Abnormal Category I (II,III)', where either 'A' or 'B' is stated for the Normal Category and either 'I', 'II', or 'III' is stated for the Abnormal Category

DO.name: HzNomRtg
DO.desc: Rated Nominal frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: HzMinRtg
DO.desc: Rated minimal frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: HzMaxRtg
DO.desc: Rated maximum frequency of usage of the DER

DO.name: DERId
DO.desc: Internal identifier of the resource within a system which is using that resource. It complements the mRID defined as part of the EEname DO. Different DERIds may be defined for different system users.

LNodeType.Details: The Coordinated Charge/Discharge operational function (DTCD) manages the charging and discharging of storage over time with the goal of achieving a specified State of Charge at a specific time.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: SocExpcTms
DO.desc: Time in seconds from now, associated with the expected State of Charge (SOC) and/or State of Energy (SOE), assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: WhReq
DO.desc: Coordinated Charge/Discharge Energy Request. Calculated amount of energy that must be transferred (charge or discharge) to move the SoC from its current value to the target SoC.

DO.name: DurMin
DO.desc: Calculated coordinated Charge/Discharge Minimum Charging Duration. Minimum duration in seconds to move from the SOC at the time of reference to the target SOC, whether by charging or discharging

DO.name: ReqW
DO.desc: Active power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function

DO.name: SocExpc
DO.desc: Expected State of Charge (SOC) at SocExpcTms time from now, assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: SocWhExpc
DO.desc: Expected State of Charge expressed in Wh at SocExpcTms time from now, assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: WSpt
DO.desc: Active power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: WSptPct
DO.desc: Active power setpoint setting as a percentage of Maximum Active Power capability, WMax at the Referenced ECP, and in the case of signed setpoint (typically for storage systems) as a percentage of Maximum Active Power charging (consuming) capability for values related to the charging phase. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control commands and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function (except CmdBlk, Mod) have been blocked.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: SocUseTgtPct
DO.desc: Coordinated Charge/Discharge Target State of Charge. Charge that the system is expected to achieve, as a percentage of the usable capacity.

DO.name: DateTgt
DO.desc: Coordinated Charge/Discharge Target Date. Date and time by which the storage system must reach the target SOC.

DO.name: ChaDurMax
DO.desc: Coordinated Charge/Discharge Duration at Maximum Charge Rate. Duration that energy can be stored at the Maximum Charge Rate.

DO.name: DschDurMax
DO.desc: Coordinated Charge/Discharge Duration at Maximum Charge Rate. Duration in seconds that energy can be delivered at the Maximum Discharge Rate.

DO.name: RmpRteUse
DO.desc: Use ramp rates limit. True = limited to ramp rates ; False = Not limited to ramp rates

DO.name: RpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during generating (discharging)/injecting. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function. In case the output of the operational function is PF, the ramp rate is expressed dimensionless.

DO.name: RpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during generating (discharging)/injecting . Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function

DO.name: ChaRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp down rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: OutFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: OplTmsMax
DO.desc: Maximum (Fast-as-possible) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It may go as fast as it can, while still respecting any limiting ramp rates. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: OplTmsMin
DO.desc: Minimum (nofaster-than-this time) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It should not go faster than this time. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: InFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP input filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: RspTmms
DO.desc: Value of the response time (in ms) used by the low-pass filter applying to the input signal of the considered operational function. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp time for moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

LNodeType.Details: The DVAR LN defines the Set Reactive Power operational function. The amount of reactive power is set as a percentage of WMax, VArMax, or AvlVAr, or an absolute value of reactive power. Also known as Constant Q.

DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: RvrtTmExp

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: VArSptRef
DO.desc: Reference for reactive power setpoints. Selects which setpoint is active.

DO.name: VArAct
DO.desc: Var set action on change between charging and discharging: True = VArAct switches between leading and lagging when active power changes sign, False = VArAct remains with the same sign (leading or lagging)

DO.name: RmpRteUse
DO.desc: Use ramp rates limit. True = limited to ramp rates ; False = Not limited to ramp rates

DO.name: RpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during generating (discharging)/injecting. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function. In case the output of the operational function is PF, the ramp rate is expressed dimensionless.

DO.name: RpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during generating (discharging)/injecting . Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function

DO.name: ChaRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp down rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: OutFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: OplTmsMax

The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It may go as fast as it can, while still respecting any limiting ramp rates. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It should not go faster than this time. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

LNodeType.desc: Set reactive power based on voltage
LNodeType.Details: The Voltage-Reactive Power operational function establishes volt-var curves that are used autonomously by the DER to respond to changes in voltage over or under nominal voltage by changing reactive power as a means to counteract those voltage levels. Hysteresis path shall be described by adding points with decreasing abscissas at the end of the list of the points describing the initial path

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: VRefEsp
DO.desc: VRefEsp reflects the effective reference voltage used by the function

DO.name: ReqVAr
DO.desc: Reactive power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function

DO.name: VRefSpt
DO.desc: Reference voltage (VRef) setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested. The effective setpoint value is reflected in VRefEsp

DO.name: VArTgtSpt
DO.desc: Target reactive power setpoint as absolute value. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArTgtSptPct
DO.desc: Target reactive power setpoint expressed as percent as indicated by VArSetRef. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) Operations count, can be reset to a value different than 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: VVArCrv
DO.desc: Paired array of independent and dependent variables For crvPts: xVal = percent of nominal voltage (with increasing abscissas first optionally followed by decreasing abscissas for hysteresis ) yVal = Percent of reactive power, either % of active power WMax, or % of reactive power VArMax or VArAvl, as set in ReactivePowerReferenceKind

DO.name: VRefAdjEna
DO.desc: If VRefAdjEna is set to true, then the referenced voltage value (expressed through VRefEsp) is the continuously calculated value of voltage at the referenced ECP, based on low pass filtered value (averaging) over a specific time (VRefTmms), possibly corrected by VRefOfs. If VRefAdjEna is set to false, then referenced voltage value (expressed through VRefEsp) is the latest valid received setpoint VRefSpt

DO.name: VRefTmms
DO.desc: Time (in ms) over which to sample voltage through a low pass filter to create an average voltage over that time

DO.name: VRefOfs
DO.desc: Default reference offset voltage setting for functions using voltage as input at this ECP if there should be an offset from the VRef value.

DO.name: VVArCrvDel
DO.desc: Paired array of independent and dependent variables For crvPts: xVal = Delta voltage from nominal (VRefSet minus percentages of nominal voltage) yVal = Percent of reactive power, either % of active power WMax, or % of reactive power VArMax or VArAvl, as set in ReactivePowerReferenceKind

DO.name: VRefPct
DO.desc: Percent of VRef to use in calculating the voltage to use in operational function calculations

DO.name: VArSptRef
DO.desc: Reference for reactive power setpoints. Selects which setpoint is active.

DO.name: VArAct

DO.name: ModNgAcc

LNodeType.desc: Set active power level based on voltage
LNodeType.Details: The Voltage-Active Power operational function (LN DVWC) sets or limits active power based on high or low voltage. Either parameters or curves can be used. For California, the active power output is reduced at a rate of 25 % of real power nameplate rating per one percent of nominal voltage and the active power output produced by the smart inverter is reduced to 0 watts when the measured voltage is greater than 110 % of nominal voltage. The beginning use of the function is 106 % of nominal voltage. Also known as P(U).

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: ReqWMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function.

DO.name: VRefEsp
DO.desc: VRefEsp reflects the effective reference voltage used by the function

DO.name: WRef
DO.desc: WRef is established dynamically by the DER to the instantaneous power that the DER was generating (consuming) at the time when the function becomes active because the independent variable (frequency or voltage) has reached a triggering value (HzStr or VStr). Only valid during the event has been activated - otherwise the quality should be set to invalid. Its usage is conditioned by the value of WMaxRefSet.

DO.name: ReqW
DO.desc: Setpoint of the DER's active power generation (or consumption). Only valid when function is active (i.e. during the event) - otherwise the quality attribute should be set to invalid.

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control commands and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function (except CmdBlk, Mod) have been blocked.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: VWCrv
DO.desc: Paired array of independent and dependent variables For crvPts: xVal = voltage at the referenced ECP of this operational function yVal = active power or percent of WMax (ChaWMax), set by DepRef Maximum power curve delineating the limits for 4 zones - High voltage generating gradients - Low voltage generation gradients - High voltage consuming gradients - Low voltage consuming gradients

DO.name: VWCrvRef
DO.desc: Meaning of dependent variable in the voltage-watt curves.

DO.name: VRefOfs
DO.desc: Default reference offset voltage setting for functions using voltage as input at this ECP if there should be an offset from the VRef value.

DO.name: VRefPct
DO.desc: Percent of VRef to use in calculating the voltage to use in operational function calculations

DO.name: HysEna
DO.desc: If HysEna = True, then use of hysteresis; If HysEna = False, then do not use hysteresis

DO.name: SnptBarEna
DO.desc: Determines if a dynamic or static boundaries should be used. If SnptBarEna = true, the actual active power output (input) is dynamically snapshotted to WRef and becomes the start of the boundary using the appropriate gradient (see WGra or gradients defined by curves). The DER tries to 'go-to' and stay on the gradient, whenever HzStr (for voltwatt, VStr) is exceeded. If curves are used, then the HzStr (VStr) is the independent variable in the first point of the curve. If SnptBar = false, the boundary remains statically defined and the active power output is only 'bounded' by the gradients and the maximum generation and minimum consumption, but is not being asked to go to the gradient boundary. In this case, the boundary must define a closed area.

DO.name: StrDlTmms
DO.desc: Activation Start Delay. Intentional delay in ms before function activation, used to ensure that the frequency has actually continuously exceeded the HzStr (or VStr) during that time period.

DO.name: StopDlTmms
DO.desc: Deactivation Delay. Intentional delay in ms before function deactivation, used to ensure that the frequency (voltage) is continuously stable during that time period within the normal frequency band between high HzStr (VStr) and low HzStr (VStr).

DO.name: WMaxRefSpt
DO.desc: Setting that enables/disables the use of WRef rather than WMax as the power output level to use as the basis of the frequency-watt curve. True = % of WRef per Hz; False = % of WMax per Hz. False is the default.

DO.name: RtnRmpRte
DO.desc: Ramp rate used after the frequency-watt (or volt-watt) function has released the active power value which can now return to any power level. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax per second.

DO.name: RmpRteUse
DO.desc: Use ramp rates limit. True = limited to ramp rates ; False = Not limited to ramp rates

DO.name: RpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during generating (discharging)/injecting. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function. In case the output of the operational function is PF, the ramp rate is expressed dimensionless.

DO.name: RpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during generating (discharging)/injecting . Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function

DO.name: ChaRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp down rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: OutFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: ModNgAcc
