DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: The Active Power Following operational function (DWFL) has the purpose of maintaining the power level at the DER output at a level that tracks the level of a reference signal. In the case of load following, the output of the DER active power output rises as the consumption of the reference load rises. In the case of generation following, the DER active power absorbed increases as the output of the reference generation increases. The LN identifies the active power threshold for starting to follow the measured (or calculated) active power at the Referenced ECP. If the threshold value is negative, consumption is to be followed. If the threshold value is positive, generation is to be followed. A percentage of following is included. for counteracting the active power after the threshold has been reached.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: SocExpcTms
DO.desc: Time in seconds from now, associated with the expected State of Charge (SOC) and/or State of Energy (SOE), assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir

DO.name: FolWRef
DO.desc: Referenced Active Power Measurement that should be followed

DO.name: ReqW
DO.desc: Setpoint of the DER's active power generation (or consumption). Only valid when function is active (i.e. during the event) - otherwise the quality attribute should be set to invalid.

DO.name: SocExpc
DO.desc: Expected State of Charge (SOC) at SocExpcTms time from now, assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: SocWhExpc
DO.desc: Expected State of Charge expressed in Wh at SocExpcTms time from now, assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: WSpt
DO.desc: Active power setpoint. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: WSptPct
DO.desc: Active power setpoint setting as a percentage of Maximum Active Power capability, WMax at the Referenced ECP, and in the case of signed setpoint (typically for storage systems) as a percentage of Maximum Active Power charging (consuming) capability for values related to the charging phase. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: FolWThr
DO.desc: Active Power Threshold that triggers the start of following when the referenced active power is equal to or greater than the threshold.

DO.name: FolWPct
DO.desc: Active Power Ratio (percentage) of the active power discharged or charged to the referenced active power

DO.name: FolWTgt
DO.desc: Active Power value setting that sets the target net value from the combination of the followed and following DER

DO.name: RmpRteUse
DO.desc: Use ramp rates limit. True = limited to ramp rates ; False = Not limited to ramp rates

DO.name: RpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during generating (discharging)/injecting. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function. In case the output of the operational function is PF, the ramp rate is expressed dimensionless.

DO.name: RpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during generating (discharging)/injecting . Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function

DO.name: ChaRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp down rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: OutFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: OplTmsMax
DO.desc: Maximum (Fast-as-possible) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It may go as fast as it can, while still respecting any limiting ramp rates. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: OplTmsMin
DO.desc: Minimum (nofaster-than-this time) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It should not go faster than this time. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: InFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP input filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: RspTmms
DO.desc: Value of the response time (in ms) used by the low-pass filter applying to the input signal of the considered operational function. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp time for moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

DO.name: ModPsAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in plus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: ModNgAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in minus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: SocUseMaxPct
DO.desc: Maximum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection (PoC)), to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: The Set Active Power operational function (DWGC) is used to set a target active power value (generating or consuming) at the Referenced ECP that the DER should achieve. Although similar to AGC in that the DER ramps to the active power target, this function may be enabled and the target set by any authorized entity without any contractual characteristics or limitations imposed by AGC.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: SocExpcTms
DO.desc: Time in seconds from now, associated with the expected State of Charge (SOC) and/or State of Energy (SOE), assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: ReqW
DO.desc: Active power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function

DO.name: SocExpc
DO.desc: Expected State of Charge (SOC) at SocExpcTms time from now, assuming persistence of the current command

DO.name: SocWhExpc
DO.desc: Expected State of Charge expressed in Wh at SocExpcTms time from now, assuming persistence of the current command

Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

LNodeType.Details: The DWMX LN defines the operational function that causes the DER to limit its maximum active power at the Referenced ECP to the target value. If target value is negative, the DER is limiting consumption (load), sometimes called Peak Power Limiting. If the target value is positive, the DER is limiting generation.

LNodeType.desc: Set reactive power based on active power
LNodeType.details: The Active Power - Reactive Power operational function actively sets the reactive power output as a function of the active power output following a target active power - reactive power (Wvar or P-Q) curve. Also known as Q(P).

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: RvrtTmExp
DO.desc: If set to true, the revert timeout duration has been reached. Setting it back to false is a local issue.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir

DO.name: ReqVAr
DO.desc: Reactive power requested from either a (DER) resource controlled by this power management function or from a hierarchically lower Power Management function

DO.name: VArTgtSpt
DO.desc: Target reactive power setpoint as absolute value. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: VArTgtSptPct
DO.desc: Target reactive power setpoint expressed as percent as indicated by VArSetRef. Its mxVal attribute reflects the value of the setpoint that is requested.

DO.name: ModPrio
DO.desc: Priority relation of this mode (0..n) with higher numbers superseding lower numbers shall be a positive value, with the default as 0.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control commands and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function (except CmdBlk, Mod) have been blocked.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

DO.name: WVArCrv
DO.desc: Paired array of independent and dependent variables. For crvPts:xVal = Percent of WMax (with increasing abscissas first optionally followed by decreasing abscissas for hysteresis ). yVal = Percent of VArMax or VArAvl Hysteresis path shall be described by adding points with decreasing abscissas at the end of the list of the points describing the initial path

DO.name: WBarEna
DO.desc: True = reactive power output must stay on the curve; False = reactive power output is just constrained by the curve

DO.name: VArSptRef
DO.desc: Reference for reactive power setpoints. Selects which setpoint is active.

DO.name: VArAct
DO.desc: Var set action on change between charging and discharging: True = VArAct switches between leading and lagging when active power changes sign, False = VArAct remains with the same sign (leading or lagging)

DO.name: RmpRteUse
DO.desc: Use ramp rates limit. True = limited to ramp rates ; False = Not limited to ramp rates

DO.name: RpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during generating (discharging)/injecting. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function. In case the output of the operational function is PF, the ramp rate is expressed dimensionless.

DO.name: RpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during generating (discharging)/injecting . Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function

DO.name: ChaRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum active power ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: EmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp down rate. Ramp rate as percentage of WMax or VArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpuMax
DO.desc: Maximum emergency ramp up rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: ChaEmgRpdMax
DO.desc: Maximum ramp down rate during consuming (charging) / absorbing. Ramp rate is expressed as percentage of ChaWMax or ChaVArMax or AMax per second, depending on the output of the operational function.

DO.name: OutFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: OplTmsMax
DO.desc: Maximum (Fast-as-possible) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It may go as fast as it can, while still respecting any limiting ramp rates. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: OplTmsMin
DO.desc: Minimum (nofaster-than-this time) open loop response time in seconds. The DER should reach OplPct (e.g. 90 % or 95 %) of the delta between its current value and the requested value by the end of this time period. It should not go faster than this time. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: InFilByp
DO.desc: Set to true, the LP input filter is by-passed otherwise is active

DO.name: RspTmms
DO.desc: Value of the response time (in ms) used by the low-pass filter applying to the input signal of the considered operational function. Is equivalent to 3 tau in case of a first order low pass filter and the target percentage is equal to 95 %.

DO.name: ActDlTmms
DO.desc: Intentional delay in ms before operational function enabling

DO.name: WinTms
DO.desc: Time window within which to randomly initiate the actions specified by the enabled mode. If the time window is zero, the mode will be initiated immediately.

DO.name: RvrtTms
DO.desc: Timeout period (in seconds), after which the device will revert to its default status, such as returning to service or allowing maximum active power output, in case communications are lost or mitigating messages are not received.

DO.name: RmpTms
DO.desc: Ramp time for moving from current operational mode settings to new operational mode settings upon enabling of the mode

DO.name: ModPsAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in plus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: ModNgAcc
DO.desc: Average accuracy with which the function will follow the stated values of the dependent curve, in minus units from the stated curve value.

DO.name: SocUseMaxPct
DO.desc: Maximum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: SocUseMinPct
DO.desc: Minimum percent of SOC to use for the function

DO.name: InEcpRef
DO.desc: Referenced ECP which is the source of the measurement used by the DER mode. It consists of the index or address of the appropriate LN DECP. This address may be within the DER, or within a proxy of ECP, or within a device at the ECP.

DO.name: EcpConnTyp
DO.desc: Connection type of ECP: connection to DER (Point of Connection 'PoC', to load, within Local Electric Power System (Local EPS), Point of Common Coupling (PCC), or directly to Area EPS

LNodeType.Details: The KFLV logical node describes the delivery system for the fuel.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: EEName
DO.desc: Name plate of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: EEHealth
DO.desc: State of external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment to which the logical node is associated.

DO.name: OpTmh
DO.desc: Operation time of the external (electrical, mechanical or communication) equipment since start of the operation.

DO.name: Loc
DO.desc: If true, the control behaviour is allowed at this level.

DO.name: LocKey
DO.desc: If true, the operation has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: TmRalActrA
DO.desc: Timing rail actuator current. Use TmRalActrA1 for the first current and TmRalActrA2 for the second current.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control commands and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function (except CmdBlk, Mod) have been blocked.

DO.name: LocSta
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control authority is at station level and control from remote is disabled; otherwise control from remote is allowed.

LNodeType.Details: The KFUL logical node models fuel types, costs, efficiency, and amounts.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control commands and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function (except CmdBlk, Mod) have been blocked.

DO.name: GrossCalVal
DO.desc: Gross calorific value for the fuel.

LNodeType.Details: This Set of DOs is used as an extension of MMET LN. This logical node represents meteorological information, which can come from a meteorological station information or be a collection of meteorological information from many sources, that is, from sensors located at different places.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: DlDur
DO.desc: Daylight duration (time elapsed between sunrise and sunset).

DO.name: SnwDen
DO.desc: Snowfall density (typically in g/cm3 - density SIUnit [kg/m3]).

DO.name: SnwCvr
DO.desc: Snow cover (typically in mm - length SIUnit [m]).

DO.name: SnwEq
DO.desc: Water equivalent of snowfall (typically in mm - length SIUnit [m]).

LNodeType.Details: This Set of DOs is used as an extension of MMXU LN. This logical node represents calculation of electric measurement such as currents, voltages, powers and impedances in a non-phase-related system. The main use is for operative applications. The "Ext" suffix attached to the LN name is only there for editorial purpose and is not present in the real model

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: PFExtQud
DO.desc: Indication of the current PF measurement quadrant. if set to true, then it is indicating overexcited quadrant, otherwise it is indicating the underexcited quadrant. This information needs to be considered in regards of the PF sign convention.

DO.name: PQSt
DO.desc: status of the power vector expressed through one of the 9 zones of the PQ diagram quadrant, based on the signing conventions set with PFSign and PFExt, as requested from the attached DER

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: TotW
DO.desc: Total real power in a three-phase circuit [W].

DO.name: TotVAr
DO.desc: Total reactive power in a three-phase circuit [Var].

DO.name: TotVA
DO.desc: The total apparent power in a three-phase circuit [VA].

DO.name: TotPF
DO.desc: Signed power factor in a three-phase circuit. The power factor is defined as ratio of the absolute active power to the apparent power (acc. IEV 131-11-46). Sign is added and determinded by the PF sign convention (DO PFSign). Calculation method of apparaent power is defined by the data object ClcTotVA.

DO.name: A
DO.desc: Phase to ground/phase to neutral three phase currents.

DO.name: W
DO.desc: Phase to ground/phase to neutral real powers P.

DO.name: Var
DO.desc: Phase to ground/phase to neutral reactive powers Q.

DO.name: VA
DO.desc: Phase to ground/phase to neutral apparent powers S.

DO.name: PF
DO.desc: Phase to ground/phase to neutral signed power factors. The power factor is defined as the ratio of absolute active power to apparent power (acc.IEV 131-11-46). Sign is added and determined by the PF sign convention (DO PFSign). If current (I) and voltage (U) are sinusoidal and displaced by the angle phi, then the power factor is cos phi. Therefore, for the power factor per phase, value is contained in 'mag' and 'ang' is not used.

DO.name: Z
DO.desc: Phase to ground/phase to neutral impedances in a three-phase system.

DO.name: AvAPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of current of the 3 phases: average(Ia,Ib,Ic).

DO.name: AvPPVPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of phase to phase voltage of the 3 phases: average(PPVa, PPVb, PPVc).

DO.name: AvPhVPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of phase to reference voltage of the 3 phases: average(PhVa, PhVb, PhVc).

DO.name: AvWPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of active power of the 3 phases: average(Wa, Wb, Wc).

DO.name: AvVAPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of apparent power of the 3 phases: average(VAa, VAb, VAc).

DO.name: AvVArPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of reactive power of the 3 phases: average(VAra, VArb, VArc).

DO.name: AvPFPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of power factor of the 3 phases: average(PFa, PFb, PFc).

DO.name: AvZPhs
DO.desc: Arithmetic average of the magnitude of impedance of the 3 phases: average(Za, Zb, Zc).

DO.name: MaxAPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of current of the 3 phases: max(Ia,Ib,Ic).

DO.name: MaxPPVPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of phase to phase voltage of the 3 phases: max(PPVa, PPVb, PPVc).

DO.name: MaxPhVPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of phase to reference voltage of the 3 phases: max(PhVa, PhVb, PhVc).

DO.name: MaxWPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of active power of the 3 phases: max(Wa, Wb, Wc).

DO.name: MaxVAPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of apparent power of the 3 phases: max(VAa, VAb, VAc).

DO.name: MaxVArPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of reactive power of the 3 phases: max(VAra, VArb, VArc).

DO.name: MaxPFPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of power factor of the 3 phases: max(PFa, PFb, PFc).

DO.name: MaxZPhs
DO.desc: Maximum magnitude of impedance of the 3 phases: max(Za, Zb, Zc).

DO.name: MinAPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of current of the 3 phases: min(Ia,Ib,Ic).

DO.name: MinPPVPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of phase to phase voltage of the 3 phases: min(PPVa, PPVb, PPVc).

DO.name: MinPhVPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of phase to reference voltage of the 3 phases: min(PhVa, PhVb, PhVc).

DO.name: MinWPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of active power of the 3 phases: min(Wa, Wb, Wc).

DO.name: MinVAPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of apparent power of the 3 phases: min(VAa, VAb, VAc).

DO.name: MinVArPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of reactive power of the 3 phases: min(VAra, VArb, VArc).

DO.name: MinPFPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of power factor of the 3 phases: min(PFa, PFb, PFc).

DO.name: MinZPhs
DO.desc: Minimum magnitude of impedance of the 3 phases: min(Za, Zb, Zc).

DO.name: ClcTotVA
DO.desc: Calculation method used for total apparent power calculation: Vector or Arithmetic

DO.name: PFSign
DO.desc: Power factor convention: IEC or EEI

LNodeType.Details: This extension to the SBAT LN provides additional DOs for battery storage supervisory control.

DO.name: ClcNxtTmms
DO.desc: Remaining time up to the end of the current calculation interval.

DO.name: BatEF
DO.desc: If true, Battery Earth Fault is present

DO.name: CelVolLoAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true, the minimum limit of cell voltage has been exceeded.

DO.name: CelVolHiAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true, the maximum limit of cell voltage has been exceeded.

DO.name: DschAmpHiAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true, the battery discharging current has exceeded the maximum threshold

DO.name: DschAmpHiWrn
DO.desc: Warning trigger status: if true, the warning current threshold during discharging of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: ChaAmpHiAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: if true, the maximum current threshold during charging of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: ChaAmpHiWrn
DO.desc: Warning trigger status: if true, the warning current threshold during charging of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: IntnTmpHiAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: if true, the maximum internal temperature threshold of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: IntnTmpHiWrn
DO.desc: Warning trigger status: if true, the high internal temperature warning threshold of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: IntnTmpLoAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true,the minimum internal temperature threshold of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: IntnTmpLoWrn
DO.desc: Warning trigger status: if true, the low internal temperature warning threshold of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: UnbTmpAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: if true, the imbalance temperature alarm threshold of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: UnbTmpWrn
DO.desc: Warning trigger status: if true, the imbalance temperature warning threshold of the battery has been exceeded

DO.name: UnbVolAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: if true, the imbalance voltage alarm threshold of the battery/component has been exceeded

DO.name: UnbVolWrn
DO.desc: Warning trigger status: if true, the imbalance voltage warning threshold of the battery/component has been exceeded

DO.name: ExtTmpHiAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true, the high level threshold of the temperature external to the battery has been reached

DO.name: ExtTmpLoAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true, the high level threshold of the temperature external to the battery has been reached

DO.name: ExtVolHiAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: if true, the high external voltage of the battery has been reached

DO.name: ExtVolLoAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true, the low level threshold of the external voltage of the battery has been reached

DO.name: IntnVolHiAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true, the high level threshold of the internal voltage of the battery has been reached

DO.name: IntnVolLoAlm
DO.desc: Alarm trigger status: If true, the low level threshold of the internal voltage of the battery has been reached

DO.name: Mir
DO.desc: If true, the LN is a mirror and represents a LN from another LD that does not reflect this physical device. If false, it is recommended to omit the data object Mir.

DO.name: CelVolLo
DO.desc: Minimum cell voltage measurement of all cells since last reset

DO.name: CelVolHi
DO.desc: Maximum cell voltage measurement of all cells since last reset

DO.name: CelTmpMax
DO.desc: Maximum temperature of all cells in the battery

DO.name: CelTmpMin
DO.desc: Minimum temperature of all cells in the battery

DO.name: IntnTmp
DO.desc: Internal battery temperature in degrees C

DO.name: ExtTmp
DO.desc: External battery temperature in degrees C

DO.name: CelVolRs
DO.desc: (controllable) if set to true, initiates the reset of the calculated minimum and maximum of battery cell voltage measurements (CelVolLo and CelVolHi). Control with value false is ignored. The change of its status value is a local issue.

DO.name: OpCntRs
DO.desc: (controllable) If true, control commands and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function (except CmdBlk, Mod) have been blocked.

DO.name: CelVolLoAls
DO.desc: Alarm threshold reflecting the minimum limit of voltage of a battery cell

DO.name: CelVolHiAls
DO.desc: Alarm threshold reflecting the maximum limit of voltage of a battery cell

DO.name: DschAmpHiAls
DO.desc: High level discharging current threshold alarm setting

DO.name: DschAmpHiWrs
DO.desc: Warning threshold defining the high discharging current warning limit of the battery (in amps)

DO.name: ChaAmpHiAls
DO.desc: High charging current alarm threshold of the battery (in amps)

DO.name: ChaAmpHiWrs
DO.desc: Warning threshold defining the high charging current warning limit of the battery (in amps)

DO.name: IntnTmpHiAls
DO.desc: High internal temperature alarm threshold of the battery (in C)

DO.name: IntnTmpHiWrs
DO.desc: High internal temperature warning threshold of the battery (in C)

DO.name: IntnTmpLoAls
DO.desc: Low internal temperature alarm threshold of the battery (in C)

DO.name: IntnTmpLoWrs
DO.desc: Low internal temperature warning threshold of the battery (in C)

DO.name: UnbTmpAls
DO.desc: Alarm threshold defining the difference limit of the imbalance of temperature of the battery component e.g. module, bank, pack, string or cell (in C)

DO.name: UnbTmpWrs
DO.desc: Warning threshold defining the difference limit of the imbalance of temperature of the battery component e.g. module, bank, pack, string or cell (in C)

DO.name: UnbVolAls
DO.desc: Alarm threshold defining the difference limit of the imbalance of voltage of the battery component e.g. module, bank, pack, string or cell

DO.name: UnbVolWrs
DO.desc: Warning threshold defining the difference limit of the imbalance of voltage of the battery component e.g. module, bank, pack, string or cell

DO.name: ExtTmpHiAls
DO.desc: High temperature external to battery alarm threshold.

DO.name: ExtTmpLoAls
DO.desc: Low temperature external to battery alarm threshold.

DO.name: ExtVolHiAls
DO.desc: High level battery external voltage threshold alarm setting.

DO.name: ExtVolLoAls
DO.desc: Low battery external voltage threshold alarm setting.

DO.name: IntnVolMxLim
DO.desc: Internal instantaneous (duration up to implementation) maximum (DC) voltage limit

DO.name: IntnVolMnLim
DO.desc: Internal instantaneous (duration up to implementation) minimum (DC) voltage limit

DO.name: IntnVolHiAls
DO.desc: High level battery internal voltage alarm threshold.

DO.name: IntnVolLoAls
DO.desc: Low level battery internal voltage alarm threshold.

EnumType.EnumVal: Currency as per ISO 4217 per SI unit
Connection of one DER to local load
Connection of group of DERs to local EPS serving local load
Connection of local EPS with local load to area EPS (PCC)
Connection of local EPS without local load to area EPS (PCC)
Waste/other coal (includes anthracite culm, bituminous gob, fine coal, lignite waste, waste coal)
Coal-based synfuel, including briquettes, pellets, or extrusions, which are formed by binding materials or processes that recycle materials
Distillate fuel oil (diesel, No. 1, No. 2, and No. 4 fuel oils)
Residual fuel oil (No. 5, No. 6 fuel oils, and bunker C fuel oil)
Waste/other oil (including crude oil, liquid butane, liquid propane, oil waste, rerefined motor oil, sludge oil, tar oil, or other petroleum-based liquid wastes)
Wood/wood waste solids (paper pellets, railroad ties, utility poles, wood chips, bark, an other wood waste solids)
Wood waste liquids excluding black liquor (BLQ) (Includes red liquor, sludge wood, spent sulfite liquor, and other woodbased liquids)
Other biomass gas(includes digester gas, methane, and other biomass gases)
Water at a conventional hydroelectric turbine

Waste heat not directly attributed to a fuel source. Note that WH should only be reported where the fuel source for the waste heat is undetermined, and for combined cycle steam turbines that are not supplementary fired
Single axis - vertical axis of rotation
Single axis - inclined axis of rotation (north-south)
Single axis - horizontal axis of rotation (north-south)
Dual axis - horizontal and vertical axis of rotation
Dual axis - two dependent horizontal axes of rotation - main axis north-south
Dual axis - two dependent horizontal axes of rotation - main axis east-west
Very fast acting (high speed fuse), normally for semiconductors protection
CTE auth and requested but DER not in CTE mode
DER in CTE mode but RTS not authorized
DER in CTE, RTS auth and not requested
P greater than zero, Q greater than zero
P less than zero, Q greater than zero
P less than zero, Q less than zero
P greater than zero, Q less than zero
P equals zero, Q greater than zero
P equals zero, Q less than zero
P greater than zero, Q equals zero
P less than zero, Q equals zero
P equals zero, Q equals zero
on but disconnected and not ready
stopping and disconnecting under emergency conditions
PoC: Electric point positioned at the connection of the DER to its local EPS
IntDER: Electric point positioned internally to the DER
PCC: Electric point positioned at the connection of local EPS to area EPS - the EPS contains DERs including local loads
PCCD: specific PCC when the EPS contains only DERs with no loads
PoCoL: Electric point positioned at the connection of load within the DER local EPS
ExtPCC: Electric point positioned at the connection to a PCC external to the area EPS
ExtPoC: Electric point positioned at the connection of DER within local EPS outside of the DER local EPS
AuxLoad: Connection of auxilliary load to DER
PoCG: Connection of group of possibly different types of DERs to local EPS
Active power as percent of maximum active power
Active power as percent of snapshot active power reference
Active power as percent of the available range active power
Active power as percent of the full range active power
Reactive power in percent of WMax
Reactive power in percent of VArMax
Reactive power in percent of VArAvl
Storage may not export to grid, but may charge
Storage may export to grid, but not charge
Storage may both charge or discharge from the grid
Active power as percent of maximum active power
Active power as percent of snapshot active power reference
Active power as percent of the available range active power
Active power as percent of the full range active power

NS.name: IEC 61850-7-410
NS.application: Hydroelectric power plants - Communication for monitoring and control

LNodeType.Details: Logical node ACTM shall be used to present information about different control modes of any control or regulating system. One logical node ACTM must be created for each available control mode.

DO.name: ModAct
DO.desc: If TRUE this mode is active

LNodeType.Details: The joint control logical node is used to co-ordinate the power production of a power plant with more than one production unit. The joint control function will normally try to optimise the power production between units already in operation. In this control mode, the power plant can be controlled as a single unit. The data attributes shall be instantiated to provide one instance per generating unit to be included in the joint control. Compare also with the HJCL logical node, which can be used to control water flow trough a single object of a hydropower plant. Instantiated parts shall be defined in the extended private parts.

DO.name: RSpt
DO.desc: Raise set-point in IED for unit {inst}

DO.name: LSpt
DO.desc: Lower set-point in IED for unit {inst}

DO.name: PwrOut
DO.desc: Contributing power output of the plant (included in the joint control)

DO.name: PwrOutTot
DO.desc: Total power output of the plant

DO.name: JCtlTag
DO.desc: Joint Control Maintenance tag affixed to the equipment

DO.name: UntTag
DO.desc: Maintenance tag affixed to the unit {inst}

LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall be used to represent a PSS 4B filter as given by the IEEE 421.5-2005. It is possible to use the generic filter function FFIL of IEC 61850-7-4 as an alternative, however the data object names will then not match the names of variables in the IEEE document. See reference [5]1 for more details on PSS functions.

DO.name: InputLIHz
DO.desc: Test Input Low- and intermediate frequency

DO.name: HiLim
DO.desc: High limit reached, PSS - filter output

DO.name: LoLim
DO.desc: Low limit reached, PSS - filter output

DO.name: OutLBG
DO.desc: Output of Low Frequency part before gain

DO.name: OutIBG
DO.desc: Output of Intermediate Frequency part before gain

DO.name: OutHBG
DO.desc: Output of High Frequency part before gain

LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall be used to represent common information and settings of a power system stabilizing (PSS) function.

DO.name: PreSelPss
DO.desc: Pre-select PSS 4B if true, Pre-select PSS2A/2B if false

DO.name: T1Tms
DO.desc: Time constant T1, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: T2Tms
DO.desc: Time constant T2, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: T3Tms
DO.desc: Time constant T3, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: T4Tms
DO.desc: Time constant T4, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: T10Tms
DO.desc: Time constant T10, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: T11Tms
DO.desc: Time constant T11, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: T8Tms
DO.desc: Time constant T8, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: T9Tms
DO.desc: Time constant T9, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: N
DO.desc: Ramptrack overall degree N, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: M
DO.desc: Ramptrack lowpass degree M, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: T7Tms
DO.desc: Time constant T7, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

DO.name: TwTms
DO.desc: Time constant wash out Tw{inst}, according to IEEE 421.5-2005

LNodeType.Details: Logical node FHBT shall be used to represent a heartbeat. This logical node is used to validate that a task is still running. FHBT should be used with FXOT as a trip function.

DO.name: Cnt
DO.desc: Heartbeat counter, no overflow action, starting at zero

LNodeType.Details: Logical node FSCH shall be used to represent a task scheduler. The task scheduler is used to replace the operator when there are repetitive tasks or tasks on set dates in a calendar.

This functional logical node represents the functional priority status of equipments or controller. Examples of equipments are pumps, thermal elements, valves, and fans. In the case of controllers, this node may be used to control modular redundancy or in step controllers. The control mode CtlMod determines which type of algorithm is used to determine the order with which the equipment or controller are used. The master priority StrPrt of each equipment or controller determines in what order the master token is passed when the CtlMod is in Alternate mode. The priority status will indicate where every piece of equipment is located in the start priority.

DO.name: CtlMod
DO.desc: Control mode for establishing a priority

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HBRG shall be used to represent the physical device bearing. It can be used to represent both thrust and guide bearings. One instance shall be used per bearing.

Logical node HCOM shall be used to represent the function that optimises the relation between net head, guide vane and runner blade positions in order to achieve best possible efficiency. It is normally a part of the governor logical device and the functionality is based on one or more 2-D curves. If more than one curve is defined, one instance shall be used per curve.

DO.name: CrvSet
DO.desc: Definition of three-dimensional curve as set of two-dimensional curves

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HDAM shall be used to represent the dam of a hydropower plant. It is basically used to provide a reference tag for the dam holding basic design information. In case the functional aspect of the dam shall be represented, the logical node HRES shall be used, see 5.6.19.
Logical node HDFL shall be used to represent the deflector control of a Pelton turbine.

DO.name: PosCls
DO.desc: Closed end position reached (deflector cannot move further)

DO.name: PosOpn
DO.desc: Open end position reached (deflector cannot move further)

DO.name: Stuck
DO.desc: Device is blocked through external influence

DO.name: DflMan
DO.desc: Manual operation of deflector is active

DO.name: OpnLim
DO.desc: Opening limit of deflector position (temporary restriction)

DO.name: Incr
DO.desc: Increment of position change for open / close commands

DO.name: PosDeg
DO.desc: Deflector position given as 0 deg to 90 ..

DO.name: Flw
DO.desc: Calculated liquid flow through the deflector [m3 / s]

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HDLS shall be used to represent a leakage supervision system for a dam.

DO.name: Flw
DO.desc: Water flow at point of measurement [m3/s]

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HEBR shall be used to represent the physical device of an electrical brake. The brake is used to stop the rotation of the shaft during power down of the unit using electric power.
Logical node HGOV shall be used to present information about different control modes of a turbine governor. One logical node HGOV must be created for each possible operation mode.

DO.name: ModAct
DO.desc: If TRUE this mode is active

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HGPI shall be used to represent a physical device that provides the position of a gate. It shall be used for gates where the full open position (or fully closed position) is dependent on the actual upper water level of the dam. The position is given either as a distance for straight gates or as an angular displacement for sector gates.

DO.name: GtePosRad
DO.desc: Gate position given as angular displacement (rad)

DO.name: GtePosDeg
DO.desc: Gate position given as angular displacement (degrees)

DO.name: GtePosCm
DO.desc: Gate position given as distance from full closed (cm)

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HGTE shall be used to represent a dam gate. It is intended for gates where the full open or full closed position is dependent on the water level of the dam. For gates inserted in a dam in such a way that the upper water level is always above the upper part of the gate, the valve logical node (HVLV) is recommended. For calculation of water flow, a FCSD logical node that holds the relation between water level, opening and flow, should be included in the same logical device.

DO.name: PosUp
DO.desc: Upper end position reached (gate cannot move further)

DO.name: PosDn
DO.desc: Lower end position reached (gate cannot move further)

DO.name: GteBlk
DO.desc: Gate is blocked (cannot move from present position)

DO.name: GteUpLim
DO.desc: Upper limit of gate position (temporary restriction)

DO.name: GteLoLim
DO.desc: Lower limit of gate position (temporary restriction)

DO.name: Incr
DO.desc: Increment of position change for raise / lower commands

DO.name: Flw
DO.desc: Calculated water flow through the gate [m3/s]

DO.name: Tag
DO.desc: Maintenance tag affixed to the device

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HITG shall be used to model the intake gates. If operated they will be either raised fully or lowered fully, mid positions are not used during continuous operation. However, start sequencers might need to operate the gate at different speeds during different parts of the movement or keep the gate at a certain position for some time, before continuing movement. To cater for this, intake gates are often provided with position switches. In order to not limit the number of switches, the position switches can be instantiated.

DO.name: PosUp
DO.desc: Upper end position reached (gate cannot move further)

DO.name: PosDn
DO.desc: Lower end position reached (gate cannot move further)

DO.name: GteBlk
DO.desc: Gate is blocked (cannot move from present position)

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HJCL shall be used when a hydropower plant is operated in a constant water flow or a constant upper water level mode. That is, the power production level is subordinated the water control. The joint control logical node is used to co-ordinate the water flow through the plant, through turbines as well as gates. The joint control function will normally try to optimise the power output for a given flow. It can open or close gates that are not blocked from operation, it can increase or decrease the active power from turbines but it cannot start or stop a unit. Some data objects may be instantiated to provide one set of objects per turbine and gate to be included in the joint control. Compare also with the HWCL logical node, which can be used to control a single object.

DO.name: FlwMax
DO.desc: Maximum flow through the controlled object (gate or turbine)

DO.name: FlwMin
DO.desc: Minimum flow through the controlled object

DO.name: FlwLevAlm
DO.desc: Flow and level control settings in conflict

DO.name: TotFlwMinLim
DO.desc: Minimum flow limit (Minimum allowed flow) - can be 0.

DO.name: FlwMaxLim
DO.desc: Maximum allowed flow through the controlled object

DO.name: FlwMinLim
DO.desc: Minimum allowed flow through the controlled object

DO.name: ClcFlw
DO.desc: Calculated water flow through the controlled object (gate or turbine)

DO.name: ClcNhd
DO.desc: Calculated net head (distance between upper and lower water levels)

DO.name: ClcTotFlw
DO.desc: Calculated total water flow through the plant

DO.name: PosChg
DO.desc: Change position of gate{inst} (stop - raise - lower)

DO.name: HdrCtlMod
DO.desc: To indicate the control mode of the function

DO.name: JCtlTag
DO.desc: Joint control maintenance tag affixed to the equipement

DO.name: UntTag
DO.desc: Maintenance tag affixed to the unit {inst}

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HLKG shall be used to represent a leakage supervision system for any purpose.

Logical node HLVL shall be used to represent a water level indicator. The principles of measurement might vary, but the level will normally be given with an accuracy of 0,01 m. In order to compare different level measurements above and below the plant, an offset from a base level is added to the local measurement. The water level measurement is a typical example of situation where substitution of the measured value is commonly used, the measurement device is often blocked from operation e.g. by ice. For a simple level measurement of e.g. a tank, where the level can be expressed as a percentage of full tank, the TLVL logical node should be used instead of HLVL.

DO.name: Stuck
DO.desc: Device is blocked through external influence

DO.name: LevOfs
DO.desc: Offset from power plant base level

DO.name: LevM
DO.desc: Water level at the point of measuring (including offset if given)[m]

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HMBR shall be used to represent the physical device brake. The brake is used to stop the rotation of the shaft during power down of the unit.

DO.name: OpRs
DO.desc: Reset a previous issued Operate command

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HNDL shall be used to represent the control of turbine needles for Pelton type turbines.

DO.name: AOfsCam
DO.desc: A-servo offset CAM function is activated

DO.name: NdlMan
DO.desc: Manual selection of number of needles is active

DO.name: NdlErr
DO.desc: Servo loop fault, Pelton turbine needle (needle number returned)

DO.name: NdlAct
DO.desc: Indication of which needles{inst} are active

DO.name: NdlOpTmh
DO.desc: Accumulated operation time of each needle{inst}

DO.name: Flw
DO.desc: Water flow through the controlled object (m3/s)

DO.name: FlwPct
DO.desc: Water flow through the controlled object (% of rated flow )

DO.name: NdlManNum
DO.desc: Manual number of needles, when in manual needle control

DO.name: NdlAutSel
DO.desc: Auto selection of number of active needles, select

DO.name: NdlManSel
DO.desc: Manual selection of number of active needles, select

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HNHD shall be used to represent a function that calculates and presents net head data and some related information. The input measured values will in most cases be derived from logical nodes of class HLVL. Separate logical nodes of HNHD class shall be used depending on the purpose of the net head value. The value used for control of a turbine will normally be based on measurements taken inside the intake gate and at the tail-race outlet. If a net head value is to be used for general water control, the measurements are taken at some distance from the power plant, both upstream and downstream.

DO.name: Stuck
DO.desc: Device is blocked through external influence

DO.name: LevOfs
DO.desc: Offset from power plant base level

DO.name: DifPres
DO.desc: Calculated Differential water pressure across trashrack

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HOTP shall be used to represent an over-topping protection for the dam. The normal action of the protection, when engaged, is to open one or more gates to full open position. One instance should be provided for each gate that is to be controlled.

DO.name: RsDlTmm
DO.desc: Reset Operate delay time in minutes

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HRES shall be used to represent the functional aspect of the reservoir in a hydropower plant. The HRES logical node does not represent the physical aspect of the dam.

DO.name: RegLevHi
DO.desc: Highest level during normal regulation mode

DO.name: RegLevLo
DO.desc: Lowest level during normal regulation mode

DO.name: VlmCrv
DO.desc: Curve to define relation between level and volume

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HSEQ shall be used to represent actions of the unit sequencer. The logical node HSEQ should be instantiated for each dedicated sequence (e.g. start, stop, etc.). It will be part of the unit controller logical device.

Logical node HSPD shall normally be part of a stand-alone logical device. It may act as a protective backup of the governor frequency control, but mainly as a placeholder for various speed limits and set-points used by the start sequencer and other functions.

DO.name: SpdLub
DO.desc: Point of operation{inst} for lubrication system

DO.name: SpdLft
DO.desc: Point of operation{inst} for lift pump (high pressure oil system)

DO.name: SpdRb
DO.desc: speed at which runner blades at start angle is reached

DO.name: SpdExt
DO.desc: Point of operation for excitation system breaker

LNodeType.Details: This logical node is used to represent a surge shaft. The surge shaft is a protection device mainly used against water-hammer effect. It behaves as a free surface for wave reflection where the water level is a function of the discharge time history. If its cross-section area is relatively small, it is usually called surge tank. This logical node can also represent air vessels. Air vessels are used for mitigating pressure fluctuations induced in hydraulic systems by pumps, vortex shedding, valves, etc. Most of the measured section data objects can be logically estimated if the parameters of the settings sections are known. Levels and heads are more comprehensive when equally referenced.

DO.name: TnkArea
DO.desc: Surge tank cross section area at the elevation TnkLev

DO.name: HdrTnkTyp
DO.desc: Surge Tank type (0=Surge Tank; 1=Surge Shaft; 2=Air Vessel)

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HTGV shall be used to represent the physical device of guide vanes (wicket gate) related to a hydropower turbine. In case of individually controlled guide vanes, it is possible to instantiate the data objects for each guide vane.

DO.name: PosSNLSet
DO.desc: Gate in speed no load position setting

DO.name: PosPct
DO.desc: Position {inst} as percent of full opening [%]

DO.name: SMPres
DO.desc: Servo motor pressure to move the guide vane {inst} [mPa]

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HTRB shall be used to represent the physical device of runner blades of a Kaplan type turbine where runner blades positions can be can be measured. If required, some data objects may be instantiated to provide separate data objects for each runner blade.
Logical node HTRK shall be used to represent the physical device of a trash rack.

Logical node HTUR shall be used to represent the physical device of a turbine in a hydropower plant. The logical node serves as an extended rating plate only, for any operational status and runtime information, the logical node HUNT shall be used.

DO.name: RotDirPmp
DO.desc: Direction of rotation in pump mode - if different from RotDir (Clockwise | Counter-clockwise | Unknown)

DO.name: TrbTyp
DO.desc: Turbine type (Francis, Helice, Kaplan, Pelton, Pump-Turbine)

DO.name: NhdRtgTrb
DO.desc: Rated net head in turbine mode [m]

DO.name: NhdRtgPmp
DO.desc: Rated net head in pump mode [m]

DO.name: ShftPres
DO.desc: Shaft seal water input rated pressure [Pa]

DO.name: ShftFlw
DO.desc: Shaft seal water input rated flow [m3/s]

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HUNT shall be used to represent the physical device of a hydropower production unit, that is, a generator and turbine combination with control equipment. It can be seen as an extended name-plate, which allows temporary settings of data. The logical node holds information about the present operational status of the unit. The logical node is also used to receive commands to change operating status of the unit.

DO.name: Iner
DO.desc: Inertia of the unit (sum of turbine and generator inertia) [kgm2]

DO.name: UntOpSt
DO.desc: Status of the unit (numbers above 20 are free for user specific requests).

DO.name: GridMod
DO.desc: Grid mode e.g. the actual grid the unit meets when CB synchronises to the grid.

DO.name: GridOpSt
DO.desc: Grid operational status, i.e. if there is a disturbance or not

DO.name: MaxFlwRtg
DO.desc: Rated maximum water flow per unit [m3/s]

DO.name: ReqSt
DO.desc: Requested state from operator (numbers above 20 are free for user specific requests)

DO.name: StepOp
DO.desc: Step by step operation of sequencer

DO.name: Tag
DO.desc: Maintenance tag affixed to the device

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HVLV shall be used to represent e.g. a valve in the penstock. For calculation of water flow, a FCSD logical node that holds the relation between water level, opening and flow, should be included in the same logical device. This LN can also be used to represent a main control valve. For a simpler type of valve, the logical node KVLV is recommended (see IEC 61850-7-4).

DO.name: PosCls
DO.desc: Closed end position reached (valve cannot move further)

DO.name: PosOpn
DO.desc: Open end position reached (valve cannot move further)

DO.name: Stuck
DO.desc: Device is blocked through external influence

DO.name: OpnLim
DO.desc: Opening limit of valve position (temporary restriction)

DO.name: Incr
DO.desc: Increment of position change for open / close commands

DO.name: SldStrPs
DO.desc: Solidity compensation start in positive direction

DO.name: SldStrNg
DO.desc: Solidity compensation start in negative direction

DO.name: Flw
DO.desc: Calculated liquid flow through the valve [m3/s]

LNodeType.Details: Logical node HWCL shall be used to represent the control of one physical device, dam gate or turbine, which can modify the water flow through the plant. Compare also with the LN for joint control (HJCL) that can be used for combined control.

DO.name: FlwLevAlm
DO.desc: Flow and level control settings in conflict

DO.name: LevHiSpt
DO.desc: Upper water (dam) high level alarm set-point

DO.name: LevLoSpt
DO.desc: Upper water (dam) low level alarm set-point

DO.name: LevDnHiSpt
DO.desc: Lower water (tailrace) high level alarm set-point

DO.name: LevDnLoSpt
DO.desc: Lower water (tailrace) low level alarm set-point

DO.name: Flw
DO.desc: Calculated water flow through the controlled object (m3/s)

DO.name: FlwPct
DO.desc: Calculated water flow (%) of rated value taken from HUNT. FlwRtg

DO.name: HdrCtlMod
DO.desc: To indicate the control mode of the function

LNodeType.Details: Logical node IFIR shall be used to represent a fire detection system. The data objects representing sensors and detection units may be instantiated in order to allow individual data from each device.
Logical node IHND shall be used to represent a local interface using e.g. push-button or any other physical device that is used to provide an action.

DO.name: Trip
DO.desc: Emergency switch trips unit or plant (1 = trip)

DO.name: CodeCmdSt
DO.desc: Codes{inst} for calls and audible alarms

LNodeType.Details: Logical node KHTR shall be used to represent a heater.

DO.name: TmpSpt
DO.desc: Temperature setpoint (in case of controllable thermostat)

DO.name: OpRs
DO.desc: Reset a previous issued Operate command {inst}

LNodeType.Details: This logical node shall be used to represent common information and settings of a field breaker.

Logical node SFLW shall be used to represent devices that supervise the media flow in a major plant object (e.g. a pipeline or tube). It provides alarm and trip/shutdown functions. If more than one sensor (LN TFLW) is connected, the LN SFLW shall be instantiated for each sensor.

DO.name: HiAct
DO.desc: Hi Start action when over activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: HiDeAct
DO.desc: Hi Stop action when overactivation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: LoAct
DO.desc: Lo Start action when under activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: LoDeAct
DO.desc: Lo Stop action when underactivation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: Act
DO.desc: Start action when over activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: HiActSpt
DO.desc: Hi Start action when activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: HiDeActSpt
DO.desc: Hi Stop action when activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: HiTripDlTm
DO.desc: Hi delay time for trip (time unit given by application) {Inst}

DO.name: LoActSpt
DO.desc: Lo Start action when activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: LoDeActSpt
DO.desc: Lo Stop action when activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: LoTripDlTm
DO.desc: Lo delay time for trip (time unit given by application) {Inst}

DO.name: ActSpt
DO.desc: Start action when activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: DeActSpt
DO.desc: Stop action when activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: TripDlTm
DO.desc: trip delay time (time unit given by application) {Inst}

LNodeType.Details: Logical node SLVL shall be used to represent devices that supervise the level of major plant objects (e.g. a tank). It provides alarm and trip/shutdown functions. If more than one sensor (LN TLVL) is connected, the LN SPOS shall be instantiated for each sensor. When instantiation of data is used, this data shall be defined in the private namespace.

DO.name: HiAct
DO.desc: Hi Start action when over activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: HiDeAct
DO.desc: Hi Stop action when under activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: LoAct
DO.desc: Lo Start action when under activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: LoDeAct
DO.desc: Lo Stop action when underactivation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: Activ
DO.desc: Start action when over activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: DeAct
DO.desc: Stop action when under activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: HiActSpt
DO.desc: Hi Start action activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: HiDeActSpt
DO.desc: Hi Stop action activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: HiTripDlTm
DO.desc: Hi delay time for trip (time unit given by application) {Inst}

DO.name: LoActSpt
DO.desc: Lo Start action when activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: LoDeActSpt
DO.desc: Lo Stop action when activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: LoTripDlTm
DO.desc: Lo delay time for trip (time unit given by application) {Inst}

DO.name: TripDlTm
DO.desc: trip delay time (time unit given by application) {Inst}

LNodeType.desc: Supervision of the position of a device
LNodeType.Details: Logical node SPOS shall be used to represent devices that supervise the position of major plant objects. It provides alarm and trip/shutdown functions. If more than one sensor (LN TPOS) is connected, the LN SPOS shall be instantiated for each sensor. When instantiation of data is used, this data shall be defined in the private namespace.

DO.name: HiAct
DO.desc: Hi Start action when over activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: HiDeAct
DO.desc: Hi Stop action when overactivation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: LoAct
DO.desc: Lo Start action when under activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: LoDeAct
DO.desc: Lo Stop action when underactivation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: Act
DO.desc: Start action when over activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: HiActSpt
DO.desc: Hi Start action activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: HiDeActSpt
DO.desc: Hi Stop action activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: HiTripDlTm
DO.desc: Hi delay time for trip (time unit given by application) {Inst}

DO.name: LoActSpt
DO.desc: Lo Start action activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: LoDeActSpt
DO.desc: Lo Stop action activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: LoTripDlTm
DO.desc: Lo delay time for trip (time unit given by application) {Inst}

DO.name: DeActSpt
DO.desc: Stop action when activation threshold {Inst} set-point

DO.name: TripDlTm
DO.desc: trip delay time (time unit given by application) {Inst}

LNodeType.Details: Logical node SPRS shall be used to represent devices that supervise the pressure in a major plant object (e.g. a tank). It provides alarm and trip/shutdown functions. If more than one sensor (LN TPRS) is connected, the LN SPRS shall be instantiated for each sensor. When instantiation of data is used, this data shall be defined in the private namespace. Pref (pref) shall, if used be either Hi or Lo to indicate if action is taken at decreasing or increasing values. Instantiation shall, if used, be indicated by numbers "1" to "9".

DO.name: HiAct
DO.desc: Hi Start action when over activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: HiDeAct
DO.desc: Hi Stop action when under activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: LoAct
DO.desc: Lo Start action when under activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: LoDeAct
DO.desc: Lo Stop action when overactivation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: Act
DO.desc: Start action when over activation threshold {Inst}

DO.name: HiActSpt
DO.desc: Hi Start action activation threshold {Inst} setting

DO.name: HiDeActSpt
DO.desc: Hi Stop action activation threshold {Inst} setting

DO.name: HiTripDlTm
DO.desc: Hi delay time for trip (time unit given by application) {Inst}

DO.name: LoActSpt
DO.desc: Lo Start action activation threshold {Inst} setting

DO.name: LoDeActSpt
DO.desc: Lo Stop action activation threshold {Inst} setting

DO.name: LoTripDlTm
DO.desc: Lo delay time for trip (time unit given by application) {Inst}

DO.name: TripDlTm
DO.desc: trip delay time (time unit given by application) {Inst}

LNodeType.Details: Logical node XFFL shall be used to represent the control of a switching equipement used for initial excitation (field flashing) of a generator.

DO.name: FaTms
DO.desc: Timing of "fire-all sequence" before field flashing is started [s]

DO.name: FlshMaxTms
DO.desc: Maximum time of field flashing to reach "VolSynOf" [s]

DO.name: RptDlTms
DO.desc: Delay time between repetition of an action [s]

EnumType.EnumVal: Upper water level set-point control mode
Generator running (speed no load, not excited)
Launching mode (back-to-back start of another unit)
Disturbed (abnormal frequency and / or voltage level)
Prepared for start in generating mode
Prepared for start in pump mode
Double AC infeed breaker and DC breaker
DC breaker with separate DC breaker for emergency excitation
